original: des khyab byed nges pa yin te /🔽khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba de ltar nges pa ni /
analyzed: des khyab byed nges pa yin te / khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba de ltar nges pa ni /
translated: It is the ascertainment of the pervader.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin //
translated: The ascertainment of the pervader is the nature of the object of understanding.

original: de'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “Its property, etc.”

original: chos can gyi chos go bar bya ba ci 'dra zhig ce na ;
analyzed: chos can gyi chos go bar bya ba ci 'dra zhig ce na ;
translated: What is the nature of the object of illumination, which is the property of the subject?

original: go bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i khyab par byed pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i khyab par byed pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: It is ascertained as the pervader of that which is to be comprehended.

original: ji ltar na khyab par byed pa nyid du nges pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na khyab par byed pa nyid du nges pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: How is it ascertained as the pervader?

original: de'i chos su nges pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i chos su nges pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because it is ascertained as the property of that.”

original: go bar byed pa de'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du nges pa ni de'i chos su nges pa ste /
analyzed: go bar byed pa de'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du nges pa ni de'i chos su nges pa ste /
translated: The nature of the property of that which is to be comprehended is ascertained as the nature of the property of that which is to be comprehended.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The proof is ascertained as the nature of the probandum.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni rjes su 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i ngo bo bshad nas /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni rjes su 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i ngo bo bshad nas /
translated: This much explains the nature of the pervasion and that which pervades.

original: ldog pa dang ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo ni 'di ldog pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa las /
analyzed: ldog pa dang ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo ni 'di ldog pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa las /
translated: The nature of the counter-pervasion and that which counter-pervades is stated by “when this is counter-pervading.”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa'i chos te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa'i chos te /
translated: This means the pervading property.

original: bdag nyid log pa @220b yod na khyab par bya ba de ldog par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag nyid log pa @220b yod na khyab par bya ba de ldog par byed pa yin na /
translated: When the self is counter-pervading, the pervaded is counter-pervaded.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: He explains this with “the very nature of the pervader,” and so on.

original: khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid ldog par gyur pa na /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid ldog par gyur pa na /
translated: When the very nature of the pervader is reversed,

original: khyad par bya ba de ldog par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par bya ba de ldog par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: then the predicate is reversed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir gal te khyad par byed pa 'di med na khyab par byed pa mi 'byung ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te khyad par byed pa 'di med na khyab par byed pa mi 'byung ba de ltar na /
translated: Because if the predicate were absent, the pervader would not occur.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di ni 'di'i khyab par byed pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di ni 'di'i khyab par byed pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the predicate would be established as the pervader of this.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: “ Therefore” is a statement of proximity.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i ngo bo dang / ldog par byed pa'i ngo bor rab tu bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i ngo bo dang / ldog par byed pa'i ngo bor rab tu bstan pas so //
translated: “ By this” refers to the just-explained nature of the forward pervasion and the nature of the reverse pervasion.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis kyang zhes bya ba chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa nyid can te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis kyang zhes bya ba chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa nyid can te /
translated: “ The two types of proof statements” are those that share a predicate and those that do not share a predicate.

original: go rims bzhin du go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: They are defined as causes of understanding, respectively.🔽

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid du bshad par rig par bya'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid du bshad par rig par bya'o / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: One should understand that these are explained as the characteristics of the probandum and the probans, respectively.

original: sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis po de nyid ni sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis po de nyid ni sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The two kinds of application are mentioned in “the two kinds of application” and so on.

original: gang gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //🔽chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can yin la /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o // chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can yin la /
translated: “Others” refers to reasoning.🔽Application that has a similar property is a positive concomitance.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can yang ldog pa can yin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can yang ldog pa can yin no //
translated: Application that has a dissimilar property is a negative concomitance.

original: de dag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren’t positive and negative concomitances established by positive and negative concomitance?

original: gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ldog pa med pa mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa 'ba' zhig yin te /
analyzed: gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ldog pa med pa mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa 'ba' zhig yin te /
translated: That which does not have a dissimilar property because there is no dissimilar class only exists in a similar class.

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba can la /
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba can la /
translated: That is a positive concomitance.

original: gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gcig tu ldog pa yod pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa can ni ldog pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gcig tu ldog pa yod pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa can ni ldog pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: That which has a pervasion from the presence of the property to be established to the presence of the reason is called “having a positive pervasion.” That which has a pervasion from the absence of the property to be established to the absence of the reason is called “having a negative pervasion.”

original: rnam par gzhag pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: The classification is correct.

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But such a classification is not reasonable,

original: ldog pa med par rjes su 'gro ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med par rjes su 'gro ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to have a pervasion from the presence of the reason to the absence of the property to be established, nor a pervasion from the absence of the property to be established to the absence of the reason.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all reasons have both a positive pervasion and a negative pervasion.🔽But because of the difference in the formulation, one is called “having a positive pervasion” and the other “having a negative pervasion.”

original: 'on kyang sbyor ba'i bye brag las rjes su 'gro ba can dang / ldog pa can zhes brjod pa de ltar na dngos po'i dbang gis kyang khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyor ba'i bye brag las rjes su 'gro ba can dang / ldog pa can zhes brjod pa de ltar na dngos po'i dbang gis kyang khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should accept them on the basis of the nature of the thing itself.

original: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove just that, he says,

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: “because of the difference in the formulation,” and so on.

original: 'di gnyis la zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can dang ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs @221a * //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can dang ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs @221a * //
translated: These two are called “reasons having the property of forward pervasion” and “reasons having the property of counter-pervasion.”

original: dag la don du ste /
analyzed: dag la don du ste /
translated: They are so called in terms of their meaning.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid du bye brag cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid du bye brag cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not the slightest difference in their nature.

original: gnyi ga dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because both have the property of forward pervasion and counter-pervasion.

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the difference in the application.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag la 'ga' zhig tu rjes su 'gro ba nyid can gyi sbyor bas ston par byed la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag la 'ga' zhig tu rjes su 'gro ba nyid can gyi sbyor bas ston par byed la /
translated: In some cases, the application of the reason having the property of forward pervasion is demonstrated by the property of forward pervasion.🔽In some cases, the application of the reason having the property of counter-pervasion is demonstrated by the property of counter-pervasion.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba sbyor ba tsam tha dad pa yin na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba sbyor ba tsam tha dad pa yin na //
translated: The difference is only in the application.

original: gal te chos mthun ba nyid can gyi sbyor ba la chos mthun pa nyid dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid can la chos nyid mi mthun pa nyid can rtogs par 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: gal te chos mthun ba nyid can gyi sbyor ba la chos mthun pa nyid dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid can la chos nyid mi mthun pa nyid can rtogs par 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: If the application of the reason having the property of similarity is understood by the property of similarity, and the application of the reason having the property of dissimilarity is understood by the property of dissimilarity,

original: don gyi bye brag kyang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi bye brag kyang yod do zhe na /
translated: then there is also a difference in meaning.

original: de ni med de gang gi phyir chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang /
analyzed: de ni med de gang gi phyir chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang /
translated: That is not so. Because in the case of a syllogism that has a similar instance,

original: don gyis te shugs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don gyis te shugs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the contraposition of the reason from the dissimilar instance is understood by implication, that is, indirectly, from the probandum.

original: nus pa de nyid de med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: nus pa de nyid de med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that capacity, he says, “If that does not exist, etc.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can te /
translated: “That” refers to the dissimilar instance.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa med na mi 'byung ba de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa med na mi 'byung ba de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the reason is not produced without the probandum, then it is a reason that possesses the probandum.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la /
translated: Similarly, in the case of a syllogism that has a dissimilar instance,

original: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: “that” refers to the positive concomitance.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs la khyab par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs la khyab par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: If the probandum pervades the reason, then

original: de log pas de ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log pas de ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: the reversal of that is the reversal of the reason.

original: ldog pa'i gtan tshigs de dag dpyad pa yang rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i gtan tshigs de dag dpyad pa yang rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The analysis of the logical mark of negation will be explained extensively later.

original: dper na mi rtag pa nyid la byas pa'am zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa kho na byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa nyid la byas pa'am zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa kho na byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, “like what is produced” means that impermanence itself is what is produced.

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba can gyi dpe brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba can gyi dpe brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the positive example.

original: 'jig pa med pa la byas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa la byas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Like what is not destroyed” means

original: 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa ni 'jig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa ni 'jig pa med pa ste /
translated: that which is not destroyed is not destroyed.

original: de bas na 'jig pa med pa 'jig pa med pa'i ngo bo yod na ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig pa med pa 'jig pa med pa'i ngo bo yod na ma byas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, if what is not destroyed, that is, the nature of what is not destroyed, exists, then it is not produced.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the meaning of “it is not an effect.”

original: de ni ldog pa can gyi dpe brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ldog pa can gyi dpe brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the negative example.

original: de nyid ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: This very point is stated by the passage beginning with “By these two” and ending with “it is not an effect.”

original: 'di gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi'o //
translated: “By these two” means by the positive and negative examples.

original: gang cung zad ces bya ba ni thams cad bsdus nas khyab pa brjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad ces bya ba ni thams cad bsdus nas khyab pa brjod par byed pa'o //
translated: “Whatever” is used to include everything and express the pervasion.

original: de bas na don gyis byas pa nyid ni rtag pa nyid las ldog pa yin no zhes ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na don gyis byas pa nyid ni rtag pa nyid las ldog pa yin no zhes ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “impermanent” is understood as the opposite of “permanent.”

original: gal te cung zad kyang rtag par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na @221b byas pa ni mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te cung zad kyang rtag par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na @221b byas pa ni mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If nothing is permanent, then what is produced is impermanent.

original: gal te gang rtag pa nyid med pa de las ldog pa yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te gang rtag pa nyid med pa de las ldog pa yod ce na /
translated: If there is an opposite of that which is not permanent,

original: de'i the tshom nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i the tshom nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then that would not be a doubt,

original: de med pas de la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas de la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without that, there would be no engagement with it.

original: sgra yang byas pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa'o //
translated: “Sound is also produced” expresses the property of the subject.

original: ci'i phyir phyogs ma bstan ces dogs pa la byas pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyogs ma bstan ces dogs pa la byas pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Fearing that the subject has not been stated, he says “because of being produced,” and so on.

original: sgra yang byas pa nyid du brjod pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe /
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa nyid du brjod pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe /
translated: “Sound is also expressed as produced” means that

original: sgra la byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa brjod pa na /
analyzed: sgra la byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa brjod pa na /
translated: When one states that being produced is pervaded by impermanence,

original: de la nges par bdag nyid khyab par byed pa yin par nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la nges par bdag nyid khyab par byed pa yin par nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because of the necessity of positing the pervader itself,

original: shugs nyid las sgra mi rtag ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs nyid las sgra mi rtag ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is just by implication that one says “sound is impermanent.”

original: de bas na 'dir gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, here, in the statement “without a doubt,”

original: gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: one should supply “it is not to be shown.”

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la'o //
translated: Here means in the case of a syllogism that has a similar instance.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni ldog pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo med pa la byas pa nyid med de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni ldog pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo med pa la byas pa nyid med de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the case of a syllogism that has a dissimilar instance, the statement “the reversal” and so forth.🔽One should supply “that which does not have the nature of impermanence does not have being produced.”

original: de yang 'jig pa med pa la ma byas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig pa med pa la ma byas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: This is explained as “that which is not destroyed is not produced.”

original: sgra yang byas pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa'o //
translated: “Sound is also a product” expresses the property of the subject.

original: 'dir yang dam bcas pa'i tshig ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dam bcas pa'i tshig ma byas pa yin te /
translated: Here, the statement of the thesis is not a product.

original: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin nyid du grub pa yin te zhes bya bar mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin nyid du grub pa yin te zhes bya bar mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ste /
translated: Because it is established as having the nature of that, i.e., impermanence,

original: rgyur gyur ba nyid du grub pa yin no //🔽de med na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyur gyur ba nyid du grub pa yin no // de med na zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is established as having the nature of a product.

original: mi rtag pa nyid med par 'gyur na byas pa nyid mi 'byung bas sgra la yod pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med par 'gyur na byas pa nyid mi 'byung bas sgra la yod pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
translated: “Without that” means that if impermanence did not exist, a product would not occur. Therefore, it is shown that sound exists.

original: sgra yang byas pa yin pas zhes bya ba nyid du brjod par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa yin pas zhes bya ba nyid du brjod par byas pa yin no //
translated: “Sound is also a product” expresses the property of the subject.

original: de'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin byas pa sgra la yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin byas pa sgra la yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas /
translated: “The existence of that nature” means that the nature of impermanence, i.e., being a product, exists in sound.

original: shugs kyis sgra mi rtag ces bya bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shugs kyis sgra mi rtag ces bya bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is established by implication, sound is impermanent.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: “As before” means like the syllogism that has a similar property.

original: mi rtag pa nyid med pa la byas pa nyid med de zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la chos mi mthun pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med pa la byas pa nyid med de zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la chos mi mthun pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In the syllogism “If there is no impermanence, there is no being made,” isn’t the mere dissimilar property shown to have no pervasion?

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Pervasion . . . ” and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par chos mi mthun pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par chos mi mthun pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Without pervasion, a dissimilar property is not tenable.

original: de nyid ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: He demonstrates just that with “The ascertainment of not having that nature . . . ” and so on.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nges pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nges pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “The ascertainment of not having that nature” means

original: @222a * // mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid la rag lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @222a * // mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid la rag lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: not depending on the nature of impermanence.

original: de log pa na zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid du nges pa nyid de log pa na ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de log pa na zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid du nges pa nyid de log pa na ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “When that is reversed” means when the ascertainment of the nature of impermanence is reversed, it is reversed.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir nges pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir nges pa ste /
translated: Because it is so, therefore it is certain.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa tshad mas rab tu bsgrubs pas bsgrub par bya ba log pas gtan tshigs ldog pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa tshad mas rab tu bsgrubs pas bsgrub par bya ba log pas gtan tshigs ldog pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because that is so, therefore, the reversal of the reason should be stated due to the reversal of the probandum, by means of ascertaining it.

original: gal te nges par rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba log pas ldog pa brjod pa yin nam /🔽tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par bsgrubs na ldog pa'i tshig don med pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nges par rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba log pas ldog pa brjod pa yin nam / tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par bsgrubs na ldog pa'i tshig don med pa'am /
translated: If the reversal is stated due to ascertaining the probandum,🔽then if it is ascertained by another valid cognition, the statement of the reversal is pointless.

original: ji ltar nges pa khong du chud pa na de log pa na de ldog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa khong du chud pa na de log pa na de ldog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Or, if it is understood that it is ascertained, then even if the probandum is reversed, the reason is not reversed.

original: gang gi nges par rab tu bsgrubs nas phyis ldog pa ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi nges par rab tu bsgrubs nas phyis ldog pa ston par byed ce na /
translated: Having ascertained it, how could one later demonstrate its reversal?

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig smras pa gang yin pa de re zhig brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig smras pa gang yin pa de re zhig brjod par bya ste //
translated: Here, what was said by someone should be stated.

original: nges par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ldog pa brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ldog pa brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the reversal is stated for the sake of demonstrating the ascertainment.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i tshig ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa ldog pa'i don yin gyi nges 'brel pa brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i tshig ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa ldog pa'i don yin gyi nges 'brel pa brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the word “only” is for the purpose of precluding the doubt that the reason applies to the dissimilar class, it does not express a necessary connection.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa ni sgra la khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa ni sgra la khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum is understood from the word “only.”

original: de'i bdag nyid kyang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyang gzhan yin la /
translated: The identity of the reason with the probandum is one thing,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid kyang gzhan nyid yin na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid kyang gzhan nyid yin na /
translated: and the absence of the reason in the dissimilar class is another.

original: gang mi mkhas pa 'ga' zhig de'i bdag nyid bstan du zin kyang ;
analyzed: gang mi mkhas pa 'ga' zhig de'i bdag nyid bstan du zin kyang ;
translated: So, even if someone were to teach the identity of the reason with the probandum,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang / med pa nyid dran pa ni yod de /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang / med pa nyid dran pa ni yod de /
translated: he would still have to be reminded of the presence and absence of the reason in the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du /
translated: In this regard, it should be said:

original: gang gi phyir tshad mas mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid du byas ba grub pa'i phyir de log pa na de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad mas mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid du byas ba grub pa'i phyir de log pa na de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Because the impermanent is established as the nature of the product, when the former is absent, the latter is absent.”

original: gal te grub na zhes bya ba ni nges par grub pa'i dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi ldog pa grub pa na ste /
analyzed: gal te grub na zhes bya ba ni nges par grub pa'i dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi ldog pa grub pa na ste /
translated: If it is established, that is, if the exclusion is established after the time of the establishment of the predicate,

original: de'i bdag nyid nges pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid nges pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the ascertainment of its nature is the existence of the predicate in only the similar instances.

original: don gyis bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyis bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the meaning is indicated, that is, because the existence of the predicate is not nonexistent.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de /🔽bsgrub par bya ba kho na la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de / bsgrub par bya ba kho na la /
translated: Others explain it differently.

original: sgrub par byed pa yod pa nges pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yod pa nges pa ste /
translated: The existence of the proof is ascertained only in the probandum.

original: rab tu sgrub pa'i sgra yang don gyis 'phangs pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rab tu sgrub pa'i sgra yang don gyis 'phangs pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word “establishes” also is a word that indicates the meaning by implication.

original: de bas na de'i phyir nges par rab tu bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de'i phyir nges par rab tu bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this: “Therefore, the ascertainment is established.

original: nges pa'i don gyis 'phangs nas ldog pa brjod par bya'o zhes don 'di yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis 'phangs nas ldog pa brjod par bya'o zhes don 'di yin no //
translated: Having indicated the meaning by implication, the exclusion should be stated.”

original: de ltar gyur pa'i tshig gis ldog par brjod par bya ba gang yin pa'i shugs las nges par 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i tshig gis ldog par brjod par bya ba gang yin pa'i shugs las nges par 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the exclusion is stated by the words, and the ascertainment is indicated by implication.

original: de @222b nyid kyi phyir gal te de zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: de @222b nyid kyi phyir gal te de zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, if it is said “that,”

original: de zhes bya ba ni nges pa 'phen par byed pa'i ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nges pa 'phen par byed pa'i ldog pa'o //
translated: “that” is the exclusion that impels ascertainment.

original: grub pa na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la de lta bur gyur pa'i tshig gis ston pa na'o //
analyzed: grub pa na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la de lta bur gyur pa'i tshig gis ston pa na'o //
translated: “ When established” means when it is taught to another by a statement that is like that.

original: de'i bdag nyid du nges pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du nges pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment of the nature of that is ascertainment of the nature of the probandum.

original: don gyis te bshad pa'i shugs kyis te 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis te bshad pa'i shugs kyis te 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: It is implied by the meaning, that is, by the force of the explanation.

original: phyir ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: phyir ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: “ Because” is the reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba grub pa yin no //
translated: The pervasion is established.

original: gzhan gyis da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Another says, “Now, how?” and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni byas pa ni dus gzhan du gnas pa dang nges par 'jig par 'dod pa de bas na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni byas pa ni dus gzhan du gnas pa dang nges par 'jig par 'dod pa de bas na /
translated: Others assert that the produced endures for another moment and definitely disintegrates. Therefore,

original: byas pa ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyis gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa yin zhes ji ltar khong du chung par bya /
analyzed: byas pa ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyis gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa yin zhes ji ltar khong du chung par bya /
translated: how should one understand that the produced is definitely impermanent because it disintegrates immediately upon arising?

original: dus gzhan du gnas nas 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas nas 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why wouldn’t it be that it is destroyed in another place at another time?

original: gang gis de skad du brjod par bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis de skad du brjod par bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the meaning of “by what”?

original: byas pa thams cad skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa thams cad skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said that all that is produced is destroyed immediately upon arising.

original: 'di ltar byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid grub pa na yang bla ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid grub pa na yang bla ste /
translated: It is fine that impermanence is established because of being produced.

original: skad cig ma ni ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dri ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dri ba'i don yin no //
translated: But momentariness is not established. This is the meaning of the question.

original: lan 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: lan 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The answer is “Because of being produced, etc.”

original: rang bzhin yin phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin yin phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: “Because of being produced” means

original: rang nyid byas pa'i ngo bor byung zhing skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'brel ba nyid byas pa'i rang bzhin grub pa yod na /
analyzed: rang nyid byas pa'i ngo bor byung zhing skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'brel ba nyid byas pa'i rang bzhin grub pa yod na /
translated: because it arises and is produced as the nature of what is produced. If the nature of being produced is established,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: then the nature of impermanence is established. This is the meaning.

original: / de bas na byas pa ni mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: / de bas na byas pa ni mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is produced is impermanent.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: rgyu min phyir te gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las gzhan pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu min phyir te gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las gzhan pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not a cause, because the cause of destruction is not different from the cause of origination, therefore it is related to intrinsic nature.

original: de nyid ni dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says just that in “because of the nature of things, etc.”

original: de'i ngo bo ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of impermanence.

original: 'on te de dag gi de'i rang bzhin nyid gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi de'i rang bzhin nyid gang las yin zhe na /
translated: But how is that their intrinsic nature?

original: rang gi rgyu nyid las zhes bya ba smos te /🔽skyed par byed ba'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu nyid las zhes bya ba smos te / skyed par byed ba'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: He says, “because of their own cause.”

original: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin dag tu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin dag tu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the cause of origination, they are born with the nature of destruction, with the nature of impermanence.

original: des kyang / rang bzhin yin phyir rjes 'brel nyid //
analyzed: des kyang / rang bzhin yin phyir rjes 'brel nyid //
translated: Therefore, he says, “because of intrinsic nature, there is relatedness.”

original: ces bya ba 'di rnam par 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di rnam par 'brel ba'o //
translated: This is the connection.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Because of that, he says, “therefore, etc.”

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: “By nature” means by intrinsic nature.

original: gal te rgyu dang bcas pa 'jig pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang bcas pa 'jig pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: If destruction is with a cause, then

original: gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba can du mi 'gyur ba de bas na de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dngos po ltos dang bcas rnams ni //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba can du mi 'gyur ba de bas na de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / dngos po ltos dang bcas rnams ni //
translated: it would not necessarily be a transformation. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that,

original: zhes bya ba la @223a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @223a * //
translated: he says, “Things that are dependent”🔽and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pa la ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa la ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: “ And so on” means “because.”

original: dngos po ltos dang bcas rnams ni //
analyzed: dngos po ltos dang bcas rnams ni //
translated: Things that are dependent

original: nges par 'gyur ba can mi mthong //
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba can mi mthong //
translated: are not seen to be permanent.

original: de phyir dngos po 'jig pa ni yang ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po 'jig pa ni yang ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, the destruction of things is by nature not dependent on another.

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” has the meaning of restriction.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'chad pa la /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'chad pa la /
translated: “ If they are dependent” and so on explains the meaning of the verse.

original: 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Some would be permanent,

original: gang dag gis 'jig pa rgyu thag nye ba na med pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig pa rgyu thag nye ba na med pa'i'o //
translated: because their destruction would not be due to the proximity of a cause.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig tu yang thag nye ba na med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig tu yang thag nye ba na med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because there are many causes of destruction, they are not always near,

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains: Because of what?

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of that is the cause of destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu de dag rnams kyang gdon mi za bar thag nye ba ma yin pas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu de dag rnams kyang gdon mi za bar thag nye ba ma yin pas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Those causes of destruction are not necessarily near.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi rkyen la ltos pa thag nye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi rkyen la ltos pa thag nye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are near, in that they depend on their own conditions.

original: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa thag nye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'jig pa'i rgyu rnams kyi rgyu dag ni thams cad du thag nye ba dag ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa thag nye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams kyi rgyu dag ni thams cad du thag nye ba dag ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: Because they are near, in that they depend on their own causes.🔽The causes of the causes of destruction are not always near.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu thag nye ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu thag nye ba ma yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, because the causes of destruction are not near,

original: 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nothing would be destroyed.

original: rgyu nye ba ni yod du zin kyang nges par 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nye ba ni yod du zin kyang nges par 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the cause is present, there is no certainty of destruction.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dag ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dag ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: For, the causes do not necessarily possess the effect.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They possess the effect called “destruction.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma tshang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma tshang ba ni lhan cig byed pa nye ba can med pa dang / gags byed pa ni 'gal ba nye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma tshang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma tshang ba ni lhan cig byed pa nye ba can med pa dang / gags byed pa ni 'gal ba nye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Because of incompleteness, etc.” Incompleteness is the absence of the presence of the cooperating causes. Obstruction is the presence of the opposing causes.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis /
translated: Therefore, because of the necessity of dependence, there is no destruction.

original: 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that it is a mistake.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni thams cad dag ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni thams cad dag ste /
translated: All are causes of destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag rtags nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag rtags nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Those that are causes of destruction are taught as the very signs of impermanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bzhag med pa'i phyir te 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bzhag med pa'i phyir te 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no effect of destruction, because it is not certain that an effect of the nature of destruction would arise from a cause of destruction.

original: rgol ba gang dag la 'di thal bar 'gyur ba de dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgol ba gang dag la 'di thal bar 'gyur ba de dag yin zhe na /
translated: To which opponents does this reductio apply?

original: 'jig pa rgyu ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Those who maintain that destruction is caused, etc.”

original: 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba gang yin pa de rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba gang yin pa de rnams la'o //
translated: It applies to those who maintain that destruction is caused.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud ba yin no //
translated: The conclusion is stated by “Therefore, etc.”

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: 'jig pa la rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽byas pa'i ngo bo 'di de'i ngo bo la ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa la rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir / byas pa'i ngo bo 'di de'i ngo bo la ste /
translated: Because destruction is causeless,🔽this nature of the produced is not dependent on that nature,

original: 'jig pa'i ngo bo la ltos pa med pa @223b can te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngo bo la ltos pa med pa @223b can te /
translated: that is, on the nature of destruction.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: This indicates the reason.

original: de'i ngo bo la nges pa ni 'jig pa'i ngo bo la nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la nges pa ni 'jig pa'i ngo bo la nges pa yin te /
translated: “Its nature is ascertained” means that the nature of destruction is ascertained.

original: 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras ba'o //
translated: This is the effect of the proof.

original: tshogs pa'i tha ma gang las gags byed pa mi srid pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i tha ma gang las gags byed pa mi srid pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the last of the collection, from which obstruction is impossible, is so called.

original: gags byed pa can mi srid pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gags byed pa can mi srid pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the impossibility of obstruction?

original: rgyu ma lus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu ma lus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is called “the complete cause.”

original: lhan cig byed pa dag gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dag gyur pa ste /
translated: The complete assemblage of the cooperating causes

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the complete, is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni dpe bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dpe bstan to //
translated: This shows the example.

original: sbyor ba ni ngo bo gang ltos pa med pa de dag ni de'i ngo bo la nges pa dag yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni ngo bo gang ltos pa med pa de dag ni de'i ngo bo la nges pa dag yin te /
translated: The application is: Those entities which are independent are ascertained in their nature.

original: dper na rgyu'i tshogs la 'bras bu bskyed pa la gags byed pa can mi srid pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i tshogs la 'bras bu bskyed pa la gags byed pa can mi srid pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the assemblage of causes, the production of the effect is impossible to obstruct.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med par byas pa'i ngo bo yang mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med par byas pa'i ngo bo yang mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The entity which is made independent of another is impermanent. This is a natural inference.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ma nges par gyur pa dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ma nges par gyur pa dogs pa ste /
translated: The statement “some . . . ” and so on expresses the doubt that it is not ascertained.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la ltos pa mad du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la ltos pa mad du zin kyang /
translated: Even though some effect is dependent,

original: gdon mi za bar de'i ngo bo med pa zhes bya ba gang la ltos pa de'i ngo bo la nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de'i ngo bo med pa zhes bya ba gang la ltos pa de'i ngo bo la nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that without doubt, that which is dependent on the non-existence of its entity does not have a definite entity.

original: de dag kyang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhe na /
translated: If they say that they are,

original: sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “the earth, etc.,” and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na ltos pa med pa de lta bu yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na ltos pa med pa de lta bu yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are like that, i.e., independent in producing their effect,

original: gags byed pa'i dus 'ga' zhig tu myu gu mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gags byed pa'i dus 'ga' zhig tu myu gu mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: at some time when there is an obstruction, they do not produce the sprout.

original: de yang rgyun la gcig nyid du nges par byas nas smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyun la gcig nyid du nges par byas nas smra ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, he speaks having ascertained that they are one in the continuum.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni len 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni len 'debs par byed de /
translated: “No, etc.” is the response.

original: de la ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs pa la ma ngos pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs pa la ma ngos pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There, the collection as explained does not exist without a basis,

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa ni rgyun gyur pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa ni rgyun gyur pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the production of the effect is dependent on the transformation of the continuum.

original: de bas na ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de ni de la 'jug pa ma yin na //
analyzed: de bas na ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de ni de la 'jug pa ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, the reason, “because of independence,” does not apply to that.

original: 'jig pa la byas pa yod du zin kyang dus gzhan la ltos pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa la byas pa yod du zin kyang dus gzhan la ltos pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if there were an action in regard to destruction, it would be dependent on another time. Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, he says, “In this way, etc.”

original: byas pa'i ngo bo 'jig pa la 'ga' zhig tu ste /
analyzed: byas pa'i ngo bo 'jig pa la 'ga' zhig tu ste /
translated: The nature of the produced is destruction, in some cases,

original: dus gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin no //
translated: without dependence on another time.

original: gal te gyur na ni rang gi ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gyur na ni rang gi ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then, like the previous, the later would not be destroyed, since there would be no difference in their natures.

original: sa dang sa bon la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: sa dang sa bon la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na /
translated: If earth, seed, etc., were the same in their natures,

original: gang las de dag rgyun gyur pa la ltos pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gang las de dag rgyun gyur pa la ltos pa nyid yin /
translated: from what would their transformation depend?

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reason is just mistaken.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, he says, “In this way, etc.”

original: sa dang sa bon la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo gcig @224a * //🔽pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa dang sa bon la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo gcig @224a * //🔽pa ma yin te /
translated: Earth, seed, etc., are not the same in their natures.

original: phyi ma dang 'dra bar sngar yang 'bras bu bskyed pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma dang 'dra bar sngar yang 'bras bu bskyed pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would have generated its effect previously, just as it does later.

original: 'on kyang phyi ma phyi mar 'gyur bas tha dad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi ma phyi mar 'gyur bas tha dad pa dag yin no //
translated: But they are different because they become later and later.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i rgyun gyur pa las tha dad pa'i tshogs de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i rgyun gyur pa las tha dad pa'i tshogs de la'o //
translated: In that, in the continuum that is different from the collection,

original: tshogs pa tha ma ste phyis byung ba 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar chad pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs pa tha ma ste phyis byung ba 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar chad pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the final collection, which is later, generates its effect, it is only the one that is uninterrupted by another moment that possesses the effect.

original: gang gis gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin /
translated: By what is the reason mistaken?

original: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshogs la'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshogs la'o //
translated: That itself, the collection that was just explained.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni tshogs par gyur pa de dag gi nad nas so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni tshogs par gyur pa de dag gi nad nas so //
translated: From that, from the collection that has become.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir sngar gyur pa'i don ji ltar na rgyu zhes brjod ce na ;
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir sngar gyur pa'i don ji ltar na rgyu zhes brjod ce na ;
translated: If that is so, then why is the meaning of “that which has become earlier” described as a cause?

original: gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it is different, etc.

original: skyed par byed par 'dod par gyur ba tha ma de las gzhan no //
analyzed: skyed par byed par 'dod par gyur ba tha ma de las gzhan no //
translated: The last one, which is held to be the producer, is different from that.

original: de las gzhan pa gzhan yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gzhan yang yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is another one different from that,

original: sngar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sngar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “the one that has already occurred.”

original: de'i don zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i skad cig ma'i don to //
analyzed: de'i don zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i skad cig ma'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is the meaning of the moment of potentiality.

original: de bas na rgyu'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas /
translated: Therefore, because it is the cause of the cause, it is designated as🔽the cause, and the convention of cause is made.

original: rgyu'i tha snyad du byas pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i tha snyad du byas pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: skad cig ma tha ma la yang gags byed pa yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par byed pa la nges pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma la yang gags byed pa yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par byed pa la nges pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is no certainty in the production of the effect because there is an obstruction even in the last moment, then the example is empty of the probandum.

original: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says, “There,” and so on.

original: der zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa tha ma la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa tha ma la'o //
translated: “There” refers to the final collection.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gyur pa'i srid gcig pa tha ma la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gyur pa'i srid gcig pa tha ma la'o //
translated: “In that” refers to the final moment of the single existence of the cause.

original: 'gyur ba bskyed na skad cig ma de'i gcig pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir snga ma 'phos pa'i phyir dang / gnyis par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba bskyed na skad cig ma de'i gcig pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir snga ma 'phos pa'i phyir dang / gnyis par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it generates a change, then the momentariness of that would be impaired, because the prior would be transferred and the second would be generated, called “change.”

original: de bas na de'i tha mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de'i tha mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be the last.

original: ji ste nyes pa der ma gyur cig snyam pas skad cig ma de'i skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'pho sar mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa der ma gyur cig snyam pas skad cig ma de'i skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'pho sar mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you think, “Let us not incur that error,” and you do not accept that the prior moment is transferred to the last moment, because it has the nature of generating that moment,

original: de'i bdag nyid la ste /🔽skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid las skad cig ma tha mas bsdus pa'i rgyu 'pho ba med pa ni de skyed par byed pa la ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la ste / skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid las skad cig ma tha mas bsdus pa'i rgyu 'pho ba med pa ni de skyed par byed pa la ste /
translated: then it would be in its own nature.🔽The cause included in the last moment would not be transferred from the nature of the generator to the generator of the effect.

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa la gags byed pa'i rgyu mi mthun pa mi byed pa ni gags byed pa nyid ma yin zhing gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa la gags byed pa'i rgyu mi mthun pa mi byed pa ni gags byed pa nyid ma yin zhing gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause that obstructs the generation of the effect would not be obstructive, because it would not be obstructive and would not be harmful.

original: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa 'bras bu s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa gang la ltos pa dang bcas pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa 'bras bu s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa gang la ltos pa dang bcas pa med pa yin no //
translated: The seed of barley, etc. is not dependent on anything else that produces the sprout of rice.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de skyed par byed pa'i sa dang chu la sogs pa rkyen dag ni 'ga' zhig tu nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa de la yang nye @224b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i sa dang chu la sogs pa rkyen dag ni 'ga' zhig tu nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa de la yang nye @224b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conditions that produce it, such as the earth and water, are not present in the seed of barley, etc.

original: de dag ltos pa med du zin na yang s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par mi byed pa de bas na de'i gnas skabs can ni ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ltos pa med du zin na yang s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par mi byed pa de bas na de'i gnas skabs can ni ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if they were not dependent on anything else, they would not produce the sprout of rice. Therefore, the state of being a seed is not definite.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ji ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ji ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, “How?”

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de dag la zhes bya ba nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa dag la s'a lu'i sa bon gang yin pa de nyid skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de dag la zhes bya ba nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa dag la s'a lu'i sa bon gang yin pa de nyid skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is only dependent.🔽In those, in the seed of barley, etc., that very seed of rice is not a producer,

original: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid dag med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid dag med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that is, it does not have the nature of producing the sprout of rice.

original: de'i rang bzhin la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin la ltos pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it depends on the nature of the rice sprout.

original: de bas na de la gtan tshigs mi 'jug pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la gtan tshigs mi 'jug pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the reason does not apply to that, it is not indeterminate.

original: 'on te de ltar yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: If it were so, etc. is from another.

original: khyad par la ltos pa dang dag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: khyad par la ltos pa dang dag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the reason that depends on the distinction and the pure reason,

original: 'ga' zhig byas pa'am yod pa nyid la yang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig byas pa'am yod pa nyid la yang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: someone says, “It is also in the case of something that is produced or exists.”

original: de la yang zhig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la yang zhig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: There, also is to be supplied.

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid yod pa ma yin te skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid yod pa ma yin te skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has the nature of destruction does not exist, because it is momentary. This is the meaning.

original: de bas na de'i rang bzhin la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i rang bzhin la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because it depends on its nature,

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig pa dag ma yin no //
translated: because it depends on the nature of destruction, it is not destroyed.

original: 'dis ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la ma grub pa nyid smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la ma grub pa nyid smras pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the nonestablishment of the reason, “because of the absence of dependence.”

original: s'a lu'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, “The rice seed, etc.,”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: and the word “etc.” includes barley seeds, etc.

original: rang bzhin de ni zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin de ni zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos te /
translated: “That nature” refers to the nature that is desired and the opposite.

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: It is the nature of producing an effect and not producing an effect.

original: rang gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni s'a lu'i sa bon de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni s'a lu'i sa bon de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which is a barley seed, etc., is not the cause of that rice seed, because it is not its cause.

original: gang gi rgyur mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi rgyur mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a cause of that.

original: de de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: de de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: That nature would not be its nature.

original: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur par bye brag med pa'i phyir rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur par bye brag med pa'i phyir rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Since there is no distinction between the elements and the derivative elements that are the nature that produces a rice sprout, there is a distinction of cause.

original: de'i nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Its potency,” etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye bas mngon sum gyis khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye bas mngon sum gyis khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: The nature, i.e., the essence, is ascertained by perception through the distinction of nature.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also ascertained by inference, he says,

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la rang bzhin nges pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //🔽don rnams la ni zhes @225a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la rang bzhin nges pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba'i rang bzhin nyid do // don rnams la ni zhes @225a * //
translated: “The nature,” etc. The nature is ascertained means that the nature is distinguished.

original: bya ba ni dngos po rnams la'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni dngos po rnams la'o //
translated: “In regard to objects” means in regard to entities.

original: glo bur du zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par ro //🔽ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: glo bur du zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par ro // ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: “Suddenly” means without cause.

original: ltos pa med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why is it not reasonable? He says, “It is not reasonable that it be independent,” etc.

original: rgyu la ltos pa med pa ni yul 'ga' zhig kho na la yin gyi thams cad la ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa med pa ni yul 'ga' zhig kho na la yin gyi thams cad la ma yin zhing /
translated: That which is independent of a cause is not in regard to all objects, but only in regard to some;

original: dus 'ga' zhig tu yin gyi thams cad kyi tshe ma yin la /
analyzed: dus 'ga' zhig tu yin gyi thams cad kyi tshe ma yin la /
translated: it is not at all times, but only at some times;

original: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa rdzas 'ga' zhig la yin gyi thams cad la ma yin pa de lta bu /
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa rdzas 'ga' zhig la yin gyi thams cad la ma yin pa de lta bu /
translated: it is not in regard to all substances, but only in regard to some, such as the seed of barley, etc.

original: gang 'di yul dang dus ngang rdzas nges pa de la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'di yul dang dus ngang rdzas nges pa de la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is determined in regard to place, time, and substance is not possible.

original: nges pa yang de'i phyir yul la sogs pa la ltos nas yod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: nges pa yang de'i phyir yul la sogs pa la ltos nas yod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: And because of that, existence in dependence on place, etc. is understood to be possession of a cause.

original: de tsam ni rgyu dang ldan pa tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin pa'i rgyu ni rgyu'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de tsam ni rgyu dang ldan pa tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin pa'i rgyu ni rgyu'i khyad par yin no //
translated: That much is the cause of the conventional, because it is the cause of the conventional. The cause of intrinsic nature is a special cause.

original: ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dag rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin nges pa yin pa de ltar 'di la yang byas pa'am yod pa dag gi nges pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dag rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin nges pa yin pa de ltar 'di la yang byas pa'am yod pa dag gi nges pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as the seed of rice, etc. is determined in intrinsic nature because of the difference in causes, so the cause of the determination of the produced or the existent should be stated in this case.

original: gang gi phyir te nges par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir byas pa'am yod pa 'ga' zhig 'di ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can du 'byung ba dag yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir te nges par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir byas pa'am yod pa 'ga' zhig 'di ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can du 'byung ba dag yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin la /
translated: Why? Because of the cause that determines it. Some things that are produced or exist arise with the nature of destruction, but not others.

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And here, there is no nature that determines anything.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is established that all that is produced is impermanent.

original: skye ba gang la yod na thams cad ni skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad rgyu tsam dag las skyes pa dag la khyad par med par 'jig par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba gang la yod na thams cad ni skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad rgyu tsam dag las skyes pa dag la khyad par med par 'jig par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when production exists, it is established that all that is produced is destroyed without distinction, since they are produced from mere causes.

original: de yang gzhan la dus gzhan du 'jig par rab tu grags pa kho nas gzung nas bshad pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan la dus gzhan du 'jig par rab tu grags pa kho nas gzung nas bshad pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood to be stated by taking the example of what is well known to be destroyed in another place at another time.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not momentary destruction,

original: de nyid ni grub pa'i skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni grub pa'i skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the very occasion of the proof.

original: dus gzhan du 'jig par grub pa na yang de 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du 'jig par grub pa na yang de 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is established that it is destroyed at another time, then it is established that it has the nature of destruction.

original: de lta ma yin na snga ma dang 'dra bar phyis kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na snga ma dang 'dra bar phyis kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then like before, it would not be destroyed later,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference.

original: de bas na 'jig pa med pa'i bdag nyid du rgyus skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'dod pas ;
analyzed: de bas na 'jig pa med pa'i bdag nyid du rgyus skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'dod pas ;
translated: Therefore, since it is accepted that the cause generates it as having the nature of non-destruction,

original: dus thams cad du gnas pa'i ngang tshul can du skyed par byed do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gnas pa'i ngang tshul can du skyed par byed do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: it must be accepted that it generates it as having the nature of enduring at all times.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i byas pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i byas pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Such a thing that is produced does not exist,

original: thams cad dus gzhan du 'jig par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dus gzhan du 'jig par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that it is destroyed at another time.

original: re zhig nang gi bdag nyid can blo dang dbang po dang lus rgyun chad ba can dag dmigs la /
analyzed: re zhig nang gi bdag nyid can blo dang dbang po dang lus rgyun chad ba can dag dmigs la /
translated: The internal, such as the mind, the sense faculties, and the body, are observed to be interrupted.

original: phyi @225b rol gyi shing la sogs pa yang dmigs so //
analyzed: phyi @225b rol gyi shing la sogs pa yang dmigs so //
translated: External trees, etc., are also observed.

original: ri la sogs pa dag kyang de la brten pa'i shing la sogs pa 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa dag kyang de la brten pa'i shing la sogs pa 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: and mountains, etc. are also destroyed because the trees, etc. that are based on them are destroyed.

original: de lta ma yin na brten pa yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na brten pa yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then what is based on them would not be destroyed.

original: gzhan dag kyang 'ga' zhig tu tha na rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yang mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'ga' zhig tu tha na rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yang mi skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: And others are also destroyed because they do not produce even the slightest effect of consciousness.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa dag kyang de'i rigs can nyid yin pas na 'jig pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa dag kyang de'i rigs can nyid yin pas na 'jig pa grub pa yin no //
translated: And because diamond, etc. are of the same kind, destruction is established.

original: 'jig pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rgyus byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rgyus byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The distinction between destruction and nondestruction is not made on the basis of being produced by a cause.

original: 'on kyang gal te skye ba dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te skye ba dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: But rather, if it possesses origination, etc.

original: 'di la skye ba yod pas na skye ba dang ldan pa yin la de'i rang bzhin ni skye ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin te /
