analyzed: 'di la skye ba yod pas na skye ba dang ldan pa yin la de'i rang bzhin ni skye ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That which has origination is one that possesses origination. Its nature is the nature of one that possesses origination.

original: 'jig pa dang ldan pa de nyid 'jig pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang ldan pa de nyid 'jig pa can yin no //
translated: That which possesses destruction is one that is destroyed.

original: de skad du 'ga' zhig de la de 'dra ba'i skye ba yod pa nyid gang gis 'ga' zhig 'gag par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du 'ga' zhig de la de 'dra ba'i skye ba yod pa nyid gang gis 'ga' zhig 'gag par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, someone might say, “By what is there such arising, which is the cessation of something, but not of something else?”

original: gzhan ni skye ba ni 'jig pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni skye ba ni 'jig pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Another says, “Arising is not the cause of the essential nature of destruction,

original: skye ba zhes bya ba cung zad tha dad pa ni cung zhig ma yin na gang gis 'jig pa can gyi rang bzhin ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba cung zad tha dad pa ni cung zhig ma yin na gang gis 'jig pa can gyi rang bzhin ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: because what is called ‘arising’ is not something different, so what would it do to the essential nature of destruction?”

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid skye ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid skye ba yin te /
translated: The essential nature of things is arising.

original: de nyid las gang las skye ba 'di 'dra ba zhes gtan tshigs kyi rnam par dbye ba dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid las gang las skye ba 'di 'dra ba zhes gtan tshigs kyi rnam par dbye ba dpyod par byed do //
translated: From that very thing, one analyzes the classification of reasons, “From what does this kind of arising occur?”

original: rgyu med pa can gyi skye ba'i rang bzhin nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can gyi skye ba'i rang bzhin nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no definite essential nature of causeless arising.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni 'jig pa grub pas skye ba 'jig pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir byas pa'am yod pa 'di las rgyu las 'jig pa dang / 'jig pa med par skyed par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par dbye ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni 'jig pa grub pas skye ba 'jig pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir byas pa'am yod pa 'di las rgyu las 'jig pa dang / 'jig pa med par skyed par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par dbye ba med do //
translated: Because all that is produced is established as perishable, production does not have a cause that has the nature of non-perishing. Therefore, in terms of the produced or the existent, there is no distinction in terms of the nature of the cause in terms of perishing or not perishing.

original: de med pa'i phyir te gtan tshigs kyi rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu byas pa'am yod pa nyid la 'jig pa dang / 'jig pa med pa nyid du rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te gtan tshigs kyi rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu byas pa'am yod pa nyid la 'jig pa dang / 'jig pa med pa nyid du rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Because of that non-existence, because there is no distinction in terms of the reason, there is no distinction in terms of the produced or existent effect in terms of perishing or not perishing.

original: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is similar to barley seeds and so on.

original: byas pa nyid la ltos nas de skad du skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni 'jig pa grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la ltos nas de skad du skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni 'jig pa grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: In dependence on being produced, it is taught, “Because all that is produced is established as perishable,” and so on.

original: yod pa nyid la yang ltos par mi rigs te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid la yang ltos par mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not tenable to rely on existence.

original: rtag pa dag ni gzhan gyis yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dag ni gzhan gyis yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the other schools accept that they are permanent and existent.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: byas pa ma yin pa la yod pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pa la yod pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence is not possible for what is not produced.

original: yod pa nyid thams cad ni yul dang dus dang dngos po la nges pa yin @226a * //
analyzed: yod pa nyid thams cad ni yul dang dus dang dngos po la nges pa yin @226a * //
translated: All existence is determined in terms of place, time, and substance,

original: na ; rgyu med pa can nyid ni de la nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na ; rgyu med pa can nyid ni de la nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is not possible to determine that something is causeless.

original: gzhan gyis rdul phra rab dag dang yid ni lus can nyid yin ba'i phyir yul nges pa khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rdul phra rab dag dang yid ni lus can nyid yin ba'i phyir yul nges pa khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: The other schools accept that atoms and mind are embodied, and so they accept that they are determined in terms of place.

original: des byas pa'i phan btags pa med pa la yul 'di na rdul phra rab yod kyi gzhan na med la de bzhin du bdag gi phyogs 'di na yid yod la gzhan na med do zhes bya ba'i yul nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des byas pa'i phan btags pa med pa la yul 'di na rdul phra rab yod kyi gzhan na med la de bzhin du bdag gi phyogs 'di na yid yod la gzhan na med do zhes bya ba'i yul nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they are not benefited by the action of atoms, then it is not possible to determine that atoms exist in this place but not in another, and similarly, that mind exists in this part of the self but not in another.

original: yul thams cad la rdul phra rab la sogs pa thams cad yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul thams cad la rdul phra rab la sogs pa thams cad yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that atoms and so on would exist everywhere.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang dag yod pa la ltos pa med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i don mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang dag yod pa la ltos pa med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i don mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: “Therefore” and so on concludes the meaning of the syllogism, “Whatever is not dependent on anything else is not tenable as existing.”

original: 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa 'dis dngos po zhes 'ga' zhig la /
analyzed: 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa 'dis dngos po zhes 'ga' zhig la /
translated: This non-dependence on destruction is what makes something a thing.

original: dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: At some time,

original: 'jig pa yod pa gang de dang 'gal ba can ci zhig byed de med pa ste 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jig pa de med pa'i rang bzhin de yod pa nyid du grub par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig pa yod pa gang de dang 'gal ba can ci zhig byed de med pa ste 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jig pa de med pa'i rang bzhin de yod pa nyid du grub par byed de /
translated: whatever exists, what is incompatible with that? It is non-existence. At some time, that which is the nature of non-existence of destruction is established as existent.

original: thams cad la dus thams cad du 'jig pa yod par grub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad la dus thams cad du 'jig pa yod par grub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is established that at all times, for all things, destruction exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: “Because” and so on.

original: yul dang rdzas de la ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul dang rdzas de la ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because it is dependent on the object and the substance.

original: dus gang la'am rdzas gang 'gyur ba'i dus dang rdzas de la ltos pa can te /
analyzed: dus gang la'am rdzas gang 'gyur ba'i dus dang rdzas de la ltos pa can te /
translated: At whatever time, or whatever substance, at that time and in that substance, it is dependent.

original: ltos pa med ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: ltos pa med ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes gong du bshad zin to //
translated: It was explained above that it would not be independent.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: “ If, on the other hand” and so on is the opponent’s position.

original: rgyu med pa can ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid kyi rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las de ltar skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid kyi rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las de ltar skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: “ It is not causeless” means that it arises from the essence of the cause of existence itself,

original: 'jig ba'i rang bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig ba'i rang bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises with the nature of destruction.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to make this point clear, he says “existence” and so on.

original: yod pa nyid du 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽yod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba ni de 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni / yod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba ni de 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: “ Would be existence” means

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it would attain existence, because it has the nature of destruction.🔽If it is thought that “undoubtedly existence does not arise from any cause,”

original: gal te gdon mi za bar dngos po yod pa nyid ni rgyu 'ga' zhig las kyang byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsam pa ni yod pa thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gdon mi za bar dngos po yod pa nyid ni rgyu 'ga' zhig las kyang byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsam pa ni yod pa thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: then all existence would not depend on a cause.

original: phyogs dang dus dang rdul phra rab la sogs ba nyid 'ga' zhig bsags pas brtag pa yin pa de bas na yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang dus dang rdul phra rab la sogs ba nyid 'ga' zhig bsags pas brtag pa yin pa de bas na yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni /
translated: Since the aggregates of directions, time, subtle particles, etc. are themselves imputed, the reason “because of existing”

original: de dag gis ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: is indeterminate for them.

original: 'on te bstan pa nyid du 'dod pa dag gi yod pa nyid ni blo bur ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te bstan pa nyid du 'dod pa dag gi yod pa nyid ni blo bur ba ste /
translated: But if you assert that the existence of the taught is adventitious,

original: rgyu med pa can yin pa'i yod pa 'di don 'ga' zhig la dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul @226b 'ga' zhig tu ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can yin pa'i yod pa 'di don 'ga' zhig la dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul @226b 'ga' zhig tu ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then this causeless existence would not be reversed at any time, for any object, in any place.

original: rdzas dang yul dang dus des bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas dang yul dang dus des bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be reversed by any substance, place, or time.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽dngos po de ni rten du gyur pa 'ga' zhig la 'brel pa ste brten par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dngos po de ni rten du gyur pa 'ga' zhig la 'brel pa ste brten par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “That existence is not related to . . .”🔽That existence is not related to any support, i.e., it is not supported by anything.

original: gang gang la skyed par byed pa po la sogs pa la cung zhig rag lus pa ste ltos pa'am /
analyzed: gang gang la skyed par byed pa po la sogs pa la cung zhig rag lus pa ste ltos pa'am /
translated: Or, it is not related to anything, i.e., it does not depend on anything, such as a cause, etc.

original: 'brel pa med pa ma yin zhing gang gang la rag lus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa ma yin zhing gang gang la rag lus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not unrelated, nor is it dependent on anything.

original: gal te yod pa nyid de 'di ni 'ga' zhig la rag lus pa can ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid de 'di ni 'ga' zhig la rag lus pa can ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If existence is not dependent on anything,

original: rdzas dang yul dang dus la ltos par nges pa can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzas dang yul dang dus la ltos par nges pa can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be ascertained as depending on substance, place, and time.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' la 'di yod pa nyid yin gyi bdag la ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' la 'di yod pa nyid yin gyi bdag la ma yin la /
translated: For, it would not be the case that space exists here and not in the self,

original: bdag la yod pa nyid yin gyi dus la yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la yod pa nyid yin gyi dus la yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that it exists in the self and not in time.

original: 'di ltar yul 'di la rdul phra rab yod kyi gzhan la ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul 'di la rdul phra rab yod kyi gzhan la ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, it would not be ascertained that atoms exist in this place and not elsewhere,

original: bdag gi phyogs 'di la yid yod pa nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi phyogs 'di la yid yod pa nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that the mind exists in this part of the self and not in that part.

original: yul thams cad la rdul phra rab la sogs pa thams cad dang phyogs la sogs pa dag la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul thams cad la rdul phra rab la sogs pa thams cad dang phyogs la sogs pa dag la yang 'gyur te /
translated: Atoms and so on would exist in all places, and parts and so on would exist in all things.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu med pa la dus dang rdzas la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu med pa la dus dang rdzas la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not depend on time and substance, just as it is without an effect.

original: dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe lhan cig byed pa 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe lhan cig byed pa 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at some time, it would not have an effect in association with some of the cooperating causes.

original: gzhan du de la rag las pa'i 'bras bu cig car bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du de la rag las pa'i 'bras bu cig car bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would generate an effect that depends on it all at once.

original: gang zhig la ltos pa de ni de las skye ba dang ldan pa yin te myu gu la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gang zhig la ltos pa de ni de las skye ba dang ldan pa yin te myu gu la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: That which depends on something else is produced from that, like a sprout, etc.

original: de bas na yod pa nyid 'di ni 'ga' zhig tu rtag par mngon par 'dod pa yin du zin kyang blo bur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yod pa nyid 'di ni 'ga' zhig tu rtag par mngon par 'dod pa yin du zin kyang blo bur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this existence, even though it is accepted as permanent in some places, is not adventitious.

original: gal te yod pa nyid kyi rgyu kho na las 'jig pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid kyi rgyu kho na las 'jig pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If destruction occurs only from the cause of existence,

original: 'o na da ji ltar 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du bstan zhes bya ba 'gal ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na da ji ltar 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du bstan zhes bya ba 'gal ba ston pa'o //
translated: then how is it that you teach that destruction is without a cause? This shows the contradiction.🔽He replies:

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed pa ste /
translated: If it is said that it is not so because it is produced, etc.

original: yod pa nyid kyi rgyu las 'jig pa'i rang bzhin skyes pa de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi rgyu las 'jig pa'i rang bzhin skyes pa de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of that which is arisen from the cause of existence is the nature of destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu med par bshad do //
translated: Since it does not depend on another cause of destruction, it is said that destruction is causeless.

original: gang du 'dir yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba dngos po las gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang med de dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang du 'dir yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba dngos po las gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang med de dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Here, destruction is not something different from a thing, but rather a thing itself is destruction.

original: zhig nas med pa 'jig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa 'jig pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t destruction the nonexistence of what has been destroyed?

original: de de ltar dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de de ltar dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be the nature of an existent thing.

original: de nyid skad cig mar gnas pa'i tshul can du skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /🔽rang gi rgyu kho na las skad @227a * //
analyzed: de nyid skad cig mar gnas pa'i tshul can du skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / rang gi rgyu kho na las skad @227a * //
translated: Since it is produced in the manner of momentary endurance,🔽it is produced from its own cause alone in the manner of momentary endurance.

original: cig mar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can du skyes pa'i phyir 'jig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cig mar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can du skyes pa'i phyir 'jig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “destruction.”

original: skad cig mar gnas pa kho na 'jig pa yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa kho na 'jig pa yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: It is asserted that momentary endurance is itself destruction.

original: zhig nas med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the nonexistence of what has been destroyed. This is the meaning.

original: gal te skad cig mar gnas pa can gyi ngo bo de nyid 'jig pa yin na yang ci'i phyir rgyu na chad pa las sngar yang de ltar mi 'dzin /
analyzed: gal te skad cig mar gnas pa can gyi ngo bo de nyid 'jig pa yin na yang ci'i phyir rgyu na chad pa las sngar yang de ltar mi 'dzin /
translated: But if that very entity that endures for a moment is also destroyed, why is it not apprehended as such prior to the cause of destruction?

original: ma bzung ba de'i phyir skad cig mar gnas pa can gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma bzung ba de'i phyir skad cig mar gnas pa can gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not apprehended, one would understand that it does not have an entity that endures for a moment.

original: de'i phyir blun po dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blun po dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore Candrakīrti says, “Fools, lacking clear vision, think that the nature of things such as pots . . .”

original: blun po ste mthong ba gsal po dang bral ba dag gis bum pa la sogs pa dngos po'i di'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa can de ni /
analyzed: blun po ste mthong ba gsal po dang bral ba dag gis bum pa la sogs pa dngos po'i di'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa can de ni /
translated: Fools, lacking clear vision, think that the nature of things such as pots, which have an entity that endures for a moment,

original: rgyun chad pa'i dus phyis dngos po 'di 'jig pa can yin no zhes nges pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i dus phyis dngos po 'di 'jig pa can yin no zhes nges pa ste /
translated: is destroyed later, at the time of the interruption of the continuum.

original: gsal bar gyur gyi sngar yod pa nyid kyi dus su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar gyur gyi sngar yod pa nyid kyi dus su ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so at the time of its existence.

original: mthong na yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba yod na yang mthong ba'i dus su nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong na yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba yod na yang mthong ba'i dus su nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even when seeing, when the nature of destruction is seen, there is no ascertainment at the time of seeing.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa nyid kyi phyir dang gzhan rgyun 'dra ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa nyid kyi phyir dang gzhan rgyun 'dra ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the darkness of nescience and because of the arising of a similar continuum.

original: mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absence of clear vision.

original: de'i dbang gis te phyis des mi rtag go zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis te phyis des mi rtag go zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: By the power of that, later, one determines that it is impermanent.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that example, he says, “For example, an inexperienced person, etc.

original: dper na skyes bu mkhas pas dug gi rdzas gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir sngar nges par ma bzung la /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu mkhas pas dug gi rdzas gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir sngar nges par ma bzung la /
translated: For example, although an experienced person has grasped a poisonous substance, because the reason for error exists, he has not previously ascertained it.

original: phyis dug gis byas pa'i 'gyur ba kha chu 'dzag pa la sogs pa mthong nas dug tu 'jog pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis dug gis byas pa'i 'gyur ba kha chu 'dzag pa la sogs pa mthong nas dug tu 'jog pa de bzhin no //
translated: Later, seeing the change produced by the poison, such as the flow of saliva, he determines it to be poison.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: 'jig pa 'di ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'di ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This destruction, etc.

original: dngos po'i yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ma gtogs par 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ma gtogs par 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because, apart from the existence of the thing, it does not depend on any other cause of destruction whatsoever.

original: de la khyab par byed pa ste yod pa nyid la khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa ste yod pa nyid la khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the pervader of existence.

original: 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The other party says, “It is not dependent on destruction, etc.”

original: de'i rgyu nus pa med pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni lan gyi tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nus pa med pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni lan gyi tshig go //
translated: “Because its cause is not capable” is the response.

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: “Its cause” is the cause of destruction.

original: med pa zhes bya ba la dngos po grub pa'i phyis med pa zhes mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i bya ba dgag pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs gzhan bsdu ba'i phyir yang gi sgra smos pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba la dngos po grub pa'i phyis med pa zhes mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i bya ba dgag pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs gzhan bsdu ba'i phyir yang gi sgra smos pa yin no //
translated: “It is not nonexistent” is stated to negate the activity of that which is asserted to be nonexistent after the establishment of a thing, and to include another reason.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The other party says, “How can it be destroyed?”

original: slob dpon gyis dngos po grub pa la ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dngos po grub pa la ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The master says, “When a thing is established, etc.”

original: dgongs pa ni 'jig @227b pa'i rgyu'i dngos po de nyid dam de las gzhan byed ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'jig @227b pa'i rgyu'i dngos po de nyid dam de las gzhan byed ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The intention is that the cause of destruction either is that very thing or is different from it.

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the case that

original: gang gi phyir dngos po grub pa la ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po grub pa la ni byed pa ste /
translated: Because an entity that is established does not need to be made by a cause of cessation.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni dngos po de la mi byed de /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni dngos po de la mi byed de /
translated: A cause of cessation does not make that entity.

original: des ni rang gi rgyu kho na las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni rang gi rgyu kho na las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established from its own cause alone.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the second position,

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la byed pa ni dngos po de la cung zhig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la byed pa ni dngos po de la cung zhig kyang ma yin te /
translated: because that which makes another does not make that entity in the least.

original: de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the same status.

original: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to “an entity that is not that,” and so on,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa dngos po'i ngo bo dang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa dngos po'i ngo bo dang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means that it does not make an entity that is the opposite of the entity that is explained.

original: kyang gi sgras ni med pa rnam pa gsum sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni med pa rnam pa gsum sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “also” includes the three types of nonentities.

original: de bas na 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir nus pa med pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir nus pa med pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because a cause of cessation does not make anything at all, it is established that it is not capable of cessation that is independent of an entity.

original: bya ba dgag pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras bsdus pa gang yin pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba dgag pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras bsdus pa gang yin pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify what is included by the word “also” in the phrase “in order to stop activity,”

original: ji ltar bya ba 'gog ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba 'gog ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: he says, “How does one stop activity?”

original: 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba de dag gis dngos po'i ngo bo med pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba de dag gis dngos po'i ngo bo med pa yin par sems so //
translated: “ Destruction” is the non-existence of the entity of a thing.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: “ Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di ni med pa'i ngo bo byed do zhes bya ba thob po //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di ni med pa'i ngo bo byed do zhes bya ba thob po //
translated: The cause of destruction is the non-existence of the entity of a thing.

original: de ltar gnas pa de la gal te med ba zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig 'jig pa'i rgyus 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de'i tshe myu gu la sogs pa dang 'da' bar 'bras bu nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa de la gal te med ba zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig 'jig pa'i rgyus 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de'i tshe myu gu la sogs pa dang 'da' bar 'bras bu nyid yin pas na /
translated: Thus, if the so-called “non-existence” of that enduring thing becomes the nature of the effect due to the cause of destruction, then, since it is an effect like a sprout, etc.,

original: de nyid dngos po yin pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid dngos po yin pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is a thing, and therefore it is not the non-existence of the entity of a thing.

original: de bas na gang dngos po 'di med pa 'jig pa'i rgyus byed do zhes smra ba des /
analyzed: de bas na gang dngos po 'di med pa 'jig pa'i rgyus byed do zhes smra ba des /
translated: Therefore, the one who says, “This thing is destroyed by a cause of destruction,”

original: dngos po mi byed do zhes 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di'i bya ba 'gog pa byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po mi byed do zhes 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di'i bya ba 'gog pa byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not stop the activity of this cause of destruction, which is not a cause of the thing.

original: bya ba 'gog pa de lta na yang cung zhig kyang mi byed pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di ci'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba 'gog pa de lta na yang cung zhig kyang mi byed pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di ci'i phyir /
translated: Even though the activity is stopped, why is this cause of destruction, which does not do anything at all,

original: dngos pos 'jig pa la ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos pos 'jig pa la ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: dependent on the thing that is destroyed?

original: de ltar na dngos po ni 'jig pa la ltos pa med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po ni 'jig pa la ltos pa med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the thing is established as not dependent on destruction.

original: ltos pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of that very non-dependence,

original: gang zhes de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhes de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'gyur /
translated: how could it be that the thing itself is destroyed by its own nature?

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig la mthong bar 'gyur ba de la 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig la mthong bar 'gyur ba de la 'jig pa'o //
translated: If it were seen in some thing, it would be destroyed.

original: de las gzhan pa dag la yang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la yang /
translated: But it is not seen in other things

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'gyur ba yin /
translated: either, because of its own nature.

original: rang bzhin tsam gyis ngo bo 'di las dngos po gzhan dag las ma mthong na yang zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tsam gyis ngo bo 'di las dngos po gzhan dag las ma mthong na yang zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the nature of this thing is not seen in other things, merely by its nature.

original: de 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad @228a * //🔽par byed pa la /
analyzed: de 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad @228a * // par byed pa la /
translated: He explains this with this is that, etc.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: This is the perishing.

original: de ltar gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba la yang ngo //🔽dngos po'i yul can gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba la yang ngo // dngos po'i yul can gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i yul can no //
translated: Thus, in other cases means also in the unseen.🔽The word having means having an object.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo des zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid du sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo des zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid du sbyor ro //
translated: The word having is connected with the word effect in the sense of a common locus.

original: de yang lnga pa'i tshig gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang lnga pa'i tshig gnyis pa yin te /
translated: And that is the second word of the fifth case, having an effect.🔽 The word having is connected with the word nature in the sense of an action done by that effect and nature.

original: 'bras bu dang ngo bo de dag gis byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ngo bo de dag gis byas pa'o //
translated: That is, having an effect and nature.

original: gang la 'bras bu'i rtags kyi rjes su dpog pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'bras bu'i rtags kyi rjes su dpog pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has an inference of an effect is called that.

original: de bzhin du gang la rang bzhin rtags kyis zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la rang bzhin rtags kyis zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, having a nature is to be connected with the word sign in the same way.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the pervasion of the probandum just as it is,

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: the effect is the pervader of the probandum.

original: rang bzhin gyi yang rang bzhin khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yang rang bzhin khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: And the nature of the pervader is to be established with respect to the nature of the pervaded.

original: bsgrub par bya ba rtags can de la 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin gyi rtags de dag de nyid rag lu sa ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba rtags can de la 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin gyi rtags de dag de nyid rag lu sa ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect and nature signs are the proof of that which has the sign, which is the object to be established.

original: mi dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to non-observation,

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽yod pa nges pa dang sgra dang tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug pa blo sngon can nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / yod pa nges pa dang sgra dang tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug pa blo sngon can nyid kyi phyir /
translated: he says, “engagement,” and so on.🔽Because engagement, which is characterized by the ascertainment of existence and the expression of sound and convention, is preceded by the mind,

original: tshad ma sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it is preceded by valid knowledge.

original: de'i ngo bo mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo mi dmigs na /
translated: If its nature is not observed,

original: 'jug pa'i yul de'i ngo bo mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis mi dmigs na'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul de'i ngo bo mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis mi dmigs na'o //
translated: if the nature of the object of engagement is not observed by either direct perception or inference.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par mi bya zhes bya bas zhes bya ba'i cha 'di tsam gyis ma mthong ba'i yul can la yang mi dmigs pa ni tshad mar bshad /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par mi bya zhes bya bas zhes bya ba'i cha 'di tsam gyis ma mthong ba'i yul can la yang mi dmigs pa ni tshad mar bshad /
translated: The mere part “one who has conception does not engage” explains that non-observation is a valid knowledge even with regard to a subject that does not see its object.

original: gsum pa mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ni go bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsum pa mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ni go bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The third, the reason of nonapprehension, is the means of comprehending.

original: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i yul zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di spangs nas /
analyzed: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i yul zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di spangs nas /
translated: Without distinction means that, having rejected the distinction “the object of seeing,”

original: spyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'ga' zhig gi'o //
analyzed: spyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'ga' zhig gi'o //
translated: it is a general proof of some object to be established.

original: yod par nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don de nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: yod par nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don de nyid ston par byed do //
translated: The meaning of that is shown by “certainty of existence,” and so on.

original: yod pa'i sgra ni re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra ni re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word “exists” should be applied to each.

original: tshad ma'i phyis 'byung ba can gyi yod pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni yod par nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i phyis 'byung ba can gyi yod pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni yod par nges pa'o //
translated: The conceptual thought “exists,” which occurs after the valid knowledge, is the certainty of existence.

original: de'i phyis 'byung ba can kho na'i yod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yod pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyis 'byung ba can kho na'i yod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yod pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The word “exists,” which occurs only after that, is the word “exists.”

original: de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba'i 'jug pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba'i 'jug pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The engagement “exists just as it is” is the convention of existence.

original: thams cad kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthong ba'i yul can dang ma mthong ba'i yul can no //
analyzed: thams cad kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthong ba'i yul can dang ma mthong ba'i yul can no //
translated: The word “just that” is both the object of seeing and the object of nonseeing.

original: mdo las 'jug pa'i sgrar gsungs la //🔽'grel pa las kyang yod par nges //
analyzed: mdo las 'jug pa'i sgrar gsungs la // 'grel pa las kyang yod par nges //
translated: The sutra speaks of the term engagement.🔽And the commentary states:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs na /
translated: “It is ascertained as existent.”

original: de ci ltar don 'brel pa med pa @228b can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar don 'brel pa med pa @228b can ma yin zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then how can it not be devoid of a related object?

original: yod par nges pa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod par nges pa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says: “From the ascertainment of existence,” and so on.

original: mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyis 'byung ba can blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dang / btang snyoms su bya ba'i don la blang ba dang dor ba dang btang snyoms su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod par nges pa de las /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyis 'byung ba can blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dang / btang snyoms su bya ba'i don la blang ba dang dor ba dang btang snyoms su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod par nges pa de las /
translated: After the experience of direct perception, there is the ascertainment of the conceptual thought that engages in the object to be adopted, to be rejected, or to be ignored.

original: sgra dang tha snyad dag 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i phyir yod par nges pa dang sgra dang tha snyad gsum po de dag kyang ci rigs par 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra dang tha snyad dag 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i phyir yod par nges pa dang sgra dang tha snyad gsum po de dag kyang ci rigs par 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: From that, terms and conventions are engaged. Therefore, the three—the ascertainment of existence, the term, and the convention—are the limbs of engagement, and because they are the nature of engagement,

original: mdo las 'jug pa zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: mdo las 'jug pa zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: the sutra explains them as engagement.

original: de'i phyir mdo dang 'grel pa dag la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo dang 'grel pa dag la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction between the sūtra and the commentary.

original: ci'i phyir shes pa log pa na yang yod pa'i tha snyad ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes pa log pa na yang yod pa'i tha snyad ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Why, when cognition is reversed, does the convention of existence also cease?

original: gang gi phyir shes pa de nyid yod pa nyid yin la de med pa ni med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa de nyid yod pa nyid yin la de med pa ni med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because that cognition itself is existence, and its nonexistence is nonexistence.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa nyid rnam pa gnyi ga la yang bye brag med par med pa yin no zhes gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa nyid rnam pa gnyi ga la yang bye brag med par med pa yin no zhes gong du bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, nonapprehension is not different in either case, and it is nonexistence, as was explained above.

original: med pa nyid de yang bskal pa'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'i dbang gis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid de yang bskal pa'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'i dbang gis bshad pa yin te /
translated: And that nonexistence is explained by the power of realizing nonapprehension that has a distant object.

original: rtogs pa pos ni dmigs par mi 'gyur bas na med do zhes bya bar nges par byed kyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa pos ni dmigs par mi 'gyur bas na med do zhes bya bar nges par byed kyi /
translated: Since the cognizer does not apprehend it, he ascertains it to be nonexistent.

original: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the power of the thing itself.

original: 'di ltar bskal pa'i don la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid the tshom du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bskal pa'i don la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid the tshom du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, with respect to a distant object, there is doubt as to whether it exists or does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir ji srid 'di la rtogs pa med pa de srid du 'di la bskal pa'i dngos po de'i rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji srid 'di la rtogs pa med pa de srid du 'di la bskal pa'i dngos po de'i rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because as long as there is no cognition of it, there is no cognition of that thing that is separate from it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod pa nyid du zin kyang bskal pa'i don mi dmigs pas des de'i don mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du zin kyang bskal pa'i don mi dmigs pas des de'i don mi byed pa ste /
translated: Even if it did exist, the object of the cognition would not be perceived, and therefore it would not perform its function.

original: skyes bu de'i don mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu de'i don mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not perform the function of that person.

original: yod du zin kyang rtogs pa po la med pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yod du zin kyang rtogs pa po la med pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even if it did exist, it would be as if it did not exist for the cognizer.

original: dngos su ni mi dmigs pa yin yang med pa dang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su ni mi dmigs pa yin yang med pa dang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In reality, it is not perceived, but it is not nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod pa nyid yin na yang rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pas 'ga' zhig tu mi dmigs pa de'i phyir /🔽med pa nyid nges pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin na yang rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pas 'ga' zhig tu mi dmigs pa de'i phyir / med pa nyid nges pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Even if it did exist, it would not be perceived at all because of its separation by nature and so on. Therefore,🔽it is not ascertained as nonexistent.

original: yod pa nyid du nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it ascertained as existent,

original: mi dmigs pa de ni med pa dag la yang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de ni med pa dag la yang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because nonperception is the same for nonexistent things as it is for existent things.

original: yod pa nyid de zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: yod pa nyid de zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: It is connected to “that existence.”

original: / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of the object of apprehension?

original: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi yod pa nyid kyi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i don yin gyi //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi yod pa nyid kyi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i don yin gyi //
translated: The meaning is that it is the negation of existence which has the nature of an object of apprehension.

original: dngos su yod pa nyid ldog pa ni ma yin te de ni the tshom du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa 'ga' @229a * //
analyzed: dngos su yod pa nyid ldog pa ni ma yin te de ni the tshom du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa 'ga' @229a * //
translated: But it is not the negation of actual existence, because that would lead to doubt.

original: zhig mi dmigs pa gang yin pa 'di yang dngos su med pa nyid kyi ngo bo yang yin no //
analyzed: zhig mi dmigs pa gang yin pa 'di yang dngos su med pa nyid kyi ngo bo yang yin no //
translated: Since this is the case, whatever is not apprehended as having the nature of an object of apprehension is also, in reality, non-existent.

original: yang gi sgras ni rtogs pa po'i dbang gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni rtogs pa po'i dbang gis kyang ngo //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is also due to the power of the cognizer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jug par mi rung ba nyid de yod pa'i tha snyad du mi rung ba de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par mi rung ba nyid de yod pa'i tha snyad du mi rung ba de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to engage, because it is not suitable to be the basis of the convention of existence.

original: de yang zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gog pa'i yul 'di la yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du de tshad mar mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gog pa'i yul 'di la yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du de tshad mar mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the non-apprehension of that is similar to the valid cognition of the result of the negation of the convention of existence in regard to this object of negation of the convention of existence.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can yang yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can yang yin te /
translated: That non-apprehension which is the non-apprehension of the characteristic of apprehension has the result of the ascertainment of non-existence.

original: gang la med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The result of the ascertainment of non-existence is the convention of non-existence.

original: yod pa nyid ma yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed pa la yod pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed pa la yod pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The clarification by “even though there is no existence” and so on is as follows: “no existence” is the convention of non-existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang dmigs su rung ba'i ngo bo la dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan tshogs pa dag yod cing snang ba ni mi dmigs pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dmigs su rung ba'i ngo bo la dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan tshogs pa dag yod cing snang ba ni mi dmigs pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: If the cause of the apprehension of the nature of the object of apprehension is present and appears, non-apprehension is not possible.

original: bskal pa'i yul mi dmigs pa snga ma ni med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa'i yul mi dmigs pa snga ma ni med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The former nonobservation of a past object of a past time is not a proof of nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can kho na yin na /🔽de la bstan bcos kyi dbang du byed pa'i skabs gang yin pa de la 'brel pa med cing med na mi 'byung ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can kho na yin na / de la bstan bcos kyi dbang du byed pa'i skabs gang yin pa de la 'brel pa med cing med na mi 'byung ba can yin te /
translated: Because direct perception, inference, and scriptural statements are the only characteristics of valid cognition.

original: bstan bcos skabs dang 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa bskal pa'i don mang po dag ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos skabs dang 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa bskal pa'i don mang po dag ste /
translated: In this context, the treatise is not related to the many objects of past time such as nature, etc.

original: bstan bcos kyi dbang du ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi dbang du ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of not related to the treatise is not taken into consideration.

original: de dag mngon sum gyis yul yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag mngon sum gyis yul yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are not objects of direct perception,

original: dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “transcending the senses.”

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /🔽'di ltar rtags can la min te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te / 'di ltar rtags can la min te /
translated: They are not objects of inference either.🔽Because they are not related to a reason.

original: de dag la 'bras bu'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'bras bu'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not related to a reason, they are not related to a result.

original: tshad ma gsum gyi yul las 'das pa de dag la ni tshad ma gsum ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum gyi yul las 'das pa de dag la ni tshad ma gsum ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na /
translated: Those which are beyond the scope of the three means of valid knowledge are characterized by the absence of the three means of valid knowledge.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs phyir na med de ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs phyir na med de ma yin no //
translated: How can they be nonexistent because of nonapprehension? No, they cannot!

original: de med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: de med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: He explains this with “Their nonexistence, etc.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the opponent.

original: don thams cad la zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: don thams cad la zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag la yang ngo //
translated: “In all matters” means in matters separated by place, time, and nature.

original: tshad ma gsum ldog pas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung ldog pa las so //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum ldog pas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung ldog pa las so //
translated: “By the absence of the three means of valid knowledge” means by the absence of perception, inference, and testimony.

original: lung gi tshad ma khas blangs nas de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma khas blangs nas de skad du bshad do //
translated: Having accepted the means of valid knowledge of testimony, he explains it in this way.

original: de ni zhes bya ba bstan bcos ni dbang du byas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba bstan bcos ni dbang du byas pa med pa ste /
translated: “That” refers to the treatise.

original: dbang @229b du byed pa med par skyes bu'i don la te bar mkho ba med pa'i don 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang @229b du byed pa med par skyes bu'i don la te bar mkho ba med pa'i don 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not authoritative, because without authority one does not engage in some matter that is not necessary for human aims.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos ba la /
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos ba la /
translated: The treatise is called a treatise and so on.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa'i don la brten nas bstan bcos 'jug pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa'i don la brten nas bstan bcos 'jug pa na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if a treatise were to engage in a meaning that is not useful for a person's purpose, it would be a treatise that is not useful for a person's purpose.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i brjod pa ste /
translated: It is an expression that is unrelated.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i bstan bcos ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i bstan bcos ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a treatise that is an unrelated expression would not be valid.

original: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba nyid la bstan bcos 'jug pa ni bden te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba nyid la bstan bcos 'jug pa ni bden te /
translated: It is true that a treatise engages in what is useful for a person's purpose.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i skabs de la /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i skabs de la /
translated: However, in that context of what is useful for a person's purpose,

original: nye bar mkho ba'i don thams cad ni dngos su'am brgyud pas bstan par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba'i don thams cad ni dngos su'am brgyud pas bstan par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir //
translated: all useful meanings should be taught either directly or indirectly. Therefore,

original: bstan bcos ni don thams cad yul du byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni don thams cad yul du byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: the treatise takes all meanings as its object.

original: de'i phyir skabs de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skabs de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says in that context.

original: skyes bu'i don dpyod pa'i skabs su mang po dag gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don dpyod pa'i skabs su mang po dag gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In the context of examining the person, it is not necessary to teach many things.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to teach that, he says, “For example,” and so on.

original: so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ba ni skyes bu so sor tha dad pa dag go //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ba ni skyes bu so sor tha dad pa dag go //
translated: The phrase “with a specific nature” refers to individual persons.

original: de ni skyes bu dag mtha' yas pa'i rdzas kyi bye brag de dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu dag mtha' yas pa'i rdzas kyi bye brag de dag kyang ngo //
translated: That is, the many substances of infinite persons.

original: de zhes bya ba ni / nges pa'i rgyu mtshan las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni / nges pa'i rgyu mtshan las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “that which is not” is connected to the phrase “a mode of being that does not arise from a specific cause.”

original: 'dis ni skyes bu gcig la yang rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i phyir mang po nyid dang go rims nges pa med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyes bu gcig la yang rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i phyir mang po nyid dang go rims nges pa med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that even a single person has many different causes and that there is no definite order to them.

original: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba nyid yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba nyid yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if the person is available for the purpose,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa ma lus par tshig re re nas /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa ma lus par tshig re re nas /
translated: the entire process of the mind engaging in that is not expressed in a single word.

original: gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin te mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin te mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not necessarily to be taught, because it is impossible.

original: yul dang dus kyis chod pa'i skyes bu'i don gyi skabs la nye bar mkho ba med pa'i rdzas kyi bye brag gdon mi za bar bstan par mi bya'o de bas na de bstan bcos kyi yul du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus kyis chod pa'i skyes bu'i don gyi skabs la nye bar mkho ba med pa'i rdzas kyi bye brag gdon mi za bar bstan par mi bya'o de bas na de bstan bcos kyi yul du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The particular substance that is not necessary for the context of the object of a person who is separated by place and time is not necessarily to be taught. Therefore, it is not taken as the subject of the treatise.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa yin la /
translated: That refers to the engagement of the mind.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi bye brag de dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi bye brag de dag kyang ngo //
translated: That refers to the particular substances.

original: de zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i rtags su bstan te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i rtags su bstan te /
translated: That refers to the signs of a male that are taught.

original: skyes pa bud med dang zhes bya ba skyes pa lhag par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa bud med dang zhes bya ba skyes pa lhag par ma byas pa'o //
translated: Male and female does not emphasize male.

original: mngon sum ldog pa yang med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum ldog pa yang med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the reversal of direct perception is also not a proof,🔽he says,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In that way, etc.

original: de ltar bskal pa dag la zhes bya ba yul la sogs pas bskal ba dag @230a * //
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa dag la zhes bya ba yul la sogs pas bskal ba dag @230a * //
translated: In that way, in eons means in eons separated by place, etc.

original: la rang gi nus pa nye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: la rang gi nus pa nye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are near their own potential.

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa gtod par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa gtod par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the projectors of their own consciousnesses.

original: shes pa skyes pa'i nus pa de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa skyes pa'i nus pa de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That potential for the arising of consciousness does not exist.

original: des ni dbang po las 'das zhes bya ba'i tshig de rnam par bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: des ni dbang po las 'das zhes bya ba'i tshig de rnam par bshad pa yin no /
translated: This explains the words “beyond the senses.”

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yang de dag yul ma yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yang de dag yul ma yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that inference also does not have them as its objects, he says,

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: “Their” and so forth.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa dag gi'o //
translated: “Their” refers to objects and so on.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pas so //
translated: “By which” refers to the nonobservation of effects.

original: de ni rtags can min zhes bya ba'i tshig de rnam par bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: de ni rtags can min zhes bya ba'i tshig de rnam par bshad pa yin no /
translated: This explains the words “they are not characterized.”

original: de dag gi ni zhes bya ba ni bskal pa dag ni'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ni zhes bya ba ni bskal pa dag ni'o //
translated: “Their” refers to the disconnections.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na yul la sogs pas bskal ba'i yul mi dmigs pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na yul la sogs pas bskal ba'i yul mi dmigs pa thams cad kyang /
translated: Since that is the case, all nonobservations of objects and so on that are disconnected are not evidence for the nonexistence of invisible objects.

original: ldog pa nges pa ste med pa nges par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa ste med pa nges par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase “it is not a means of ascertaining nonexistence” is the conclusion.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yang 'dir tshad mar khas blangs nas bshad kyi /
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yang 'dir tshad mar khas blangs nas bshad kyi /
translated: The refutation of the convention of existence is explained here as being accepted as valid knowledge.

original: dngos su de la yang tshad ma med do zhe na /
analyzed: dngos su de la yang tshad ma med do zhe na /
translated: But in reality, there is no valid knowledge in regard to that.

original: de bas na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Therefore, this non-apprehension,” and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni'o //
translated: The phrase “this non-apprehension” refers to the non-apprehension that has as its object a non-appearing object.

original: yod med nges pa'i 'bras can min /🔽phyir na ste yod par nges pa'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod med nges pa'i 'bras can min / phyir na ste yod par nges pa'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not a means of ascertaining existence or nonexistence.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a means of ascertaining existence because it has as its object a nonexistent object.

original: med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can du yang mi 'gyur te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can du yang mi 'gyur te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a means of ascertaining nonexistence because it is doubtful.

original: phyir ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The phrase “because of this” is the reason.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di ni tshad ma nyid mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di ni tshad ma nyid mi 'gyur /
translated: This non-apprehension is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with the words, “Non-apprehension, etc.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshad ma dag ni nges pa'i 'bras bu can te yid ches pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dag ni nges pa'i 'bras bu can te yid ches pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because valid cognitions have a definite result, i.e., they are the cause of conviction.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yang rnam pa kun 'dzin pa na 'jug pa'i yul gyi rnam par nges par byed pa gang yin pa de dag la tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yang rnam pa kun 'dzin pa na 'jug pa'i yul gyi rnam par nges par byed pa gang yin pa de dag la tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: When a valid cognition of direct perception apprehends all aspects, it is a valid cognition in regard to the determination of the aspect of the engaged object.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di ni 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med pa nges par byed pa ma yin no /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di ni 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med pa nges par byed pa ma yin no /
translated: But this non-apprehension does not determine the existence or non-existence of anything.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is not so,

original: 'jug pa 'gog pa la tshad mar 'gyur ro zhen bden te //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'gog pa la tshad mar 'gyur ro zhen bden te //
translated: but it is a valid cognition in regard to the cessation of engagement.

original: 'on kyang 'jug pa 'gog pa yin yang sems la the tshom yongs su gcod pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jug pa 'gog pa yin yang sems la the tshom yongs su gcod pa can ma yin no //
translated: But even though it is the cessation of engagement, it does not completely eliminate doubt in the mind.

original: sems gang la the tshom yongs su gcod pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems gang la the tshom yongs su gcod pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in regard to the mind in which there is the complete elimination of doubt” is to be supplied.

original: the tshom za ba yod na gdon mi za bar 'dug par mi bya'o zhes de ltar sems la nges pa med do zhes bya @230b ba'i don to //
analyzed: the tshom za ba yod na gdon mi za bar 'dug par mi bya'o zhes de ltar sems la nges pa med do zhes bya @230b ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “There is no certainty in the mind.”

original: the tshom las kyang 'ga' zhig la zhing pa la sogs pa'i skyes bu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom las kyang 'ga' zhig la zhing pa la sogs pa'i skyes bu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because some people engage in activities, such as farming, even though they are doubtful about the results.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jug pa med pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis 'di tshad mar bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jug pa med pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis 'di tshad mar bshad ce na /
translated: But how can it be a means of valid knowledge if it does not engage in the way things really are?

original: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “If one engages in the way things really are,” etc.

original: de bzhin kho na yin pa la 'jug par byed pa kha na mtho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin kho na yin pa la 'jug par byed pa kha na mtho ba med pa yin no //
translated: There is no fault in engaging in the way things really are.

original: gal te rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tha snyad du byed pa can yin pa de'i phyir nges par ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa don du gnyer bar 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: gal te rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tha snyad du byed pa can yin pa de'i phyir nges par ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa don du gnyer bar 'dod pa la'o //
translated: If one who has previously reflected and who has gone forth on the basis of certainty makes a statement, then, because of the certainty, he engages in the way things really are.

original: mi snang ba'i yul mi dmigs pa de ni mi 'jug 'bras bu can zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i yul mi dmigs pa de ni mi 'jug 'bras bu can zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But the non-perception of an imperceptible object is not a means of valid knowledge, because it does not engage in the way things really are.

original: rtags kyi phul du byung ba yod pa can zhes bya ba la mi dmigs pa'i rtags de phul du byung ba'i khyad par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de yod pa ste /
analyzed: rtags kyi phul du byung ba yod pa can zhes bya ba la mi dmigs pa'i rtags de phul du byung ba'i khyad par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de yod pa ste /
translated: The best of reasons is called “the existence of that which has the character of the perception of a special, superior object.” That non-perception is the best of reasons, and has the character of the perception of a special, superior object.

original: yod pa de nyid de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa de nyid de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That existence is in that which has it, and that is what is meant by “that which has it.”

original: rtags kyi khyad par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has the special character of a reason.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “the non-perception of that which has the character of the perception of a special, superior object” is the same.

original: rtags kyi khyad par las yod pa ste /
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par las yod pa ste /
translated: It exists by virtue of the special character of the reason.

original: skye ba gang la yod pa ste skye ba gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'i don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba gang la yod pa ste skye ba gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'i don ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it exists in any arising, that it exists in any arising.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di las mi dmigs pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di las mi dmigs pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The non-perception does not arise from this special character, “that which has the character of the perception of a special, superior object.”

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: Here, he explains with “here” and so on.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba med pa tha snyad la /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba med pa tha snyad la /
translated: “Here” refers to the convention of non-existence.

original: gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas /
translated: The reason is in dependence on the particular.

original: la lar mer shes 'bras bu can //
analyzed: la lar mer shes 'bras bu can //
translated: and for some, the result of the cognition of fire.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar gong du dper byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar gong du dper byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: As was exemplified above.

original: gang yang mi dmigs pa cang ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni bye brag med par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang mi dmigs pa cang ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni bye brag med par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
translated: And what was said, “There is no non-apprehension at all,” should not be understood as a non-distinction.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bskal pa can ni rang bzhin yin la shes byed ni rtags yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bskal pa can ni rang bzhin yin la shes byed ni rtags yin te /
translated: But the statement, “The nature, etc., is the reason,” means that the nature is the reason for the cognition.

original: de dag mi shes pa ni rang bzhin shes byed mi shes la /
analyzed: de dag mi shes pa ni rang bzhin shes byed mi shes la /
translated: The non-cognition of that is the non-cognition of the nature and the reason.

original: de la med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'di brjod pa yin /🔽rang bzhin mi shes pa ni mngon sum log pa yin la /
analyzed: de la med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'di brjod pa yin / rang bzhin mi shes pa ni mngon sum log pa yin la /
translated: And this is the argument, “There is no valid cognition in the proof of non-existence.”🔽The non-cognition of the nature is the negation of perception.

original: shes byed mi shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa las log pa yin no //
analyzed: shes byed mi shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa las log pa yin no //
translated: The non-cognition of the reason is the negation of inference.

original: mi snang ba'i yul can gyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa la rigs pa 'di brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i yul can gyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa la rigs pa 'di brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: the reason is stated for the non-perception of the object, and for the non-perception of the subject, and for the non-perception of the object and subject.

original: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with “that which,” etc.

original: gang bskal pa'i don 'ga' zhig gi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum gyis mi dmigs te /🔽yul la sogs pas bskal @231a * //
analyzed: gang bskal pa'i don 'ga' zhig gi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum gyis mi dmigs te / yul la sogs pas bskal @231a * //
translated: That which is the object of a certain purpose is not perceived by direct perception, because of the separation of the object, etc.

original: pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is the separation of the object, etc.

original: rang bzhin de ni mi dmigs pa tsam ste de'i yul can gyis mi dmigs pa tsam mngon sum log pa tsam des med pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de ni mi dmigs pa tsam ste de'i yul can gyis mi dmigs pa tsam mngon sum log pa tsam des med pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That nature is merely non-perception, and the subject of that is merely non-perception. Merely by that non-perception of the object and subject, it is not called non-existence.

original: gang du ji skad bshad pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni de ltar bskal pa dag la rang gi nus pa nye ba'i phyir shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang du ji skad bshad pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni de ltar bskal pa dag la rang gi nus pa nye ba'i phyir shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “Where, and as explained,” etc. means that in that way, because of the proximity of the separation, the capacity to generate cognition also does not exist, etc.
