original: rang bzhin mi shes pa zhes bya ba de bshad nas shes byed mi shes pa la zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir /🔽shes par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi shes pa zhes bya ba de bshad nas shes byed mi shes pa la zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir / shes par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Having explained the so-called “ignorance of nature,” in order to explain the so-called “ignorance of the means of knowledge,” he says,

original: shes par byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni rtags las zhes bya ba'o dbang po las 'das pa'i don rnam pa thams cad du dper na sems 'dod chags dang bral ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas spong bar byed do //
analyzed: shes par byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni rtags las zhes bya ba'o dbang po las 'das pa'i don rnam pa thams cad du dper na sems 'dod chags dang bral ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas spong bar byed do //
translated: “The means of knowledge” and so on. The commentary on “the means of knowledge” is “from the reason.” It refutes the assertion that imperceptible objects are in every way, like the mind, devoid of freedom from attachment and so on.

original: de bzhin du shes par byed pa rtags la med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis khyad par spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes par byed pa rtags la med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis khyad par spong bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, it refutes the assertion that the nature of the means of knowledge is to be devoid of the object, because the object does not exist.

original: dper na sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir ni khyad par spong ba yin gyi chos can yod pa nyid tsam ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir ni khyad par spong ba yin gyi chos can yod pa nyid tsam ni ma yin no ;
translated: For example, in “generosity” and so on, it is the distinction that is refuted, not the mere existence of the subject.

original: / sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: / sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Generosity and violence and so on are the terms of the contrast.

original: de'i yul can gyi sems de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi sems de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The mind that has them as its object is called that.

original: sbyin pa'i sems dag la 'tshe ba la sogs pa las ldog pa'i sems dag ces bya ba'i don to /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sems dag la 'tshe ba la sogs pa las ldog pa'i sems dag ces bya ba'i don to / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa /
translated: The meaning of “the minds of generosity” is the minds that turn away from harming and so on.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu khyad par can gyi rgyu nyid du 'dir sems pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo spong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu khyad par can gyi rgyu nyid du 'dir sems pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo spong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The cause of high status is the cause of the special effect in the future. The nature of the minds is not rejected here.

original: de dag ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are direct because they are the cause of high status.

original: 'on kyang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid de rang bzhin gyi khyad par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid de rang bzhin gyi khyad par zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of high status is their special nature.

original: sems pa dag ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid kyang mngon sum nyid yin pa de bas na 'khrul pa 'di gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa dag ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid kyang mngon sum nyid yin pa de bas na 'khrul pa 'di gang las yin zhe na /
translated: The minds are direct because they are the nature of that. The cause of high status is also direct. Therefore, what is the basis of this error?

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Thus, he says, “The meaning of direct” and so on.

original: mngon sum gyi don la phyin ci log pas zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don la phyin ci log pas zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be supplied with “due to a misconception about the meaning of direct perception.”

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu med do zhes de ltar skur pa 'debs par byed na yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu med do zhes de ltar skur pa 'debs par byed na yang ngo //
translated: If one denies that there is a cause for high status, one also denies the existence of the special intention that is the cause of high status.

original: ci ltar phyin ci log pas zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar phyin ci log pas zhe na /
translated: How is this a misconception?

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, “because it is devoid of its effect,” and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa can te mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu med pa can sems pa'i khyad par lung du ma bstan par mtho ba gang yin pa de dag dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa can te mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu med pa can sems pa'i khyad par lung du ma bstan par mtho ba gang yin pa de dag dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The special intention that is the cause of high status is devoid of its effect, the effect of high status.

original: gal te ji ltar chos mthun pa @231b can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar chos mthun pa @231b can yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask how it is similar to that,

original: 'bras bu de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “because it is devoid of an effect that is its immediate consequence.”

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa can gzhan gang las 'bras bu'i de ma thag pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa can gzhan gang las 'bras bu'i de ma thag pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: The special intention that is the cause of high status is devoid of an effect that is its immediate consequence, because another effect of it is not seen.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de ma thag pa mthong ba tsam gyis de med pa nyid de 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de ma thag pa mthong ba tsam gyis de med pa nyid de 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
translated: “By that alone” means that the absence of the effect is not due to the mere non-perception of the effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because the effect is seen to arise from the cause.”

original: 'bras bu dus gzhan phyi ma phyi ma gnas skabs gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis chos pa dag ni rgyu las skyes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dus gzhan phyi ma phyi ma gnas skabs gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis chos pa dag ni rgyu las skyes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect is seen to arise from the cause, which has the characteristic of a state that is different, later than the cause.

original: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa zhes bya ba zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa zhes bya ba zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: “The poison of a mouse and a rabid dog” is a dvandva compound.

original: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa dag gi sos bzung ba'i dug gang yin pa'i sngar 'gyur ba ma mthong ba de las /
analyzed: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa dag gi sos bzung ba'i dug gang yin pa'i sngar 'gyur ba ma mthong ba de las /
translated: The poison that is grasped by the fangs of a mouse and a rabid dog is not seen to change prior to the time of death.

original: dus gzhan du brgyal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du brgyal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the change that has the characteristic of unconsciousness and so on is seen at another time.

original: byi ba'i dug la sogs pa'i phyis 'gyur ba mthong ba las de 'bras bu'i nus pa rjes su dpag par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: byi ba'i dug la sogs pa'i phyis 'gyur ba mthong ba las de 'bras bu'i nus pa rjes su dpag par rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to infer that the effect is the potency of the poison of a mouse and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni shin tu mi rigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid rigs pa yin no zhe na /🔽de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni shin tu mi rigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid rigs pa yin no zhe na / de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But the future result of the intention to give and so on is utterly illogical, so it is logical that it does not exist.🔽Reply: The future result

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems pa dag las ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba 'gal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems pa dag las ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba 'gal ba med pa ste /
translated: arising from the intention to give and so on is not contradictory.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: bsgrub par bya ba 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa med pa 'di la mi dmigs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa med pa 'di la mi dmigs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Mere nonobservation is not a valid cognition that refutes the future result arising from the intention to give and so on.

original: gal te gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir spong ba ni yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir spong ba ni yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the future result does not arise from the intention to give and so on because there is no valid cognition that contradicts it,

original: yod pa nyid la tshad ma gang yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid la tshad ma gang yin te /
translated: then what is the valid cognition that ascertains its existence?

original: tshad ma med pa de bas na yod pa nyid du nges pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma med pa de bas na yod pa nyid du nges pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since there is no valid cognition, it is illogical to ascertain its existence.

original: gnod pa can dang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de'i phyir the tshom za ba yin yang bla ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa can dang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de'i phyir the tshom za ba yin yang bla ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is better to have doubt, he says.

original: spong ba ni rnam pa thams cad du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spong ba ni rnam pa thams cad du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to abandon it in any way.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa la tshad ma yang srid pa'i phyir mi spong ngo //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa la tshad ma yang srid pa'i phyir mi spong ngo //
translated: Since it is possible that the mind free from attachment and omniscience are valid cognitions, they are not abandoned.

original: srid pa'i tshad ma de yang le'u gnyis pa las bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i tshad ma de yang le'u gnyis pa las bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that valid cognition of existence will be established in the second chapter.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /🔽'di ltar sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba las ldog pa'i sems pa dag la mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yod pa de'i tshe de dag gzung ba na de yang gzung bar 'gyur na gang bzung ba na gang ma bzung ba gang yin pa de ni de'i rang
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / 'di ltar sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba las ldog pa'i sems pa dag la mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yod pa de'i tshe de dag gzung ba na de yang gzung bar 'gyur na gang bzung ba na gang ma bzung ba gang yin pa de ni de'i rang
translated: This is how it is.

original: bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: When the intention to give and the intention to refrain from harming have the nature of causes of high rebirth, then when they are apprehended, that is also apprehended. But it is not reasonable that what is not apprehended when something is apprehended is the nature of that.

original: de nyid gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin la lha nyid kyi khyad par la sogs pa yang ci ste yod na /
analyzed: de nyid gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin la lha nyid kyi khyad par la sogs pa yang ci ste yod na /
translated: If the attributes of the deity and so on do exist,

original: de dag gis gdon mi za bar don gyi bya ba 'ga' zhig byed na /
analyzed: de dag gis gdon mi za bar don gyi bya ba 'ga' zhig byed na /
translated: then they would certainly perform some function.🔽But since they do not appear, they do not perform a function.

original: mi snang ba de bas na don gyi bya ba mi byed pa'i @232a * //🔽phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa de nyid gnod pa can gyi tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi snang ba de bas na don gyi bya ba mi byed pa'i @232a * // phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa de nyid gnod pa can gyi tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, their existence is not established. That is the valid cognition that contradicts them.🔽Therefore, etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /🔽de bas na zhes bya ba ni dag nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la / de bas na zhes bya ba ni dag nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: Therefore is a particle that introduces the following.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: Here means “specifically.”

original: bskal pa'i don 'das ma thag pa de dag gi nang nas so //
analyzed: bskal pa'i don 'das ma thag pa de dag gi nang nas so //
translated: From among those just mentioned, the meaning of which is beyond dispute.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.

original: don nam rang gi ngo bo 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzhung gi rim pa yin pa de ltar na ci rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: don nam rang gi ngo bo 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzhung gi rim pa yin pa de ltar na ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.🔽With regard to some object or nature means that, in accordance with the order of the text, one should connect this with whatever is appropriate.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la shes pa med pa ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la shes pa med pa ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: With regard to some

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no clear seeing.

original: yul de nyams su myong ba la ji ltar gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nges par bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de nyams su myong ba la ji ltar gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nges par bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the experience of that object does not generate the capacity to ascertain the nature of the object as it is apprehended.

original: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal ba'i don 'ga' zhig la shes par byed pa 'bras bu de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal ba'i don 'ga' zhig la shes par byed pa 'bras bu de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the result that is the means of understanding is absent in some object that is separated from the object by intrinsic nature, etc.

original: shes par byed pa ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The means of understanding is not established.

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu nyid med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu nyid med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the result itself absent?

original: rgyu rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement “causes, etc.”

original: rgyu rnams kyis ni dus thams cad du skyes bu thams cad kyis gzung bar bya ba bdag nyid shes par byed pa 'bras bu gdon mi za bar brtsam par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyis ni dus thams cad du skyes bu thams cad kyis gzung bar bya ba bdag nyid shes par byed pa 'bras bu gdon mi za bar brtsam par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that causes do not necessarily produce the result that is the means of understanding, which is the nature that is apprehended by all persons at all times.

original: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa de dag ni don byed pas stong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa de dag ni don byed pas stong pa ma yin te /
translated: Those that are separated from the object by intrinsic nature, etc., are not empty of the capacity to perform a function.

original: tshu rol mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa ma yin pa ni don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa ma yin pa ni don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the operation of the meaning.

original: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i shes par byed pa med pas /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i shes par byed pa med pas /
translated: This much refers to the absence of the means of knowing as previously explained.

original: de med par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de med par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that it is nonexistent because of the absence of that,

original: dbang po las 'das pa lha nyid kyi khyad par dang / mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi khyad par dag med pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa lha nyid kyi khyad par dang / mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi khyad par dag med pa yin te /
translated: that is, because of the absence of the special nature of the deity that is beyond the senses and the special nature of the cause of prosperity, etc.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag log pa tsam gyis med pa nyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag log pa tsam gyis med pa nyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not contradictory that something is nonexistent merely because of the absence of perception and inference.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po las 'das pa dag la shes par byed pa med do zhes bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po las 'das pa dag la shes par byed pa med do zhes bstan par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot demonstrate that there is no means of knowing the special nature of the deity that is beyond the senses as previously explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang go rims bzhin du 'ga' zhig la mngon par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang go rims bzhin du 'ga' zhig la mngon par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is manifest to some in the proper order.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar yang la lar mtho ba dang dman pa'i phyir mthong ba'i rang bzhin nges pa med pa la yang de gsal ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba nges par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar yang la lar mtho ba dang dman pa'i phyir mthong ba'i rang bzhin nges pa med pa la yang de gsal ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba nges par byed de /
translated: Thus, even though the nature of seeing is not ascertained, because it is sometimes high and sometimes low, it is ascertained by the appearance of clarity, etc.

original: dper na drug la sogs pa'i rdzas goms pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na drug la sogs pa'i rdzas goms pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the substance of the six, etc., which are cultivated.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad la yang rab tu gsal bar byed pa 'byung ba can dag mngon par gsal bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad la yang rab tu gsal bar byed pa 'byung ba can dag mngon par gsal bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that the appearance of clarity, etc., occurs in all giving, etc.

original: @232b rnal 'byor sgrub pa las srid pa'i tshad ma 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @232b rnal 'byor sgrub pa las srid pa'i tshad ma 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The measure of existence will be explained in the context of the practice of yoga.

original: de bzhin du sa bon 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa 'ga' zhig gi dus gzhan du 'bras bu tshad ma mngon par gsal bar snang ba de ltar dbang po las 'das pa dag la yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bon 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa 'ga' zhig gi dus gzhan du 'bras bu tshad ma mngon par gsal bar snang ba de ltar dbang po las 'das pa dag la yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the appearance of the result of a seed, which is not the beginning of the result, is ascertained at another time. In that way, it should be understood that the result of imperceptible things is ascertained.

original: 'di ltar 'dra ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la bdag gi yul can gyi shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dra ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la bdag gi yul can gyi shes pa'am /
translated: Thus, in some cases, the cognition of the object is ascertained by the appearance of clarity, etc., or by the appearance of the result, etc.

original: rims la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed do //
translated: It produces effects such as fever.

original: de bas na bskal pa dag la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni med pa nyid /
analyzed: de bas na bskal pa dag la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni med pa nyid /
translated: Therefore, in the case of kalpana, the non-apprehension of the nature is not a proof of non-existence,

original: sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhing 'bras bu mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhing 'bras bu mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is the non-apprehension of the effect.

original: de la rgyu mi dmigs pa ni med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mi dmigs pa ni med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the non-apprehension of the cause is a proof of non-existence,

original: rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, “The non-apprehension of the cause, etc.

original: rgyu mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu mi shes pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause,

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis bskal pa can gyi yang /
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis bskal pa can gyi yang /
translated: the non-apprehension of the nature of the cause, is a proof of the non-existence of the effect, even though it is naturally separate from it.

original: med pa nyid ni sgrub byed yin /
analyzed: med pa nyid ni sgrub byed yin /
translated: The non-existence is the probandum.

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “own nature, etc.”

original: bskal pa'i yul gyi ngo bo med pa bsgrub par bya ba la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid ni tshad mar mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: bskal pa'i yul gyi ngo bo med pa bsgrub par bya ba la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid ni tshad mar mi brjod kyi /
translated: In the proof of the non-existence of the nature of a separate object, the non-apprehension of the nature itself is not said to be a valid means of knowledge.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Only the non-apprehension of the cause is a valid means of knowledge.

original: bskal pa'i yul la rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid kyis nges par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bskal pa'i yul la rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid kyis nges par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it impossible to ascertain that the object is excluded by the non-apprehension of the cause?

original: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa dag ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid nges par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa dag ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid nges par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the excluded things such as the intrinsic nature, etc., do not ascertain the state of being cause and effect with anything.

original: de ni bden te 'on kyang ma bstan pa'i yul med pa tsam rtogs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa rang bzhin la sogs pa bskal pa'i 'bras bu yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes de tsam du bstan par nus te /
analyzed: de ni bden te 'on kyang ma bstan pa'i yul med pa tsam rtogs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa rang bzhin la sogs pa bskal pa'i 'bras bu yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes de tsam du bstan par nus te /
translated: That is true, but still, because the mere non-existence of an object that is not taught is understood, it is possible to teach just this much: “Even the effect of the excluded things such as the intrinsic nature, etc., is not necessarily without a cause.”

original: cha 'di tsam gyis rgyu nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: cha 'di tsam gyis rgyu nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: This much is the arrangement of the cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyi gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyi gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that very reason, he says, “What is the universal?”

original: 'di ltar bskal pa dag la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni ma bstan pa'i yul can yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bskal pa dag la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni ma bstan pa'i yul can yin du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although the non-apprehension of the intrinsic nature in the excluded things has an object that is not taught,

original: rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not possible to establish it.

original: la lar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The line Some say... and so forth is from another source.

original: gnas khang la sogs par me shir zin kyang du ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar na rgyu zhig tu zin kyang /
analyzed: gnas khang la sogs par me shir zin kyang du ba mthong ba'i phyir ro // de ltar na rgyu zhig tu zin kyang /
translated: Some say that the reason is not established, because even when the fire has gone out, smoke is still seen in the house, etc.

original: 'bras bu mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is a mistake to say that the effect is seen when the cause has already ceased.

original: rgyu med par 'bras bu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rgyu gnas pa'i dus na 'bras bu yod pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'bras bu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rgyu gnas pa'i dus na 'bras bu yod pa ste /
translated: The statement “An effect does not occur without a cause” means that the effect exists at the time the cause exists.

original: ji srid rgyu yod pa de srid du 'bras bu yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid rgyu yod pa de srid du 'bras bu yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that as long as the cause exists, the effect exists.

original: de skad du mi smra ste /🔽gang gi rgyu zhig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad du mi smra ste / gang gi rgyu zhig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: We do not say that.

original: @233a * // rgyu las cig car skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu zhig na yang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @233a * // rgyu las cig car skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu zhig na yang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consequence of the statement “When the cause has ceased” is that the effect arises simultaneously with the cause, because the effect exists at another time when the cause has ceased.

original: 'o na tshig 'dis ci brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na tshig 'dis ci brjod ce na /
translated: What does this statement mean?

original: rgyu med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement “An effect does not occur without a cause” means that

original: 'di ltar gzhung 'dis dngos po de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis chos pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhung 'dis dngos po de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis chos pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Thus, this treatise explains that although the passage “Things do not exist in reality” and so on,

original: don gyi dbang gis de ltar sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis de ltar sbyar ba yin no //
translated: it is applied in that way in terms of the meaning.

original: de ltar re zhig bstan pa nyid du khas blangs nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bstan pa nyid du khas blangs nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having accepted that as the teaching, it is explained.

original: dngos po skad cig ma yin pa de bas na rgyu zhig pa'i 'bras bu gnas pa dag med do zhes bya ba gang la 'khrul pa the tshom za /
analyzed: dngos po skad cig ma yin pa de bas na rgyu zhig pa'i 'bras bu gnas pa dag med do zhes bya ba gang la 'khrul pa the tshom za /
translated: Since things are momentary, how could there be any error or doubt that the effect endures when the cause has disintegrated?

original: 'di ltar mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de me zhig pa na gnas pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de me zhig pa na gnas pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the momentariness of smoke generated by fire does not endure when the fire has disintegrated.

original: mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa yod pa de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa yod pa de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: When the second moment of smoke generated by fire exists,

original: rgyur gyur pa'i me'i skad cig pa gsum pa la du ba'i skad cig ma yang 'jig pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i me'i skad cig pa gsum pa la du ba'i skad cig ma yang 'jig pa de ltar na /
translated: at that time the third moment of fire that is the cause of smoke disintegrates.

original: gang las rgyu las rgyu 'jig pa'i phyis 'bras bu gnas pa yin /
analyzed: gang las rgyu las rgyu 'jig pa'i phyis 'bras bu gnas pa yin /
translated: Thus, how could the effect endure after the disintegration of the cause?

original: gang yang phyis 'bras bu gzhag pa can gyi du ba ni du ba'i rtags can nyid kyi me'i rtags can ma yin pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang phyis 'bras bu gzhag pa can gyi du ba ni du ba'i rtags can nyid kyi me'i rtags can ma yin pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the later smoke which is the basis of the effect is only the evidence of smoke and not the evidence of fire, he says,

original: dngos po de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: dngos po de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: “That entity which is thus . . .”

original: de ltar gnas pa can zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rgyu zhig na yang dus phyis gnas pa can te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa can zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rgyu zhig na yang dus phyis gnas pa can te /
translated: “Which is thus situated” means that even though the prior cause has ceased, it is situated later in time.

original: de'i rgyu can ni rgyu sngar 'gag pa'i nye bar len pa can ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can ni rgyu sngar 'gag pa'i nye bar len pa can ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Which has that as its cause” means that it is the appropriator of the prior cessation of the cause.

original: 'o na ji ltar du ba phyis 'byung ba me'i rgyu can yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar du ba phyis 'byung ba me'i rgyu can yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Well, then, how can it be said that the later arising smoke has fire as its cause?

original: brgyud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brgyud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Through a continuum . . .”

original: re zhig du ba'i skad cig ma dang po ni me nyid kyis skyed par byed la du pa'i skad cig ma nges kyang gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar brgyud pas so //
analyzed: re zhig du ba'i skad cig ma dang po ni me nyid kyis skyed par byed la du pa'i skad cig ma nges kyang gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar brgyud pas so //
translated: The first moment of smoke is produced by fire itself, and the other moments of smoke are produced by the prior moment of smoke. In this way, through a continuum.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgyun la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgyun la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says, “Because it assists the continuum.”

original: thog mar rgyun skyed par byed pa'i phyir de 'bras bu bstan pa te /
analyzed: thog mar rgyun skyed par byed pa'i phyir de 'bras bu bstan pa te /
translated: The result is taught in order to generate the continuum in the beginning.

original: rgyu dang po de'i phyi ma dag kyang 'bras bu yin no zhes de ltar tha snyad du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang po de'i phyi ma dag kyang 'bras bu yin no zhes de ltar tha snyad du byas pa'o //
translated: The subsequent causes are also results. Thus, the convention is made in this way.

original: gal te rgyu'i tshad ma rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis med pa grub pa de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i tshad ma rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis med pa grub pa de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: If nonexistence is established by some sort of valid knowledge of a cause, then at that time, its result,

original: rgyu bkag par gyur pa de'i 'bras bu yod do zhes nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu bkag par gyur pa de'i 'bras bu yod do zhes nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the negation of the cause, is not ascertained as existent.

original: 'di ni ; gal te gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: 'di ni ; gal te gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: This is the explanation of the verse:🔽If nonexistence is understood by some sort of reason,

original: de med pa ni rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de med pa ni rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: then existence is understood by some sort of valid knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'chad par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'chad par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: This is the explanation of the verse.

original: 'di ni sgrub par byed par 'dod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub par byed par 'dod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the desire to prove.

original: ma bstan pa'i yul can ni de ltar ltos par bya ba ma @233b yin te /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i yul can ni de ltar ltos par bya ba ma @233b yin te /
translated: The subject that is not taught is not to be viewed in this way, because

original: gal te rgyu med na yang 'bras bu yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med na yang 'bras bu yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: if the cause does not exist, the result also does not exist without a doubt.

original: rgyu med par dngos po 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de tsam ni bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par dngos po 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de tsam ni bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere fact that it is impossible for a thing to occur without a cause is taught.

original: de yang de ma thag pa nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang de ma thag pa nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: And that has just been explained.

original: don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin rtags can te med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin rtags can te med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: As for the meaning of “object” and so on, the object is the pervader, the evidence is the property of the subject, and the probandum is the absence of the pervader.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang ste /
translated: The non-observation of the property of the subject is also the proof of the absence of the pervader.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The non-observation of the pervader is also the proof of the absence of the pervaded.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: As for the meaning of “own nature” and so on, the explanation is as follows. “ Some” refers to the non-observation of the pervader.

original: gal te khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa na khyab par bya ba 'dod pa 'di'i rang bzhin grub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa na khyab par bya ba 'dod pa 'di'i rang bzhin grub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the non-observation of the pervader establishes the absence of the pervaded, then at that time it becomes valid cognition.

original: gal te gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gis te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gis te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya bas /
translated: If the non-existence of that is understood from some reason,

original: de med pa ni rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de med pa ni rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: then the non-existence of the effect or the pervader is established.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'chad pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of “if” and so on is explained.

original: gal te rgyu 'di med pa grub par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'di med pa grub par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If the non-existence of this cause is established, then the non-existence of the effect or the pervader is established.

original: khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig las med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig las med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no other reason that makes one understand the pervader.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-apprehension of what has the characteristic of being apprehended.

original: de ltar na dgag pa la go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dgag pa la go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa tsam ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason that makes one understand a negation is not mere non-apprehension.

original: rgyu'am khyab par byed pa de ni go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs las med pa nyid du grub pas go rims bzhin du 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba ldog par byed de //
analyzed: rgyu'am khyab par byed pa de ni go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs las med pa nyid du grub pas go rims bzhin du 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba ldog par byed de //
translated: Since the cause or the pervader is established as non-existent from the reason that makes one understand, the effect or the pervaded is negated in order.

original: de med par ma grub na ste /
analyzed: de med par ma grub na ste /
translated: If that non-existence is not established,🔽then the non-existence of the effect or the pervaded is not established.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ma grub na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba ldog pa la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ma grub na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba ldog pa la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Because if the cause and the pervader are not established, there is doubt about the reversal of the effect and the pervaded.

original: de yang gong du ji skad du bshad pa'i bstan pa'i yul can gyi med pa sgrub par byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gong du ji skad du bshad pa'i bstan pa'i yul can gyi med pa sgrub par byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be seen that this is a proof of non-existence, the object of which is the teaching as explained above.

original: gal te rang bzhin med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la de mi dmigs pa nyid tshad ma yin par ma brjod dam /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la de mi dmigs pa nyid tshad ma yin par ma brjod dam /
translated: If the non-existence of intrinsic nature is the probandum, isn't it said that non-apprehension of that is the valid cognition?

original: ji ltar na de bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid mi dmigs pa las med pa grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid mi dmigs pa las med pa grub ce na /
translated: How is it that non-existence is established from non-apprehension of the nature of things such as pots?

original: len du mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: len du mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, it is said: If it is seen... and so on.

original: bskal pa'i yul nyid la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bskal pa'i yul nyid la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of the summary is that non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is not a valid cognition with respect to an unrestricted object,

original: snang ba la ni yin zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba la ni yin zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: but it is with respect to an appearance.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang bzhin la sogs pas ma bskal pa bstan to //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang bzhin la sogs pas ma bskal pa bstan to //
translated: By appearance here, it is shown that it is unrestricted by intrinsic nature and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi @234a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi @234a * //
translated: Such a kind of...

original: dngos po de ni mi dmigs pa yod pa'i dngos po med pa ste yod pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po de ni mi dmigs pa yod pa'i dngos po med pa ste yod pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That thing is the non-existence of the existent thing that is not perceived.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na mthong ba med pa dag gi rgyu mi srid par ni 'gyur ba na mthong ba med pa'i rgyu ste rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba de mi srid par 'gyur ba na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na mthong ba med pa dag gi rgyu mi srid par ni 'gyur ba na mthong ba med pa'i rgyu ste rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba de mi srid par 'gyur ba na ste /
translated: When? When the non-perception of the cause is not possible, when the non-perception of the cause, i.e., the incompleteness of the other conditions, is not possible.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshogs par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshogs par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: when the other condition, the objective support, is complete.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “If, etc.”

original: bdag nyid go bar byed cing rtogs par byed pas na dngos po'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid go bar byed cing rtogs par byed pas na dngos po'o //
translated: A thing is that which causes one to understand and realize oneself.

original: gal te rang bzhin la sogs pas ma bskal pas rang bzhin gyi khyad par du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin la sogs pas ma bskal pas rang bzhin gyi khyad par du 'gyur na /
translated: If it becomes a special nature by not being excluded by its own nature, etc.,

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa po ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa po ste /
translated: it is the one who apprehends just as it is.

original: gang zhig gang gis 'dzin pa po'i dbang po des dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis 'dzin pa po'i dbang po des dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is apprehended by that sense faculty of the apprehender becomes the object.

original: 'dis ni snang ba'i zhes bya ba de rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni snang ba'i zhes bya ba de rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains “illumination,” etc.

original: de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i gegs byed pa can te /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i gegs byed pa can te /
translated: Moreover, it is an obstruction to the perception of the thing as it has been explained.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu la gnod par byed pa can no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu la gnod par byed pa can no //
translated: It is an obstruction to the cause that generates consciousness.

original: bar chad la sogs pa dag ces bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni ma tshang ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar chad la sogs pa dag ces bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni ma tshang ba gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “obstruction, etc.” includes incompleteness.

original: gags byed pa la sogs pa med pa ste dmigs pa'i rkyen dag yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gags byed pa la sogs pa med pa ste dmigs pa'i rkyen dag yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if the objective conditions are not obstructed, etc.

original: dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: It is just the object that is perceived,

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: not something else.

original: de ltar bur gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni med do zhes nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bur gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni med do zhes nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the non-perception of what has become such is ascertained as non-existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de 'dra bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Because of being like that,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yod na dmigs pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yod na dmigs pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error in the perception of the object if it exists with the characteristic of being perceived.

original: gang 'di nyid ni rang gi ngo bo med par nges pa na mthong ba med pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs 'di nyid bshad par bya ba rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di nyid ni rang gi ngo bo med par nges pa na mthong ba med pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs 'di nyid bshad par bya ba rigs par bya'o //
translated: When this very non-existence of intrinsic reality is ascertained, the statement “by those who do not see” and so on should be understood as explaining the reasoning.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang la zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang la zhe na /
translated: With respect to what is to be established?

original: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa dag med pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa dag med pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la yang ngo //
translated: Also with respect to the probandum that is the absence of cause and the absence of that which makes a difference.

original: dngos po 'gal ba yod na yang //
analyzed: dngos po 'gal ba yod na yang //
translated: Even when there is an existent that is contradictory

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan dang sbyar te /
translated: The word “also” is connected with another sequence:

original: de dang 'gal ba dmigs na yang zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba dmigs na yang zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: “When there is the observation of that which is contradictory with it” should be seen.

original: gang med pa bsgrub par bya ba de dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de dmigs pa med pa nyid de dgag par bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang med pa bsgrub par bya ba de dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de dmigs pa med pa nyid de dgag par bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is the observation of that which is contradictory with that which is the nonexistent probandum, it is just the non-observation, and the object of negation becomes nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po 'gal ba yod na ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'gal ba yod na ni //
translated: Because when there is an existent that is contradictory

original: de yod pa la gnod byed phyir te /
analyzed: de yod pa la gnod byed phyir te /
translated: it is because it is the harm to its existence.

original: dgag par bya bar 'dod pa de nyid yod pa nyid la gnod par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgag par bya bar 'dod pa de nyid yod pa nyid la gnod par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it undermines the existence of that very thing which is to be refuted.

original: gnyi ga lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because the two do not coexist.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “because of the mutual incompatibility of their bases,” etc.

original: dngos po gang zhig bdag nyid 'gal ba gang dang @234b lhan cig mi gnas te /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig bdag nyid 'gal ba gang dang @234b lhan cig mi gnas te /
translated: Whatever thing is incompatible with whatever thing does not coexist with it,

original: dper na grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the sensation of cold and the sensation of heat.

original: ci'i phyir mi gnas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi gnas she na /
translated: Why do they not coexist?

original: de dag gi nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says, “because of the mutual incompatibility of their bases,” etc.

original: 'gal ba de dag gi nye bar len pa gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun gcig la gcig mi mthun pa gang yin pa de'i rten yin pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'gal ba de dag gi nye bar len pa gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun gcig la gcig mi mthun pa gang yin pa de'i rten yin pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The bases of those incompatible things are mutually incompatible.

original: dro ba'i nye bar len pa ni grong ba'i nye bar len pa dang mi mthun pa'i rten yin pas so //
analyzed: dro ba'i nye bar len pa ni grong ba'i nye bar len pa dang mi mthun pa'i rten yin pas so //
translated: The basis of the sensation of heat is incompatible with the basis of the sensation of cold.

original: de bas gcig gis kyang cig shos kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas gcig gis kyang cig shos kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, one does not coexist with the other.

original: rgyu des grang ba dang dro ba 'gal ba dag gis 'bras bu dag ni gcig la yang cig car rtsom pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu des grang ba dang dro ba 'gal ba dag gis 'bras bu dag ni gcig la yang cig car rtsom pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that cause, it is contradictory for the effects of cold and heat to be produced simultaneously in one thing.

original: sngar mi dmigs pa'i rab tu byed ba 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa grang ba dang dro ba 'gal ba de dag ni gcig yod na yang gzhan med🔽pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar mi dmigs pa'i rab tu byed ba 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa grang ba dang dro ba 'gal ba de dag ni gcig yod na yang gzhan med pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the previous chapter on non-apprehension, it was explained that “here there is no cold touch because there is fire,” and so on. The aspects of cold and heat that are contradictory are understood to be absent when the other is present.

original: ci ste yang 'dir mi dmigs pa zhes ma thos pa de ltar na yang rang bzhin 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i rtags ni mi dmigs pa las tha dad par brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang 'dir mi dmigs pa zhes ma thos pa de ltar na yang rang bzhin 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i rtags ni mi dmigs pa las tha dad par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if non-apprehension is not heard here in this way, the reason called “contradictory nature” should not be stated separately from non-apprehension.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs pa de nyid las 'gal ba rtogs pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba las kyang med pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de nyid las 'gal ba rtogs pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba las kyang med pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because contradiction is understood from that very non-apprehension, and because non-existence is established from contradiction.

original: 'gal ba yang ji ltar nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ji ltar nges par 'gyur /
translated: How is contradiction also ascertained?

original: gal te dmigs pa na cig shos mi dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa na cig shos mi dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is perceived, the other is not perceived.

original: de lta ma yin na cig shos dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na cig shos dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro /
translated: If it were not so, then the perception of the other would not be blocked, and nonexistence would not be established.

original: de ltar na don gyis 'gal 'grub pa na mi dmigs pa kho na rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don gyis 'gal 'grub pa na mi dmigs pa kho na rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the meaning of contradiction is established, nonapprehension alone is applied.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa ste snang ba'i yul mi dmigs pa las med pa rtogs par 'gyur ba de bas 'di tshad ma yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa ste snang ba'i yul mi dmigs pa las med pa rtogs par 'gyur ba de bas 'di tshad ma yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: Therefore, it is best if this is a means of valid cognition, since the nonexistence of an object of appearance of that kind is understood from the nonapprehension of that object.

original: de yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma gzhan kho na yin no zhes bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma gzhan kho na yin no zhes bsams pa'o ;
translated: Moreover, it is not inference, but rather it is just another means of valid cognition.

original: ; ji ltar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi'o //🔽dpe la ltos pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: ; ji ltar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi'o // dpe la ltos pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: How could it not be so? This is the master’s response.🔽Because it does not rely on an example. This is the opponent’s response.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dpe la ltos pa yin te rjes su dpag pa 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dpe la ltos pa yin te rjes su dpag pa 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Inference relies on an example, because it goes and returns.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni ma yin pa de bas na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni ma yin pa de bas na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that, therefore, because it does not have the characteristics of inference, it is not inference.

original: dpe la ltos pa med pa nyid 'di la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dpe la ltos pa med pa nyid 'di la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, he says, “This non-reliance on an example,” and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: “In this” refers to non-apprehension.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyi yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyi yin te /
translated: The master’s response begins with “Why?” and so on.

original: dpe nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is an example.

original: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The opponent’s response begins with “That,” and so on.

original: de ni @235a * //
analyzed: de ni @235a * //
translated: That refers to

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: sky-flowers and so on.

original: med pa zhes bya ba ji ltar tshad ma gang gis khong du chud par bya zhing gang gis de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ji ltar tshad ma gang gis khong du chud par bya zhing gang gis de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can non-existence be understood by any valid cognition, and how can it be like that?

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med pa bsgrub par bya ba la dper 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med pa bsgrub par bya ba la dper 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that in establishing non-existence by the reason of non-apprehension, it is an example.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa'i rtags kho na las nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa khong du chud par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa'i rtags kho na las nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa khong du chud par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you understand that the sky flower and so on are only non-apprehended reasons,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa la'o //
translated: then in regard to that, that is, in regard to the sky flower and so on,

original: ji ltar dpe med pa can dag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dpe med pa can dag ste /
translated: how can you have an example?

original: med pa nyid ma grub pa can gang la dpe yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid ma grub pa can gang la dpe yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word “how” is to be connected with the phrase “for those who have no established non-existence.”

original: ci ste 'di la yang dpe gzhan yod pa de'i tshe nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa nyid ma grub pa de dpe dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste 'di la yang dpe gzhan yod pa de'i tshe nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa nyid ma grub pa de dpe dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you say that there is another example for this, then when the non-existence of the sky flower and so on is not established, it is itself an example, and it follows that there is an infinite regress,

original: de la yang dpe gzhan dang dpe gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang dpe gzhan dang dpe gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in regard to that there is another example and another example.

original: thug pa med pa yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: thug pa med pa yin pa de lta na /
translated: If there is an infinite regress,

original: gcig kyang ma grub na thams cad la rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang ma grub na thams cad la rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then if even one is not established, all are not apprehended.

original: de bas na thug pa med pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir dpe 'gyur ba nye bar brjod pa med pa med par grub pa dpe med pa can bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thug pa med pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir dpe 'gyur ba nye bar brjod pa med pa med par grub pa dpe med pa can bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to avoid the fault of infinite regress, the example should be without a figurative expression, without a non-existent, and without an example.

original: de bas na gzhan la yang ste 'di na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i pa'i mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la yag /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan la yang ste 'di na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i pa'i mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la yag /
translated: Therefore, in other cases as well, where the object of observation is not observed, the application is: because of the non-observation of the nature of the observed.

original: dpe la ltos pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe la ltos pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not depend on an example, non-observation is not inference.

original: slob dpon gyis thos su zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis thos su zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Master says, “Even if one hears . . . ” and so on.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la med pa bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la med pa bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in the case of the non-observation of a nature, it is not that non-existence is established,

original: 'on kyang med pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: but rather, it is the convention of non-existence. This has been explained many times.

original: de bas na thos su zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bas na thos su zin kyang ngo //
translated: Therefore, even if one hears . . .

original: glen pa'i ming ni lha dang lhar 'gyur skye dgu'i bdag ces bya ba gsum gsungs pa de bas na /
analyzed: glen pa'i ming ni lha dang lhar 'gyur skye dgu'i bdag ces bya ba gsum gsungs pa de bas na /
translated: The names of the fools are said to be the three: Deva, Deva-bhūta, and Prajāpati.

original: lha rnams dga' ba ste glen pa dag gis nges pa gzung ba gsal ba med pa gang gis dpe yod du zin kyang de ma grub par rgol te /
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba ste glen pa dag gis nges pa gzung ba gsal ba med pa gang gis dpe yod du zin kyang de ma grub par rgol te /
translated: If the reason is not established, then even if an example is given, the opponent will argue that it is not established.

original: gal te 'dir med pa grub par bya ba la dpe ma grub par ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir med pa grub par bya ba la dpe ma grub par ni 'gyur na /
translated: If the nonexistence of sound were to be established, then the example would not be established.

original: 'on kyang med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: However, the expression of nonexistence is established.

original: med pa'i tha snyad de nyid bsgrub byar bstan pa'i phyir sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad de nyid bsgrub byar bstan pa'i phyir sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan te /
translated: In order to show that the expression of nonexistence itself is the probandum, he says “sound” and so on. The reason for the expression of nonexistence is the nonobservation of the observed object.

original: rgyu dmigs pa mi dmigs pa snang ba mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid thag nye ste /
analyzed: rgyu dmigs pa mi dmigs pa snang ba mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid thag nye ste /
translated: That is itself proximate, because it is itself proximate.

original: rang nyid thag nye ba'i phyir bdag mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu mtshan can te /
analyzed: rang nyid thag nye ba'i phyir bdag mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu mtshan can te /
translated: Those that have the nature of the nonobservation of the self are those that have their own reason.

original: med pa'i tha snyad de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir @235b thams cad ni 'dir dpe yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir @235b thams cad ni 'dir dpe yin no //
translated: In order to establish those expressions of nonexistence, everything here is an example.

original: rang gi rgyu mtshan gyi tshogs pa rung ba thag nye ba can ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu mtshan gyi tshogs pa rung ba thag nye ba can ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the sort of assemblage of its own reasons that is proximate?

original: myu gu la sogs pa gang la rang gi rgyu mtshan gyi tshogs pa rung ba thag nye ba de yod pa dang ba lang gi tha snyad la sogs pa gang la lkog shal la sogs pa gong bu'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa gang la rang gi rgyu mtshan gyi tshogs pa rung ba thag nye ba de yod pa dang ba lang gi tha snyad la sogs pa gang la lkog shal la sogs pa gong bu'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is said to exist in whatever, such as a sprout, has a proximate assemblage of its own reasons, and in whatever, such as the convention “cow,” has a reason for a whole, such as a dewlap.

original: sbyor ba yang gang la gang gi rgyu mtshan gyi tshogs pa gags med pa can yod pa de la der 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang la gang gi rgyu mtshan gyi tshogs pa gags med pa can yod pa de la der 'gyur te /
translated: The application is: Whatever has an unobstructed assemblage of reasons for something is that.

original: dper na gang cung zhig rgyu mtshan tshogs pa gags med pa can gzhan lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gang cung zhig rgyu mtshan tshogs pa gags med pa can gzhan lta bu'o //
translated: For example, whatever has an unobstructed assemblage of reasons for something else is that.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na yang med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na yang med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Even if there is a reason for non-apprehension that is the characteristic of apprehension, there is the convention of non-existence. This is a reason of nature.

original: 'dir yang ci'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad kho na sgrub par byed kyi med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang ci'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad kho na sgrub par byed kyi med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only the expression of non-existence is established here, and not non-existence itself?

original: med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Non-existence itself is not established, etc.”

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du snang ba mi dmigs pa 'di la med pa nyid mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du snang ba mi dmigs pa 'di la med pa nyid mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: As previously explained, in this non-apprehension of appearance, there is only the non-apprehension of non-existence.

original: de bas na 'dir med pa bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir med pa bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, here non-existence is not established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between what is to be established and the proof.

original: gang gis 'di med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis 'di med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is by this very means that the expression of non-existence is established, this non-apprehension of appearance is included within the natural reason.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa'i rgyu las med pa'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa'i rgyu las med pa'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: The result of the expression of non-existence, which is the cause of the non-apprehension of appearance, is inferred.

original: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang la yod pa zhes spyir gzhan gyi tshig can du bstan nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang la yod pa zhes spyir gzhan gyi tshig can du bstan nas /
translated: Having generally indicated that the definition of that is “that which has the nature of being other,”

original: phyis dngos po'o rkyen bya'o //
analyzed: phyis dngos po'o rkyen bya'o //
translated: he says, “the effect is the reason.”

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bud med kyi rtags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bud med kyi rtags su 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because the effect would have the nature of being an inference, it would be a sign of a woman.

original: rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa rung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa rung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The suitability of inferring an effect from a collection of causes is an inference.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba le'u bzhi pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba le'u bzhi pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained in Chapter Four that it is included within autonomous reasons.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dpe grub par 'gyur na mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dpe grub par 'gyur na mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: If the non-apprehension of appearance is established as an example, how is the non-apprehension of non-appearance established?

original: yod pa'i sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The word ‘exists’ and so on,”

original: yul la sogs pa bskal ba dag la tshad ma log pas yod pa'i sgra dang tha snyad 'gog pa la /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa bskal ba dag la tshad ma log pas yod pa'i sgra dang tha snyad 'gog pa la /
translated: and so on refers to the negation of the word “exists” and the convention “exists” in regard to objects and so on, because the valid cognition that ascertains them has ceased.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Because there is no cause, the effect is to be established as nonexistent.

original: 'dir nye bar brjod pa med pa 'ba' zhig dpe ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar brjod pa med pa 'ba' zhig dpe ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, here non-mention alone is not the example.

original: 'on kyang rgyu mtshan te rgyu ma tshang bas myu gu la sogs pa med pa yang dpe yin no //🔽sbyor ba ni rgyu mtshan ma tshang @236a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu mtshan te rgyu ma tshang bas myu gu la sogs pa med pa yang dpe yin no // sbyor ba ni rgyu mtshan ma tshang @236a * //
translated: However, the nonexistence of sprouts, etc., due to the incompleteness of the cause, is also the example.

original: ba can gang yin pa de ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba can gang yin pa de ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is incomplete with regard to the cause does not come into being,

original: dper na sa phyogs sa bon gyis stong pa'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa phyogs sa bon gyis stong pa'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: like a sprout in a place devoid of seeds, etc.🔽Non-apprehension is also the incompleteness of the cause of the word and convention of existence.

original: mi dmigs pa yang yod pa'i sgra dang tha snyad kyi rgyu ma tshang ba yang yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang yod pa'i sgra dang tha snyad kyi rgyu ma tshang ba yang yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is non-apprehension of the cause.

original: gang yang nye bar brjod pa med pa de med pa ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhes smras pa de la yang /
analyzed: gang yang nye bar brjod pa med pa de med pa ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhes smras pa de la yang /
translated: Also, with regard to what was said, “How is the nonexistence of that which is not mentioned to be understood?,”

original: nye bar brjod pa med pa dper gyur pa la mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa med pa dper gyur pa la mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: in that case, because non-mention is the example, it is non-apprehension.

original: yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug pa 'di nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug pa 'di nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the refutation of the engagement which has the characteristic of the cognition, word, and expression of existence.

original: med pa bsgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa bsgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the establishment of non-existence.

original: gang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The word “also” is to be applied in order.

original: 'gog pa yang zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Refutation” should be seen as “also.”

original: yang gi sgras ni la lar med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni la lar med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: The word “also” establishes the engagement which has the characteristic of the cognition, etc. of non-existence in some cases.

original: de dag gi med pa nyid kyang ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi med pa nyid kyang ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is their non-existence established?

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Non-apprehension, etc.”

original: rva la sogs pas dben pa'i ri bong gi mgo bo la sogs pa /
analyzed: rva la sogs pas dben pa'i ri bong gi mgo bo la sogs pa /
translated: The head of a rabbit, etc. which is devoid of horns, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: is the non-apprehension which has the characteristic of the apprehension of the absence of something.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i 'jug pas gang la mtshan nyid de nyid yod pa med pa nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i 'jug pas gang la mtshan nyid de nyid yod pa med pa nyid du grub ste /
translated: By the engagement of an implicative negation, that which has that characteristic is established as non-existent.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pas dben pa'i mgo bo la sogs pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pas dben pa'i mgo bo la sogs pa grub pa yin te /
translated: The head, etc. which is devoid of horns, etc. is established.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa nyid du grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa nyid du grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same as saying that the nonexistence of the rabbit’s horns is established.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur na snang ba mi dmigs pa la med pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba grub na /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur na snang ba mi dmigs pa la med pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba grub na /
translated: If that were not so, then the nonexistence of the object of the non-observation of appearance would be established.
