original: de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi med pa'i tha snyad kyang sgrub pa kho na yin na de bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi med pa'i tha snyad kyang sgrub pa kho na yin na de bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If that were the case, then the reason for the expression of nonexistence would be established. What would be the use of establishing that?

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad log par grub pa de ltar na /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad log par grub pa de ltar na /
translated: Also, in the case of the non-observation of non-appearance, there is no reason for the expression of nonexistence. Therefore, the expression of existence is established as the opposite.

original: de dgag pa bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de dgag pa bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, what would be the use of establishing the negation of that?

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa la sngar rab tu grags pa'i yul nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpes dgos pa cung zhig kyang med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa la sngar rab tu grags pa'i yul nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpes dgos pa cung zhig kyang med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, there is not the slightest purpose for the example that has the characteristic of illustrating the previously well-known object in the non-observation.

original: rgyu mtshan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The reason” and so on.

original: rmongs pa la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rmongs pa la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it is to be established for the confused.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa la med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan te med pa nges pa khas blangs shing /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa la med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan te med pa nges pa khas blangs shing /
translated: The reason for the term “nonexistence” in the nonobservation of appearance is the ascertainment of nonexistence.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la de med pas te /🔽med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma med pa khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la de med pas te / med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma med pa khas blangs pas so //
translated: The reason for the term “nonexistence” in the nonobservation of the nonappearing is the absence of a valid cognition that ascertains nonexistence.

original: gang med par nges pa la med pa'i tha snyad bya ba de la mi byed pa'i phyir 'jug pa lugs las ldog par byed pa'o //🔽mi snang ba'i mi dmigs pa la gang the tshom du gyur pa'i don la med do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad bzlog par bya ba de la /🔽@236b med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang med par nges pa la med pa'i tha snyad bya ba de la mi byed pa'i phyir 'jug pa lugs las ldog par byed pa'o // mi snang ba'i mi dmigs pa la gang the tshom du gyur pa'i don la med do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad bzlog par bya ba de la / @236b med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The reversal of the procedure is to not apply the term “nonexistent” to that which is ascertained as nonexistent.🔽The reversal of the procedure is to apply the term “nonexistent” to that which is doubted in the nonobservation of the nonappearing.

original: zlog pa lugs las ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zlog pa lugs las ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: The reversal of the procedure is to apply the term “nonexistent” to that which is to be reversed, “The object does not exist.”

original: de ltar smos pa de la ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin du bstan to zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de ltar smos pa de la ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin du bstan to zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The statement “In this way, I have taught in accordance with what is accepted” is as follows.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa gang la 'dis med pa'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa de la med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar ston to //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa gang la 'dis med pa'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa de la med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar ston to //
translated: This shows that the non-observation of appearance should be the reason for accepting the expression of non-existence.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa gang la med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med par khas blangs pa de med pa'i tha snyad ma byed cig ces de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa gang la med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med par khas blangs pa de med pa'i tha snyad ma byed cig ces de ltar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the non-observation of non-appearance should not be the reason for accepting the expression of non-existence.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir nye bar brjod pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir nye bar brjod pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example, he says, “like the non-existence of the expression,” and so on.

original: nye bar brjod pa med pa bzhin nye bar brjod pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa med pa bzhin nye bar brjod pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: “Like the non-existence of the expression” means like the expression.

original: ji ltar nye bar brjod pa med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad yin pa de ltar 'di la yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar brjod pa med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad yin pa de ltar 'di la yang ngo //
translated: Just as the non-existence of the expression is the reason for the expression of non-existence in regard to the non-existence of the expression in regard to such things as the horn of an ass, because the non-observation of the reason for the expression of non-existence is possible, so it is in this case as well.

original: gzhan dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la gzhan gyi dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la gzhan gyi dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la gzhan gyi dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la gzhan gyi dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: “Like the other” means like the other.

original: ji ltar rgyu mtshan thag nye ba can gyi myu gu la sogs pa'i 'jug pa de ltar med pa'i tha snyad kyi yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu mtshan thag nye ba can gyi myu gu la sogs pa'i 'jug pa de ltar med pa'i tha snyad kyi yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Just as the occurrence of a sprout, etc. is not due to proximity to a sign, so too the occurrence of the expression “non-existence” is not due to the existence of non-existence.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la ltos nas dpe gnyi ga la yang grub pa don gyi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la ltos nas dpe gnyi ga la yang grub pa don gyi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: In both examples, the similarity of the meaning is established in dependence on non-apprehension of non-appearance.

original: ji ltar rgyu med par ri bong gi rva las nye bar brjod pa med pa'i med pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu med par ri bong gi rva las nye bar brjod pa med pa'i med pa'am /
translated: Just as the non-existence of the expression “rabbit horn” due to the absence of a cause,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba'i myu gu la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi med pa de dang 'dra bar yul la sogs pa bskal pa dag la med pa'i tha snyad do zhes bya ba'i dpe grub par bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba'i myu gu la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi med pa de dang 'dra bar yul la sogs pa bskal pa dag la med pa'i tha snyad do zhes bya ba'i dpe grub par bstan te /
translated: or the non-existence of a sprout, etc. due to the incompleteness of its cause, so too the expression “non-existence” in regard to a place, etc. is due to the absence of an object. The establishment of the example is shown.

original: gal te re zhig dmigs pa med pa ste /🔽mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de nyid ji ltar tshad ma gang gis grub pa ste /
analyzed: gal te re zhig dmigs pa med pa ste /🔽mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de nyid ji ltar tshad ma gang gis grub pa ste /
translated: If non-apprehension,🔽that is, non-existence, is established by some valid cognition, then it is not non-existent.

original: ma grub pa yang rtags ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang rtags ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: and that which is not established is not a reason.

original: de ni 'og nas /🔽de la khyad par can dmigs pa //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas / de la khyad par can dmigs pa //
translated: This is explained below:🔽“The observation of the specific

original: de'i phyir de yang mi dmigs te //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang mi dmigs te //
translated: is not observed there.

original: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni //
translated: Therefore, this non-observation

original: mngon sum bdag nyid kho nar rtogs //
analyzed: mngon sum bdag nyid kho nar rtogs //
translated: is understood to be of the nature of perception.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And so on.

original: gang yang mi dmigs pa la sngar rab tu grags pa'i yul nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpe nye bar bstan pas ci dgos zhes smras pa 'dir /
analyzed: gang yang mi dmigs pa la sngar rab tu grags pa'i yul nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpe nye bar bstan pas ci dgos zhes smras pa 'dir /
translated: As for what was said about the need to demonstrate an example that has the characteristic of indicating a well-known object in non-observation,

original: dri ba'i tshul du rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dri ba'i tshul du rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in the manner of a question, he says, “In other inferences as well,” and so on.

original: yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang /
analyzed: yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang /
translated: Inferences that prove existence

original: khyab par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyab par bya ba'i chos byas pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pas te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyab par bya ba'i chos byas pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pas te /
translated: are also proofs of the property of the subject, which is pervaded by the probandum, such as being produced, and so on.

original: go bar byed pa bstan par 'dod na ci'i phyir dpe rtogs par bya ba yin zhing khong du chud par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: go bar byed pa bstan par 'dod na ci'i phyir dpe rtogs par bya ba yin zhing khong du chud par bya ba yin te /
translated: If you wish to teach the interpretable meaning, why is the example to be understood and to be comprehended?

original: shes @237a * //
analyzed: shes @237a * //
translated: If you want to teach the example in order to make the meaning understood, why is the example to be understood and to be comprehended?

original: par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be known.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya bas khyab par bya ba gtan tshigs bstan pas /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya bas khyab par bya ba gtan tshigs bstan pas /
translated: Because the reason is taught as pervading the probandum in accordance with itself,

original: khyab par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the probandum, the pervasion, is established.

original: gal te don nges su zin kyang ste /
analyzed: gal te don nges su zin kyang ste /
translated: Even if the meaning is already ascertained,

original: 'brel pa gzung du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa 'di la dpe ni dran pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzung du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa 'di la dpe ni dran pa'i don yin te /
translated: and even if the connection is already grasped, the example in this inference is for the purpose of reminding.

original: ji ltar gzhan la khyab par bya ba thag nye ba na khyab par byed pa rtogs par 'gyur ba de ltar 'di la yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ltar rmongs pa dran pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la khyab par bya ba thag nye ba na khyab par byed pa rtogs par 'gyur ba de ltar 'di la yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ltar rmongs pa dran pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the pervasion is realized when the pervaded is nearby, so it is realized here as well, in order to generate the recollection of the confused.

original: de ni dpes rmongs pa dran pa bskyed pa de'o //
analyzed: de ni dpes rmongs pa dran pa bskyed pa de'o //
translated: That is the generation of the recollection of the confused by the example.

original: cig shos la zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: cig shos la zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: The other is non-apprehension.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “That is not the case, etc.”

original: bstan par bya ba de ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gzhan mi dmigs pa tsam las med pa'i tha snyad rtogs su zin kyang /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba de ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gzhan mi dmigs pa tsam las med pa'i tha snyad rtogs su zin kyang /
translated: That which is to be demonstrated is not the mere non-apprehension of another, such as the horn of an ass, etc., which is suitable as a convention of non-existence. Even though one may understand the convention of non-existence from the mere non-apprehension of another,

original: dngos por gyur pa spyi'am yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du rung ba 'di la yang rmongs pa'i phyir dpe nye bar bstan pas yul can dran par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa spyi'am yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du rung ba 'di la yang rmongs pa'i phyir dpe nye bar bstan pas yul can dran par bya ba yin no //
translated: still, because of delusion with regard to this, which is suitable as a convention of non-apprehension, which is characterized by the apprehension of a thing, such as a universal or a whole, etc., the example is demonstrated in order to remind the opponent of the subject.

original: gal te snang ba'am mi snang ba'i yul can la mi dmigs pa thams cad la ci rigs par med pa'i tha snyad dam yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba'am mi snang ba'i yul can la mi dmigs pa thams cad la ci rigs par med pa'i tha snyad dam yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the non-apprehension of a subject, whether it appears or does not appear, is to be established as the negation of the convention of existence or the convention of non-existence, as the case may be,🔽then,

original: ci ste gang 'di slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas gtso bo la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes sbyor ba mdzad de /
analyzed: ci ste gang 'di slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas gtso bo la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes sbyor ba mdzad de /
translated: But if you say that the master Dignaga and so on, in the syllogism, “The primal substance and so on do not exist because they are not perceived,”

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba de la ji ltar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'am yod pa'i tha snyad de 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba de la ji ltar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'am yod pa'i tha snyad de 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: how can the nonperception syllogism prove the term “nonexistent” or negate the term “existent”?

original: brgal ba smras ma thag pa blo la bzhag nas gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: brgal ba smras ma thag pa blo la bzhag nas gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Having placed in his mind the objection just stated, he thinks, “Both are untenable.”

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang re zhig 'dir rtsod pa smrar bcug la de nas rjes su mthun pa'i lan brjod par bya'o snyam pas ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang re zhig 'dir rtsod pa smrar bcug la de nas rjes su mthun pa'i lan brjod par bya'o snyam pas ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes smos so //
translated: The proponent of tenets thinks, “First let the opponent state the objection and then I will give a suitable reply,” and so he says, “How could it not be so?”

original: rtsod par byed pa'i bsam pa ni de'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rtsod par byed pa'i bsam pa ni de'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The opponent’s thought is stated in the words “The meaning of that term.”

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra de'i yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don 'gog pa yod na /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra de'i yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don 'gog pa yod na /
translated: If the meaning of the term “primal substance” and so on, which has the characteristic of the three qualities and so on, is refuted,🔽then the term “primal substance” and so on is also refuted.

original: rjod par byed pa gtso bo la sogs pa'i chos can gyi tshig mi sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa gtso bo la sogs pa'i chos can gyi tshig mi sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the words that express the subject, such as “primal substance,” are not applied.

original: brjod par bya ma gtogs par rjod par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ma gtogs par rjod par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For there is no application of the expression without the expressed.

original: gang gi tshe gtso bo la sogs pa sgra dag mi sbyor ba de'i tshe med do zhes bya @237b ba'i 'gog pa brjod pa kho na'i sgras khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtso bo la sogs pa sgra dag mi sbyor ba de'i tshe med do zhes bya @237b ba'i 'gog pa brjod pa kho na'i sgras khyad par du byed do //
translated: When “primal substance” and so on are not applied, then the word “does not exist” alone expresses the negation.

original: de yang dgag par bya ba'i don bstan pa med par yul med pa can gyi dgag pa zhes bya ba dgag pa'i tshig gi sgra mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dgag par bya ba'i don bstan pa med par yul med pa can gyi dgag pa zhes bya ba dgag pa'i tshig gi sgra mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not tenable, because the word “negation” is not appropriate without the indication of the object of negation.

original: de ltar na gtso bo la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i dam bcas pa'i tshig gnyi ga yang sbyor bar mi rung ba'i phyir gang la gcig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na gtso bo la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i dam bcas pa'i tshig gnyi ga yang sbyor bar mi rung ba'i phyir gang la gcig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, because it is not tenable to apply either of the two expressions—the expression of the thesis “primal substance does not exist” and the expression of the proof “because it is not perceived”—

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba don byed pa yin te /
translated: the expression “nonperception” is a proof that is not tenable.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dag kyang med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dag kyang med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because the principal and so on do not exist as the subject of the proposition, the reason would not be a property of the subject.

original: dam bcas pa'i tshig dag phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i tshig dag phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the words of the proposition would be mutually contradictory.

original: 'di ltar gtso bo la sogs pa zhes sbyor ba'i phyir de'i don thag nye ba yin na yod pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir thag nye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bo la sogs pa zhes sbyor ba'i phyir de'i don thag nye ba yin na yod pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir thag nye ba ma yin te /
translated: In this way, because the words “the principal and so on” are used, if the meaning of the words is close, then it is not the case that they do not exist.

original: thag nye ba dang thag nye ba ma yin pa gcig la cig car 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: thag nye ba dang thag nye ba ma yin pa gcig la cig car 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: But if the meaning is not close, then it is contradictory for something to be both close and not close. This is the opponent’s opinion.

original: nyes pa de ni med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa de ni med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is, “That fault does not exist.”

original: 'di skad du ji ltar gzhan dag gi phyi rol gyi ngo bo yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gtso bo la sogs pa brtags pa de nyid gal te sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar gzhan dag gi phyi rol gyi ngo bo yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gtso bo la sogs pa brtags pa de nyid gal te sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: This is what is being said: If the meaning of the words “the principal and so on” is close, then it is not the case that they do not exist.

original: phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa med pa'i phyi ro gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa brgal ba smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa med pa'i phyi ro gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa brgal ba smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the terms “primal substance” and so on do not apply to external objects.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi sgra'i don yin par ma zad kyi /🔽'on kyang thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa snga ma snga mas rnam par rtog pa phyi ma phyi ma bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi sgra'i don yin par ma zad kyi / 'on kyang thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa snga ma snga mas rnam par rtog pa phyi ma phyi ma bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the term “external” is not the only thing that is not established;🔽the former conceptual thought generates the latter conceptual thought, and the former conceptual thought arises from another latent potentiality, and that arises from another, and so on.

original: bag chags kyi nus pa gzhag cing rnam par rtog pa snga ma de yang bag chags gzhan las skye ste de yang gzhan las zhes bya ba 'khor ba thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa'i nyes pa yang yod pa ma yin pa
analyzed: bag chags kyi nus pa gzhag cing rnam par rtog pa snga ma de yang bag chags gzhan las skye ste de yang gzhan las zhes bya ba 'khor ba thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa'i nyes pa yang yod pa ma yin pa
translated: Thus, because cyclic existence is beginningless, there is no fault of infinite regress.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thog ma med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thog ma med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “beginningless latent potentialities.”

original: thog ma med pa yang de yin la bag chags kyang yin pa de las byung ba ni /
analyzed: thog ma med pa yang de yin la bag chags kyang yin pa de las byung ba ni /
translated: That which is beginningless and is a latent potentiality is the source of the conceptual thought that apprehends the object as permanent, unitary, and independent.

original: thog med bag chags las byung ba ;
analyzed: thog med bag chags las byung ba ;
translated: It is produced from beginningless latent impressions.

original: / de lta bur gyur ba yang de yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin pa des yongs su bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: / de lta bur gyur ba yang de yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin pa des yongs su bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: It is that which is produced in that way and is also a conceptualization. It is completely established by that.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the aspect of the apprehended of that kind of conceptualization. This is the meaning of the term.🔽That is the meaning of the term.

original: de ni sgra don te de yang chos ni rnam pa gsum ste rang bzhin rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni sgra don te de yang chos ni rnam pa gsum ste rang bzhin rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, phenomena are threefold, with three natures.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yod med ces bya @238a * //
analyzed: yod med ces bya @238a * //
translated: He says, “existence, nonexistence, and both,”

original: ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga zhes zlas dbye bar byas nas de la brten pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa de'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga zhes zlas dbye bar byas nas de la brten pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa de'i skyes bu'o //
translated: Having made a compound of existence, nonexistence, and both, “based on that” is the second, its person.

original: de la dngos po mthong ba'i bag chags las byung ba ni yod pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po mthong ba'i bag chags las byung ba ni yod pa la brten pa ste /
translated: Among them, that which is produced from the latent impressions of seeing things is based on existence,

original: dper na skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the conceptualization of arising and so on.

original: med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba ni med pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba ni med pa la brten pa ste /
translated: That which is produced from the latent impressions of the conceptualization of nonexistence is based on nonexistence,🔽like the conceptualization of nonarising and so on.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of the non-production of the rabbit’s horns and so forth.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi sgo las byung ba ni gnyi ga la brten pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi sgo las byung ba ni gnyi ga la brten pa ste /
translated: The conceptualization that arises from the habitual tendencies of the conceptualization of existence and non-existence is based on both.

original: shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of the knowable itself and so forth.

original: de bas na gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis yongs su bsgrubs pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba de nyid ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis yongs su bsgrubs pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba de nyid ni chos can yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of apprehension that is established by the conceptualizations of pradhāna and so forth is the subject, pradhāna and so forth, which is the verbal object of expression.

original: dngos po nye bar len pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po nye bar len pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of the thing that is the appropriator is the probandum.

original: 'di la pha rol gyis kun du brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa'i dngos po nye bar len pa can med pas na /
analyzed: 'di la pha rol gyis kun du brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa'i dngos po nye bar len pa can med pas na /
translated: Since the pradhāna and so forth imagined by the opponent do not have the appropriation of a thing,

original: de dngos nyer len can med pa bsgrub la'o //
analyzed: de dngos nyer len can med pa bsgrub la'o //
translated: the non-appropriator of a thing is being proven.

original: de zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa chos can no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa chos can no //
translated: The “that” is the pradhāna and so forth that exist in the mind, the subject.

original: mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: Non-apprehension is as follows.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa can nyid du mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa can nyid du mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the appropriator of external primal matter, etc., is not perceived.

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa mi dmigs pa ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa mi dmigs pa ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the reason is the non-perception of the conformity and reversal of the effect.

original: re zhig gtso bo la sogs pa med na rnam par rtog pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gtso bo la sogs pa med na rnam par rtog pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Primal matter, etc., do not exist because conceptualization does not exist if it does not exist.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis gtso bo la sogs pa med pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yod na yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis gtso bo la sogs pa med pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de yod na yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Primal matter, etc., do not exist because they are permanent.

original: rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su mi byed pa de ni /
analyzed: rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su mi byed pa de ni /
translated: Even if it exists, it does not exist because it would follow that it would always exist.🔽How could that which does not conform to the conformity and reversal of something else

original: ji ltar de'i nye bar len pa can du 'gyur /🔽de ltar gtso bo la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i nye bar len pa can du 'gyur / de ltar gtso bo la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: be the appropriator of that?🔽Thus, primal matter, etc., do not exist because they are not perceived.🔽The meaning is that primal matter, etc.,

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ni gtso bo la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ni gtso bo la sogs pa ste /
translated: are not perceived.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtogs pa de dag ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i rgyu can nyid du yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtogs pa de dag ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i rgyu can nyid du yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Those conceptual thoughts of primal matter and so on do not exist as having primal matter and so on as their cause.

original: de dag ni rang gi nye bar len pa kho na la rag lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi nye bar len pa kho na la rag lus pa yin no //
translated: They are dependent only on their own appropriators.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not observed.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The reason is that conceptual thought is not observed to conform to the presence or absence of external primal matter and so on.

original: de bas na 'di ltar rnam @238b par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can nyid du 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar rnam @238b par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can nyid du 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in this way, conceptual thought is refuted as having external objects as its appropriator.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid du nges pa ni ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid du nges pa ni ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: It is not refuted as having its own nature.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, he says, “That very conceptual thought,” and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pas yongs su sgrub pa de nyid kyi chos can med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yongs su sgrub pa de nyid kyi chos can med pa ma yin no //
translated: The object that is established by conceptual thought does not lack the property of being an object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the words “primary nature” and so on are applied.

original: de bkag na ni yul med pa nyid kyi phyir sgra sbyor ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na 'di ltar blo'i snang ba khas blangs nas gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra dag sbyor ba dang / yul yod pa'i phyir dgag par brjod pa'i sgra yang yod par mi rung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de bkag na ni yul med pa nyid kyi phyir sgra sbyor ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // de bas na 'di ltar blo'i snang ba khas blangs nas gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra dag sbyor ba dang / yul yod pa'i phyir dgag par brjod pa'i sgra yang yod par mi rung ba ma yin pas /
translated: If that were refuted, then because there would be no object, the words would not be applied.🔽Therefore, in this way, having accepted the appearance of cognition, the words “primary nature” and so on are applied, and because the object exists, the words of refutation are also not untenable.

original: phyogs kyi chos can nyid ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos can nyid ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not a property of the subject.

original: blo'i snang ba nyid phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba nyid phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of cognition itself is the subject.

original: dam bcas pa'i tshig la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i tshig la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no contradiction in the thesis.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ni yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ni yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because existence and nonexistence are different objects.

original: blo snang ba nyid du yod pa nyid dang phyi'i nye bar len pa can nyid du med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas thams cad bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: blo snang ba nyid du yod pa nyid dang phyi'i nye bar len pa can nyid du med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas thams cad bsal ba yin no //
translated: Because existence is the appearance of cognition itself, and nonexistence is the possession of external appropriation. Thus all is refuted.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “Just as . . . ” and so on.

original: ji ltar sgra de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar sgra de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: As was explained earlier, those sounds are not the objects of their own characteristics.

original: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags la rnam par rtogs pa gang las byung zhing skye ba yod pa de la so sor snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don gang yin pa de yul nyid du bdag gir byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags la rnam par rtogs pa gang las byung zhing skye ba yod pa de la so sor snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don gang yin pa de yul nyid du bdag gir byed do //
translated: However, the object that appears individually to that which arises and is born from the beginningless imprints of conceptualization is taken as the object itself.

original: rgyu gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snos te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snos te /
translated: Another reason is stated with “conceptualization . . . ” and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa de la brten pa'i 'chad pa po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de la brten pa'i 'chad pa po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The speaker is based on that conceptualization.

original: 'di dang 'di bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba yin pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa spyi'i rnam par brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba yin pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa spyi'i rnam par brten pa'o //
translated: It is as if he thinks, “I will teach this and that.” In that way, conceptualization is based on the aspect of the universal.

original: dngos po ji ltar snang ba bzhin du ni spyi'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar snang ba bzhin du ni spyi'i rnam par ro //
translated: As things appear, it is based on the aspect of the universal.

original: dngos por snang ba de ston par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dngos por snang ba de ston par 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is the desire to teach that appearance as a thing.

original: brjod par 'dod pa des sgra sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa des sgra sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the speaker employs the sound in order to express what he wants to say.

original: gnas skabs de la rang gi mtshan nyid so sor snang ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs de la rang gi mtshan nyid so sor snang ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The individual intrinsic identity does not appear in that situation.

original: nyan pa po la de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyan pa po la de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it generates a conceptual cognition in the listener that has the aspect of that sound.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates a conceptual cognition that has the aspect of the universal just as it is desired.

original: sgra la nyan pa po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba ni skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra la nyan pa po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba ni skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The listener does not experience the aspect of the intrinsic identity of the sound,

original: long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽'dod par mi 'gyur na gal te 'chad pa'i don ston par 'dod pa de'i tshe nyan pa po'i yang sgra las @239a * //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // 'dod par mi 'gyur na gal te 'chad pa'i don ston par 'dod pa de'i tshe nyan pa po'i yang sgra las @239a * //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the deaf would not experience it.

original: byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na sgra'i don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na sgra'i don yin no zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept that, then even if the intrinsic identity does not appear in the conceptual cognition that arises from the sound in the listener when he wishes to teach the meaning of what he has heard, still the intrinsic identity is the meaning of the sound.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the cognition of the appropriated and the result, etc.”

original: nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu ni nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu ni nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: The appropriated and the result are the appropriated and the result.

original: de dag nyid kyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi shes pa ste /
translated: Those are the cognition.🔽The cognition of the appropriated and the result.

original: rtog pa de la snang ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa de la snang ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa ste /
translated: That is not the nature of the appearance in that conception.

original: med pa nyid ni de'i yul can te /
analyzed: med pa nyid ni de'i yul can te /
translated: Nonexistence is its object.

original: sgra'i yul can nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra'i yul can nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not possible to ascertain that it is the object of the word.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i shes pa ni 'chad pa po'i bstan par 'dod pa'i dus na yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgra'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i shes pa ni 'chad pa po'i bstan par 'dod pa'i dus na yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgra'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of the appropriated is the cause of the speaker’s conception of the word at the time of the desire to teach.

original: 'bras bu'i shes pa ni sgra las byung ba'i nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i shes pa ni sgra las byung ba'i nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the result is the hearer’s conception that arises from the word.

original: de'i sgra'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i sgra'i don ma yin te /
translated: That is not the meaning of the word.

original: gang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la so sor snang ba med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la so sor snang ba med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: That which does not appear individually in the cognition that arises from the word is the summarized meaning.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni /
translated: By this much,

original: thog med bag chags las byung ba'i //
analyzed: thog med bag chags las byung ba'i //
translated: arising from beginningless latent propensities,

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs bsgrubs pa /
translated: The establishment of conceptualization

original: sgra don zhes bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra don zhes bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: is the commentary on the words “signifier and signified.”

original: rnam par rtog pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa lhag ma'i cha 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa lhag ma'i cha 'chad par byed de /
translated: The remainder of the treatise is explained by the verse beginning with “That conceptualization,” and so on.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i shes pa ste /
translated: Conceptualization that is both existent and nonexistent is the cognition of both existence and nonexistence.

original: des bsgos shing 'phangs pa'i bag chags kyi nus pa de las rnam par rtog pa gang las byung zhing skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des bsgos shing 'phangs pa'i bag chags kyi nus pa de las rnam par rtog pa gang las byung zhing skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That conceptualization is said to arise from the potential of the latent propensities that are infused and projected by that cognition.

original: 'dis kyang yod med gnyi ga la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tshig rkang de rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang yod med gnyi ga la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tshig rkang de rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: This also explains the verse “based on both existence and nonexistence.”

original: phyir te gtan tshigs kyis yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phyir te gtan tshigs kyis yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i chos zhes brjod do //
translated: Because of that, it is said that the characteristics of both existence and nonexistence are imputed.

original: de la yod pa'i shes pas bsgos pa'i bag chags las byung ba ni yod pa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: de la yod pa'i shes pas bsgos pa'i bag chags las byung ba ni yod pa'i chos yin la /
translated: Among them, the characteristics of existence arise from the latent propensities infused by the cognition of existence.

original: med pa'i shes pa'i bag chags las byung ba med pa'i chos yin zhing gnyi ga'i shes pas bsgos pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i gnyi ga'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'i shes pa'i bag chags las byung ba med pa'i chos yin zhing gnyi ga'i shes pas bsgos pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i gnyi ga'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The phenomena of nonexistence arise from the habitual tendencies of the cognition of nonexistence, and the phenomena of both existence and nonexistence arise from the habitual tendencies imbued with the cognition of both.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The cognition that appears as that . . .

original: rnam par rtog pa de nyid la snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa dang med pa nyid du nges pa de'i dbang gis yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de nyid la snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa dang med pa nyid du nges pa de'i dbang gis yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga chos zhes brjod do //
translated: The aspect that appears in that conceptualization is called the phenomena of existence and nonexistence because of the ascertainment of existence and nonexistence.

original: de skad du rang nyid rnam pa dngos po nyid du rnam par rtog pas nges par byas pa'i rnam pa de ni yod pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du rang nyid rnam pa dngos po nyid du rnam par rtog pas nges par byas pa'i rnam pa de ni yod pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: In that way, the aspect that is ascertained by conceptualization as the entity of the aspect is called the phenomena of existence.

original: de bzhin du med pa dang gnyi @239b ga'i chos dag la yang blta bar bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du med pa dang gnyi @239b ga'i chos dag la yang blta bar bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the phenomena of nonexistence and both should be seen.

original: de bas na blo la snang ba'i chos can 'di la brten nas te /
analyzed: de bas na blo la snang ba'i chos can 'di la brten nas te /
translated: Therefore, based on this phenomenon that appears to the mind,

original: skyes bu dag chos can de la dpyod pa'i gnas nyid du brten nas /
analyzed: skyes bu dag chos can de la dpyod pa'i gnas nyid du brten nas /
translated: The person, having relied on that very thing which is the object of analysis,

original: phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can nyid du yod pa med pa nyid spyod par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can nyid du yod pa med pa nyid spyod par byed do //
translated: engages in the non-existence of external objects.

original: ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gtso bo'i sgra brjod pa las nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don gang yin pa de gtso bo'i sgra las snang ba ste /
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gtso bo'i sgra brjod pa las nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don gang yin pa de gtso bo'i sgra las snang ba ste /
translated: In “what,” etc., the meaning that appears to the thought of the hearer from the utterance of the word “primal substance” is the appearance from the word “primal substance.”

original: ci dngos po nye bar len pa can nam ma yin zhe'o //
analyzed: ci dngos po nye bar len pa can nam ma yin zhe'o //
translated: Is it a thing that is appropriated or not?

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de ni dngos po nye bar len pa can med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de ni dngos po nye bar len pa can med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: That appearance of the thought of “primal substance,” etc., is the subject to be proven as non-existent.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de nyid blo'i rang bzhin nyid du so so rang gi rig pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de nyid blo'i rang bzhin nyid du so so rang gi rig pa nyid de /
translated: That very appearance of thought is the nature of cognition, which is reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir spong bar 'os pa ma yin pa ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir spong bar 'os pa ma yin pa ni chos can yin no //
translated: Because it is reflexive awareness, it is not suitable to be refuted.

original: gal te blo la snang ba de nyid phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la de yang spong bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te blo la snang ba de nyid phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la de yang spong bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: If that appearance to the mind is the characteristic of external pradhāna, etc., then that also is not to be refuted.

original: 'o na ni gtso bo la sogs pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gtso bo la sogs pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then pradhāna, etc. would be established.

original: ci ste gtso bo la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid spong ba de'i tshe snang ba de nyid spong bar 'gyur te rang gi mtshan nyid dang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dag ni gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gtso bo la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid spong ba de'i tshe snang ba de nyid spong bar 'gyur te rang gi mtshan nyid dang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dag ni gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If the characteristic of pradhāna, etc. is refuted, then that appearance itself is refuted, because the appearance of the characteristic and the appearance of conceptual thought are the same.

original: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That itself,” etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i don de nyid kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i don de nyid kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot say that the object that appears to the conceptual mind is itself the characteristic.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma thob pa dang 'gags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma thob pa dang 'gags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That which is not obtained,” etc.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa dag yod na yang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa dag yod na yang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there were non-arising and cessation in intrinsic reality, still, because of not being free from the appearance of conceptualization,

original: gal te phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa'i snang bar 'gyur na ma thob pa dang 'gags pa de ni so sor snang ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa'i snang bar 'gyur na ma thob pa dang 'gags pa de ni so sor snang ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if the intrinsic reality of external things were to become the appearance of conceptualization, then that which is not obtained and has ceased would be free from the appearance of each.

original: dngos po la phyin ci log pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: dngos po la phyin ci log pa yang de yin la /
translated: That is the error in regard to things,

original: rnam pa yang yin pa de la mngon par zhen pa'i ngang tshul can gzhan mu stegs pa'i shes pa ste rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag la sgra'i don snang ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa yang yin pa de la mngon par zhen pa'i ngang tshul can gzhan mu stegs pa'i shes pa ste rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag la sgra'i don snang ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: and that which is the aspect and is the habit of adherence to that, is the consciousness of other tīrthikas, that is, conceptualization. Because the appearance of the meaning of words exists for them,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: the appearance of conceptualization is not intrinsic reality.

original: 'di skad du gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa'i snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la @240a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa'i snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la @240a * //
translated: If the specific characteristic itself were to appear to thought, then because the specific characteristic is one only,

original: rnam pa gcig kho na skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig kho na skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: only one aspect would arise in all philosophical systems,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and there would be no difference in terms of the distinctions of permanence, impermanence, both, or neither.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis don 'di nyid bsdus par mdzad pa la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis don 'di nyid bsdus par mdzad pa la /
translated: This point is summarized in two verses.

original: don dam pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: don dam pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do ;
translated: The ultimate is the specific characteristic.

original: / gcig phyogs nyid yod ces bya ba'i sgra ni mthar phyin pa'i tshig tu grags pa yin te /
analyzed: / gcig phyogs nyid yod ces bya ba'i sgra ni mthar phyin pa'i tshig tu grags pa yin te /
translated: The term “only” is known to be a term that expresses finality,

original: dper na bsam gtan la rtse gcig par gyur ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan la rtse gcig par gyur ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, “he became one-pointed in meditative concentration.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la phyogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid gcig tu yul nyid ces bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la phyogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid gcig tu yul nyid ces bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: “Directed to the specific characteristic” is a term that means “the object of the specific characteristic is one.”

original: gzhan dag ni sgra sgrub pa sngon du song ba can 'chad par byed de /🔽gang gis rnam par shes pa rgyas par byed cing skyed par byed pa de ni rgyas par byed de yul zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sgra sgrub pa sngon du song ba can 'chad par byed de / gang gis rnam par shes pa rgyas par byed cing skyed par byed pa de ni rgyas par byed de yul zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Others explain that the term “object” is derived from the verbal root vṛdh, to increase, because it increases consciousness.🔽The term “object” means that which increases consciousness, that is, that which generates consciousness.

original: gang la yul don dam pa gcig rgyas byed yod ces bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la yul don dam pa gcig rgyas byed yod ces bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The term “object” is a tatpuruṣa compound, meaning “that which increases the object.”

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: The term “its” refers to the object.

original: sgra rnams kyi khas blangs par 'gyur ba de yod na don rnams la ni sgra de dag gi rgyu med pa can rten med pa can 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi khas blangs par 'gyur ba de yod na don rnams la ni sgra de dag gi rgyu med pa can rten med pa can 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the object exists as it is accepted by the terms, then the terms would not be applied to objects without a basis, without a cause.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object would not exist as it is conceived by the terms.

original: ji ltar bur gyur pa dag la zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bur gyur pa dag la zhe na /
translated: In what way does it not exist?

original: mthong ba'i bye brag dag tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bye brag dag tha dad pa ste /
translated: It does not exist as a distinct object of perception.

original: grub pa'i mtha' khyad par tha dad pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag gi la'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khyad par tha dad pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag gi la'o //
translated: It does not exist as a distinct object of perception in the different philosophical systems that are mutually contradictory.

original: 'das dang ma skyes pa la yang //
analyzed: 'das dang ma skyes pa la yang //
translated: It does not exist in the past or future.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams la sgra 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gong ma dang sbyar te rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams la sgra 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gong ma dang sbyar te rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is connected with the previous sentence: “The word would not apply to past and future things,” because they do not have intrinsic identity.

original: gzhan yang tshig 'ga' zhig kyang brdzun pa'i don can nyid du ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig 'ga' zhig kyang brdzun pa'i don can nyid du ste /
translated: Moreover, some words would not have the meaning of falsehood.

original: brdzun pa'i don can kho nar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i don can kho nar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not be only the meaning of falsehood,

original: gang thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid la gcig tu phyogs pa nyid yin pas na bden pa'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid la gcig tu phyogs pa nyid yin pas na bden pa'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: because all of them would be the meaning of truth, since they are directed only to intrinsic identity.

original: phyir te ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis tshig de dag blo'i yul can 'dod do //
analyzed: phyir te ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis tshig de dag blo'i yul can 'dod do //
translated: The words are the objects of the intellect, as asserted by the opponent.

original: de ni zhes bya ba gtso bo la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i ngo bo nye bar len pa can med pa bsgrub par bya ba la ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba gtso bo la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i ngo bo nye bar len pa can med pa bsgrub par bya ba la ste /
translated: “ That” refers to the appearance in the imagination of the primal substance, etc., which is devoid of the appropriated entity as desired.

original: 'di la ji ltar 'dod pa ste ji ltar kun tu brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi gtso po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nye bar len pa yod pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar 'dod pa ste ji ltar kun tu brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi gtso po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nye bar len pa yod pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the phrase “the nature of external things that are imagined, that is, that are conceived of, is not apprehended” is to be supplied.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba 'di la 'dod pa'i ngo bo nye bar len pa can de'i rje su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de ltar mi dmigs @240b pa ste /🔽sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba 'di la 'dod pa'i ngo bo nye bar len pa can de'i rje su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de ltar mi dmigs @240b pa ste / sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the object that is conceived of in the appearance of conceptual thought is not apprehended as it goes and comes.🔽The reason is not unestablished, because the property of the position exists.

original: phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a property that is not a property of the position is not a reason.

original: sbyor ba 'di la sgra las te //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di la sgra las te //
translated: This syllogism is from scripture.

original: rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i don 'di nyid ni bsnyon par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i don 'di nyid ni bsnyon par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the appearance of conceptual thought cannot be denied.

original: sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the appearance of conceptual thought that arises from words is not denied.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i don de nyan pa po'i blo la bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i don de nyan pa po'i blo la bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning that appears to thought is generated in the mind of the listener.

original: sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word is applied.

original: de med na ste rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don med na ni de rung ba ste sgra sbyor bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gsum pa /
analyzed: de med na ste rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don med na ni de rung ba ste sgra sbyor bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa gsum pa /
translated: If that does not exist, if the meaning that appears to thought does not exist, then that is not tenable, because the word is not applied.

original: gzhan yang gal te sgra'i don nyid la bsnyon pa sgrub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sgra'i don nyid la bsnyon pa sgrub pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if you refute the meaning of the word, then at that time

original: sgra don bsnyon na bsgrub ya'i chos de'i rten sgra dang don gyi mtshan nyid can gyi chos de ni bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra don bsnyon na bsgrub ya'i chos de'i rten sgra dang don gyi mtshan nyid can gyi chos de ni bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: if you refute the meaning of the word, the word, which is the basis of the property of the probandum, the property that is characterized by the word and its meaning, is refuted.🔽The inclusion of the property of the probandum and the property possessor is not established.

original: chos dang chos can gyi bdag nyid can gyis bsdus pa bsgrub byar mi 'gyur zhing med do zhes bya ba de tsam gyis chos tsam lus par 'gyur ba de yang yan gar chos kyang grub pa yin te yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam gyis
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi bdag nyid can gyis bsdus pa bsgrub byar mi 'gyur zhing med do zhes bya ba de tsam gyis chos tsam lus par 'gyur ba de yang yan gar chos kyang grub pa yin te yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam gyis
translated: The mere property that remains, the mere statement “it does not exist,” is not established.

original: ni ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere statement “it does not exist” is not established.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: He explains this with “If, etc.”

original: gtso bo'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i sgras bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i sgras bstan par bya'o //
translated: The expression “what is expressed by the word ‘primary’” means what is indicated by the word “primary.”

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro//
translated: “ Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the property to be proven.

original: gang rten gyis rnam par gcod pa ste khyad par 'di la 'di med pa nyid do //🔽de la ltos pa med pa can zhes bya ba ni de la ltos pa med pa de ltar na rtsod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa ste med pa nyid can du 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis grub pa'i dus su nye bar 'dod
analyzed: gang rten gyis rnam par gcod pa ste khyad par 'di la 'di med pa nyid do // de la ltos pa med pa can zhes bya ba ni de la ltos pa med pa de ltar na rtsod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa ste med pa nyid can du 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis grub pa'i dus su nye bar 'dod
translated: The exclusion by the basis is this particular absence.🔽“ Without depending on that” means “not depending on that.” In that case, it is not the basis of dispute, because it is established as having the nature of absence.

original: par bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //🔽sgra don bsnyon pa med pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: par bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // sgra don bsnyon pa med pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The reason is established.🔽“ By the unexceptionable meaning of the word” is an illustration.

original: de ltar na sgra'i don grub par mi byed pa dag gis zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sgra'i don grub par mi byed pa dag gis zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should say “by those that do not establish the meaning of the word.”

original: sgra'i don sgrub par mi byed pa dag gis sgra'i don bsgrub pa nyid kyi phyir dang bsnyon pa mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du dngos po nyid la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽yod med phyogs kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: sgra'i don sgrub par mi byed pa dag gis sgra'i don bsgrub pa nyid kyi phyir dang bsnyon pa mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du dngos po nyid la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yod med phyogs kyi bye brag gis //
translated: The meaning of the words “due to the distinction of the positions of existence and nonexistence” is as follows:

original: zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med par dam bcas pa'i khyad par gyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med par dam bcas pa'i khyad par gyis /
translated: Due to the distinction of the assertions of existence and nonexistence,

original: dngos po nyid ni dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni dpyad par bya'o //
translated: the nature of an entity should be analyzed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'di la 'bras @241a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'di la 'bras @241a * //
translated: Because in this way, the effect of this entity

original: bur ga las phyir sgra'i don la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bur ga las phyir sgra'i don la ni ma yin no //
translated: is established, but not the meaning of the word.

original: gal te de ltar na yang sgra'i don dpyad par bya ba yin no zhe na /🔽don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang sgra'i don dpyad par bya ba yin no zhe na / don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you ask, “Even so, is the meaning of the word to be analyzed?”

original: sgra'i don byed nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i don byed nus pa ma yin la /
translated: The root text states, “The meaning of the word is not capable of performing a function.”

original: don byed par 'dod pa dag ni /
analyzed: don byed par 'dod pa dag ni /
translated: Those who assert that it is capable of performing a function

original: de 'dod pa rtag pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de 'dod pa rtag pas ci zhig bya //
translated: ask, “What is the point of asserting that?”

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir ma ning zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir ma ning zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is called a neuter.

original: skyes pa'i dbang po dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po dang bral ba ni /
translated: One who is devoid of the female faculty🔽is called a neuter.

original: ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //🔽yul de la 'khrig pa mngon par 'dod pa'o //🔽'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //🔽sgra don zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes // yul de la 'khrig pa mngon par 'dod pa'o // 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan // sgra don zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.

original: sgra'i don med pa ni skyes bu'i don byed cung zad kyang nye bar dgag pa ste dgag pa mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: sgra'i don med pa ni skyes bu'i don byed cung zad kyang nye bar dgag pa ste dgag pa mi byed pa'am /
translated: One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.

original: yod pa ni yang dag par byed pa ste sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes ci rigs par sbyar ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa ni yang dag par byed pa ste sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes ci rigs par sbyar ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.

original: mngon par zhen pa ji ltar ba bzhin du ste ji ltar skyes bu'i sgra'i don la don byed pa'i nus pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa de ltar de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa de ltar kho na nyid du med pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ji ltar ba bzhin du ste ji ltar skyes bu'i sgra'i don la don byed pa'i nus pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa de ltar de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa de ltar kho na nyid du med pa ste /
translated: One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called a neuter.🔽One who is devoid of both is called

original: yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: It is just as it is in reality.

original: ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gnas pa ste de ltar sgra'i don mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gnas pa ste de ltar sgra'i don mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Just as it abides in its own characteristic, so it is, because the meaning of the word does not abide.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na skyes bu 'di thams cad du ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na skyes bu 'di thams cad du ste /
translated: Since this is so, therefore, this person,

original: dus thams cad du yod pa dang / med pa dpyad pa la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: dus thams cad du yod pa dang / med pa dpyad pa la 'jug pa na /
translated: when engaged in the analysis of existence and nonexistence at all times,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba la ltos pa med par /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba la ltos pa med par /
translated: without relying on the appearance of conceptual thought,

original: dngos po gang la skyes bu'i don 'di rag lus pa'i dngos po nyid la dmigs par byed cing yul du byed de /
analyzed: dngos po gang la skyes bu'i don 'di rag lus pa'i dngos po nyid la dmigs par byed cing yul du byed de /
translated: observes and takes as an object that very thing on which the meaning of the person depends.

original: dpe ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: dpe ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The example is stated in “For example,” and so on.

original: me ni zhes bya ba ni me'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can nyid ni'o //
analyzed: me ni zhes bya ba ni me'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can nyid ni'o //
translated: “Fire” is the nature of fire, its characteristic.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “and so on” includes burning, cooking, and so on.

original: grang ba ldog par byed pa la sogs pa 'di la sgra'i don la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grang ba ldog par byed pa la sogs pa 'di la sgra'i don la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words “to stop cold” and so on is not capable of this.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin du zin kyang ste /
analyzed: de nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin du zin kyang ste /
translated: Even if it were experienced,

original: sgra'i don de ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir rang rig pas nyams su myong bar 'gyur kyang de med pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i don de ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir rang rig pas nyams su myong bar 'gyur kyang de med pa ste /
translated: the meaning of the words, being conceptual in nature, would not be experienced by reflexive awareness.

original: grang ba la zlog par byed pa la sogs pas de med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de pas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir skyes bu'i don byed par 'dod pa de ni mi nus pa la ste /
analyzed: grang ba la zlog par byed pa la sogs pas de med pa'i phyir ro // de pas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir skyes bu'i don byed par 'dod pa de ni mi nus pa la ste /
translated: But even if it were, it would not be capable of stopping cold and so on.

original: don byed pa de mi nus pa'i sgra'i don la gus pas rjes su sbyar zhing gus par byed par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa de mi nus pa'i sgra'i don la gus pas rjes su sbyar zhing gus par byed par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for those who wish to benefit others to respect and follow the meaning of words that is incapable of benefiting.

original: 'dod ldan rnams @241b kyi ste 'khrig par 'dod pa rnams kyis ma ning gzugs bzang ba dang gzugs mi bzang ba yongs su brtag pa la gus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams @241b kyi ste 'khrig par 'dod pa rnams kyis ma ning gzugs bzang ba dang gzugs mi bzang ba yongs su brtag pa la gus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are desirous do not respect the examination of whether a eunuch is attractive or unattractive.

original: gang yang 'di skad du slob dpon gyis brtags pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du slob dpon gyis brtags pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Someone might say, The master said, 'The object of investigation is called a phenomenon,' and so on.

original: mu stegs byed kyis kun du brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi gtso bo nyid la sogs pa mi dmigs pa chos yin no zhes slob dpon gyis bshad na /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis kun du brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi gtso bo nyid la sogs pa mi dmigs pa chos yin no zhes slob dpon gyis bshad na /
translated: If the master explained that the non-observation of the primal substance and so on imagined by the tīrthikas is a phenomenon,

original: khyod kyis sgra'i don dngos po nye bar len pa can nyid du mi dmigs pa chos su rnam par gzhag pa de ltar na 'gal ba med ces bya ba 'di ni 'dri ba po'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis sgra'i don dngos po nye bar len pa can nyid du mi dmigs pa chos su rnam par gzhag pa de ltar na 'gal ba med ces bya ba 'di ni 'dri ba po'i bsam pa'o //
translated: then the questioner thinks, In that case, there is no contradiction in your positing the non-observation of the meaning of a word as a thing that appropriates.

original: 'dod pa gcig pa bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa gcig pa bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate that this is a single assertion, he says, The appearance of an aspect to thought consciousnesses, and so on.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is the object of a conceptual consciousness,

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i rnam pa sgra'i don ni brtags pa yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i rnam pa sgra'i don ni brtags pa yin par 'dod kyi /
