translated: the meaning of a word is asserted to be an appearance in the aspect of the conception of primal substance and so on.

original: mu stegs byed kyis kun brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis kun brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the primal substance and so on imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: dngos po la rten par byed pa ni dngos po rten te /
analyzed: dngos po la rten par byed pa ni dngos po rten te /
translated: The meaning of the term “non-apprehension” is as follows: The non-apprehension of an entity is the non-apprehension of a basis for an entity.

original: dngos po'i nye bar len par byed pa can nyid yin na /
analyzed: dngos po'i nye bar len par byed pa can nyid yin na /
translated: If the meaning of the term “non-apprehension” is the non-apprehension of a basis for an entity, then the non-apprehension of an entity is the non-apprehension of a basis for an entity.

original: der ma grub pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: der ma grub pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of an entity.

original: sgra'i don 'di dngos po'i nye bar len pa med pa can du bsgrub par bya ba'i rtags su gyur pa'i chos su rigs par smra ba'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don 'di dngos po'i nye bar len pa med pa can du bsgrub par bya ba'i rtags su gyur pa'i chos su rigs par smra ba'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa yin no //
translated: The master Dignāga, the speaker of reason, explains that the non-apprehension of an entity is a reason that proves the meaning of the term “non-apprehension” to be the non-apprehension of a basis for an entity.

original: gzhan dag ni bshad pa yin zhes bya ba bud med kyi rtags 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bshad pa yin zhes bya ba bud med kyi rtags 'chad de /
translated: Others explain that the term “non-apprehension” is explained as a sign of a woman.

original: dngos rten ma grub bshad pa yin //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos rten ma grub bshad pa yin // zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The non-apprehension of a basis for an entity is explained.🔽The term “explained” is connected to the term “non-apprehension of a basis for an entity.”

original: ci zhig bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig bshad ce na /
translated: What is explained?

original: chos te sgrub par byed pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos te sgrub par byed pa'i chos so //
translated: The term “property” is a property that is a reason.

original: rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: The explanation is by the term “thought” and so on.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don to //🔽dngos rten ma grub ces bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don to // dngos rten ma grub ces bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The term “that” is the meaning of the term “non-apprehension.”

original: dngos po la brten pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la brten pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the term “non-apprehension of a basis for an entity” is the non-apprehension of an entity.

original: gzhan gyis tshad ma gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis tshad ma gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa la /
translated: Others say, “The three valid cognitions are refuted.”

original: tshad ma gsum log pa zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung log pa na dngos po med par ma grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum log pa zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung log pa na dngos po med par ma grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de /
translated: When direct perception, inference, and scripture are refuted, it is not established that things do not exist.

original: tshad ma gzhan log pa na zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa na yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i dngos po dag ni log par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan log pa na zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa na yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i dngos po dag ni log par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the other valid cognitions are refuted, that is, when direct perception and inference are refuted, things that are distant in space and time are not refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de dag ni ma lus pa'i yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de dag ni ma lus pa'i yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those direct perception and inference are not the only valid cognitions.

original: lung gis ni ci zhig kyang @242a * //
analyzed: lung gis ni ci zhig kyang @242a * //
translated: What is not pervaded by scripture?

original: ma khyab pa med de zhes bya ba ni thams cad la khyab par byed pa de log pa ste /
analyzed: ma khyab pa med de zhes bya ba ni thams cad la khyab par byed pa de log pa ste /
translated: Nothing. That which pervades everything is refuted.

original: lung gi log pa de ji ltar go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung gi log pa de ji ltar go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: How could the refutation of scripture not be a refutation?

original: bskal pa can dag gis med pa go bar byed pa kho na yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa can dag gis med pa go bar byed pa kho na yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the meaning of non-existence is understood by those who are ready.

original: slob dpon gyis 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Master says, “Here, etc. ”

original: rtsod pa 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This dispute has already been explained.

original: ci zhig bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig bshad ce na /
translated: What has been explained?

original: lung dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lung dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “In the scriptures, etc. ”

original: ci'i phyir nye bar sbyar bar ma byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nye bar sbyar bar ma byas she na /
translated: Why was it not applied?

original: skabs su bab pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not the proper occasion.

original: skyes bu'i don dpyad pa'i skabs la nye bar sbyar ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽bstan bcos skabs dang 'brel med dang // dbang po las 'das rtags can min //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don dpyad pa'i skabs la nye bar sbyar ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro // bstan bcos skabs dang 'brel med dang // dbang po las 'das rtags can min //
translated: It was not applied in the context of the examination of the person.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: It was explained in the context of the verse:🔽“It is not a treatise, not related, not beyond the senses, not a sign.”

original: gal te 'o na ci'i phyir yang phyogs snga mar byas she na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ci'i phyir yang phyogs snga mar byas she na /
translated: If it is not a treatise, etc., then why was it made into a prior position?

original: lung ni phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma nyid yin ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ni phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma nyid yin ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It was in order to refute the validity of scripture with regard to external objects.

original: sngar ni khas blangs nas tshad mar bshad pa de nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngar ni khas blangs nas tshad mar bshad pa de nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove that what was previously accepted as valid cognition is not valid cognition, he says, “Moreover, etc.”🔽Words do not establish the meaning, because they do not have the nature of things.🔽Words do not establish the meaning, because they do not have the nature of things.

original: sgra rnams dngos po ste rang gi mtshan nyid dang lhan cig tu /
analyzed: sgra rnams dngos po ste rang gi mtshan nyid dang lhan cig tu /
translated: Words do not have the nature of things, because they do not have the nature of the particular.🔽If they do not have the nature of the particular, they do not have the nature of the universal.🔽If they do not have the nature of the particular and the universal, they do not have the nature of things.🔽If they do not have the nature of things, they do not have the nature of non-things.🔽If they do not have the nature of things and non-things, they do not have the nature of existence and non-existence.🔽If they do not have the nature of existence and non-existence, they do not have the nature of being and non-being.

original: med na mi 'byung nyid med phyir //🔽sgra de la don grub pa min te phyi rol gyi dngos po nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nyid med phyir // sgra de la don grub pa min te phyi rol gyi dngos po nges pa ma yin no //
translated: If they do not have the nature of being and non-being, they do not have the nature of the existent and the non-existent.🔽If they do not have the nature of the existent and the non-existent, they do not have the nature of the permanent and the impermanent.🔽If they do not have the nature of the permanent and the impermanent, they do not have the nature of the pure and the impure.

original: 'o na de gang dag la tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang dag la tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: If they do not have the nature of the pure and the impure, they do not have the nature of the self and the non-self.

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽smra ba po brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'ga' zhig rnam par gnas pa ston par byed pa ste go bar byed pa yin no //🔽de bshad par bya ba'i phyir /🔽sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / smra ba po brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'ga' zhig rnam par gnas pa ston par byed pa ste go bar byed pa yin no // de bshad par bya ba'i phyir / sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If they do not have the nature of the self and the non-self, they do not have the nature of the happy and the unhappy.🔽If they do not have the nature of the happy and the unhappy, they do not have the nature of the empty and the non-empty.🔽If they do not have the nature of the empty and the non-empty, they do not have the nature of the signless and the wishless.🔽If they do not have the nature of the signless and the wishless, they do not have the nature of the undirected and the unattached.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: If they do not have the nature of the undirected and the unattached, they do not have the nature of the unarisen and the unceased.🔽If they do not have the nature of the unarisen and the unceased, they do not have the nature of the stainless and the

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir sgra de dag la don gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir sgra de dag la don gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Because of that, those words have the nature of an object,

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid nges par gyur na sgra de dag ni smra ba po brjod par 'dod pa la rag lus pas 'jug pa can dag ste /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid nges par gyur na sgra de dag ni smra ba po brjod par 'dod pa la rag lus pas 'jug pa can dag ste /
translated: because they engage in accordance with the entity. If the nature of the entity is ascertained, those words are engaged by dependence on the speaker’s desire to express.

original: de la rag lus pa skye ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la rag lus pa skye ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “arising in dependence on that” is that.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: If that does not occur, they do not occur.

original: rjod par byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: If the desire to express does not occur, they do not occur.

original: de nyid ces bya pa brjod par 'dod pa kho na ni go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya pa brjod par 'dod pa kho na ni go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: That very desire to express is the cause of understanding, not an external particular.

original: sgra dag ni brjod par 'dod pa'i go bar byed pa yin yang de'i phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid med par mi 'byung ba de bas na /
analyzed: sgra dag ni brjod par 'dod pa'i go bar byed pa yin yang de'i phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid med par mi 'byung ba de bas na /
translated: Even though words are the cause of understanding the desire to express, they do not occur without the external particular. Therefore,

original: sgra rnams dang dngos po dag lhan cig 'brel pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra rnams dang dngos po dag lhan cig 'brel pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: words and entities have a relationship of coexistence.

original: de'i phyir @242b skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir @242b skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “a person, etc.”

original: don ji lta ba bzhin te dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin te dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of being just as the object is called “just as the object.”

original: nyes pa zad pa brtse ba dang ldan pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa brtse ba dang ldan pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: One who has exhausted the faults and is compassionate is one who has the nature of being just as the object.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “all the desires of a person.”

original: gal te don la rag lus pa med kyang sgras don go bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don la rag lus pa med kyang sgras don go bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says, “Even if there is no dependence on the object, the object is understood through the word,”

original: de la rag lus pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la rag lus pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “There is no dependence on that,” etc.

original: dngos po de la rag lus pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgra'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po de la rag lus pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgra'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that there is no dependence on that thing, which has the nature of a word that is not dependent on that thing.

original: gang la rag lus pa med pa ni gzhan de'i go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la rag lus pa med pa ni gzhan de'i go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which is not dependent on something else is not the understander of that.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po la sgra tshad ma nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po la sgra tshad ma nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the external thing is not the valid cognition itself,

original: 'on kyang gang 'di yid ches tshig ni mi slu ba spyi las te gang dang gang nyes pa zad pa'i tshig de dang de ni mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang 'di yid ches tshig ni mi slu ba spyi las te gang dang gang nyes pa zad pa'i tshig de dang de ni mi slu ba yin te /
translated: then the statement of the trustworthy person is non-deceptive in general, because whatever statement of the one whose faults are exhausted is non-deceptive.

original: dper na 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “all conditioned things are momentary,” and so on.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la nyes par zad pa'i tshig 'di yang yin no //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la nyes par zad pa'i tshig 'di yang yin no //
translated: This statement of the one whose faults are exhausted is also non-deceptive with regard to the meaning that is extremely hidden.

original: de bas na 'di yang mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta na nyes pa zad pa'i tshig ni mi slu ba spyi las rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di yang mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta na nyes pa zad pa'i tshig ni mi slu ba spyi las rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, this is also non-deceptive. Thus, the statement of the one whose faults are exhausted is non-deceptive in general, and is inferred in that way.

original: slob dpon gyi lung ni phyi rol gyi don la rjes su dpag pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi lung ni phyi rol gyi don la rjes su dpag pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement of the master is said to be an inference with regard to external objects.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni khas blangs la gnod par smras pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni khas blangs la gnod par smras pa'o //
translated: By this “just as,” and so on, he states the contradiction in the assertion.

original: skyes bu 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: skyes bu 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The passage beginning with “The person named . . .” is the reply.

original: 'di skad du slob dpon gyis dngos su tshad ma nyid du brjod pas lung rjes su dpag pa nyid du gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du slob dpon gyis dngos su tshad ma nyid du brjod pas lung rjes su dpag pa nyid du gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the master explicitly states that scripture is inference,

original: 'on kyang skyes bu'i 'jug pa la ltos nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu'i 'jug pa la ltos nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: but rather that he teaches it in terms of the engagement of a person.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu 'jug par 'dod pa 'di lung gi tshad mal ma brten par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu 'jug par 'dod pa 'di lung gi tshad mal ma brten par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: For, if one wishes to engage in the path, one cannot do so without relying on the valid knowledge of scripture.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin pa lkog tu gyur pa gang dag la yod pa de dag la ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin pa lkog tu gyur pa gang dag la yod pa de dag la ste /
translated: It is because the person who has the unseen, which is not directly perceived, is the person who has the result.

original: la la dag gis 'jug pa dang ldog pa zhes bya bas ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: la la dag gis 'jug pa dang ldog pa zhes bya bas ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Some connect “engagement and disengagement” with “that” in the phrase “that which is not directly perceived.”

original: 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i sems pa'i khyad par ldog pa'i mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis phan yon chen po thob pa'i phyir dang / 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i sems pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gis 'jug pa'i dmyal ba la sogs pa nyid @243a * //
analyzed: 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i sems pa'i khyad par ldog pa'i mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis phan yon chen po thob pa'i phyir dang / 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i sems pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gis 'jug pa'i dmyal ba la sogs pa nyid @243a * //
translated: Because they obtain great benefits through the result of higher rebirth and so on, which is the opposite of the specific intention to harm and so on, and because they enter hell and so on through the specific intention to harm and so on.🔽

original: kyis ngan song chen po thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyis ngan song chen po thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains great benefit through the result of high status, such as the reversal of the specific intention to engage in livelihood and so on, and because one hears of the great evil of the lower rebirths, such as hell, through the specific intention to engage in harm and so on.

original: 'di la yang dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i gzhan sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di la yang dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i gzhan sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Here, if there is no valid knowledge that engages by the power of the thing to be established,

original: gang gi lung ltos pa med par tshad ma gzhan la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi lung ltos pa med par tshad ma gzhan la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: then how could one engage in valid knowledge that does not rely on scripture?

original: gnod pa can yang yod pa ma yin la gang la ltos par 'gyur gnod pa can med pa nyid na de yod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa can yang yod pa ma yin la gang la ltos par 'gyur gnod pa can med pa nyid na de yod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And if there is no harm, then what would it rely on?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa las 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa yod pa la 'gal ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di lung gi dbang gis 'jug par 'dod pa de bas na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa las 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa yod pa la 'gal ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro // 'di lung gi dbang gis 'jug par 'dod pa de bas na /
translated: Because we see no contradiction in the existence of desired and undesired results from engagement and disengagement as explained.🔽Since you assert engagement on the basis of scripture,

original: 'jug par bya ba yod na 'di ltar lung yongs su brtags nas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba yod na 'di ltar lung yongs su brtags nas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: if there is engagement, it is engagement after examining scripture.

original: slob dpon gyis lung brtags nas tshad mar gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis lung brtags nas tshad mar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore the Acarya declared scripture to be valid after examining it.

original: bstan bcos thams cad yongs su brtags pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad yongs su brtags pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Not all treatises are composed on the basis of examining everything,

original: 'on kyang de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / de yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
translated: but rather, as it is said,🔽the treatise is composed on the basis of examining the subject matter and the purpose of the treatise.🔽The subject matter is the meaning of the words, and the purpose is the result of the treatise.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.

original: tshig gi don dag phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nus pa 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i thabs gang yin pa de ni rjes su mthun pas thabs te /
analyzed: tshig gi don dag phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nus pa 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i thabs gang yin pa de ni rjes su mthun pas thabs te /
translated: The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽 The treatise is composed for the sake of the result.🔽The treatise is composed for the

original: 'brel pa yang de yin la rjes su ma mthun pa'i thabs kyang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang de yin la rjes su ma mthun pa'i thabs kyang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The word also is used to include the following: It is a relation and also a method of non-concordant subsequent cognition.

original: gzhan dag ni 'brel pa'i sgra ni dbang du byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtha' can yin par brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'brel pa'i sgra ni dbang du byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtha' can yin par brjod de /
translated: Others say that the word relation is used at the end of the word 'control'.

original: de yang / dag gi tshig don 'brel pa med //
analyzed: de yang / dag gi tshig don 'brel pa med //
translated: And it is said: The word 'relation' has no meaning.

original: ces bya ba dbang du byed pa sgrub pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba dbang du byed pa sgrub pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen that control is the establishment of that.

original: de ltar na ngag gi sgra dang gzhi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ngag gi sgra dang gzhi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the word of speech becomes the common basis.

original: gal te de lta bur gyur pa yin yang skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur pa yin yang skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Even if it is so, when the meaning of a person is what is to be expressed,

original: ngag yongs su brtags pas dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag yongs su brtags pas dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: it is controlled by the examination of speech.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin de las gzhan pa yongs su brtags pas dbang byas min no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin de las gzhan pa yongs su brtags pas dbang byas min no //
translated: It is not controlled by the examination of anything other than that nature explained.

original: 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with The relation... and so on.

original: ngag rnams gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ngag rnams gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: The speech is primary and non-primary.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang btang snyoms su bya ba'i don gcig la sdud pa ste /🔽'phrod par byed pa des phan 'dogs par byed pas te /🔽ston par byed pa ni ngag rnams kyis 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang btang snyoms su bya ba'i don gcig la sdud pa ste / 'phrod par byed pa des phan 'dogs par byed pas te / ston par byed pa ni ngag rnams kyis 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.🔽The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.🔽The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.

original: gang dag bsdur med pa yang yin zhe na /🔽se'u bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag bsdur med pa yang yin zhe na / se'u bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.🔽The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.🔽The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.🔽The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.🔽The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.

original: @243b se'u bcu dang / khur ba drug dang 'khar gzhong dang / pags pa dang / sha zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i ngag rnams so //
analyzed: @243b se'u bcu dang / khur ba drug dang 'khar gzhong dang / pags pa dang / sha zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i ngag rnams so //
translated: The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.

original: de dag ni don gcig la bsdur med pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni don gcig la bsdur med pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words “to be accomplished, to be refuted, and to be disregarded” is subsumed in one thing.

original: phan tshun ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //🔽de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba 'brel pa nyid yin na 'chad pa po ste bstan bcos byed pa mi mthun pa ste 'brel pa med pa brjod pa nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //🔽de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba 'brel pa nyid yin na 'chad pa po ste bstan bcos byed pa mi mthun pa ste 'brel pa med pa brjod pa nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the words “to be

original: skyes bu 'bras bu 'dod pa 'bras bu gang la thabs nus pa med pa yod pa de ni thabs nus pa med pa can no //
analyzed: skyes bu 'bras bu 'dod pa 'bras bu gang la thabs nus pa med pa yod pa de ni thabs nus pa med pa can no //
translated: The result of a person is the result of an action. That which has no means of attaining it is one that has no means of attaining it.

original: bstan bcos gang la de lta bur gyur pa'i 'bras bu yod pa de ni dpyad par bya ba'i phyir gus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang la de lta bur gyur pa'i 'bras bu yod pa de ni dpyad par bya ba'i phyir gus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That treatise which has such a result is not to be studied because it is to be analyzed.

original: de yang rjes su mthun pa thabs zhes bya ba de'i chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi sgo nas rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rjes su mthun pa thabs zhes bya ba de'i chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi sgo nas rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: And that is explained by the method of its dissimilar properties, which is called the concordant.

original: bstan bcos gang la skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang la skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That treatise which has the result of a person's purpose is called that.

original: de las gzhan pa skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu med pa can dpyad par bya ba'i phyir gus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu med pa can dpyad par bya ba'i phyir gus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is other than that, which has no result of a person's purpose, is not to be studied because it is to be analyzed.

original: thabs nus pa med pa can gyi 'bras bu can gyi dpe na dug zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs nus pa med pa can gyi 'bras bu can gyi dpe na dug zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The example of one that has no means of attaining its result is for the sake of pacifying poison, etc.

original: gal te 'di ltar klu'i rgyal po 'jog po'i spyi gtsug na yod pa'i rin po ches rgyan byas na 'di dug gzhi bar byed do zhes bya ba de yang bsgrub par mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar klu'i rgyal po 'jog po'i spyi gtsug na yod pa'i rin po ches rgyan byas na 'di dug gzhi bar byed do zhes bya ba de yang bsgrub par mi nus pa yin no //
translated: If it were so, then it would be impossible to prove that the jewel on the head of the naga king Takshaka would remove the basis of poison.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu med pa can gyi dpe ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu med pa can gyi dpe ni /
translated: The example of the person whose goal is not an effect is

original: bya rog gi so brtag pa lta bu'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya rog gi so brtag pa lta bu'o zhes bya'o //
translated: like the examination of a crow's teeth.

original: de bzlog pa de ji skad du bshad pa'i gsum po de dag bzlog nas so //
analyzed: de bzlog pa de ji skad du bshad pa'i gsum po de dag bzlog nas so //
translated: The opposite of that is the opposite of the three as just explained.

original: sdud pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel pa dang zhes bya ba de dang / thabs nus pa can dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes mthun thabs zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sdud pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel pa dang zhes bya ba de dang / thabs nus pa can dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes mthun thabs zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: By possessing inclusion he explains connection and by possessing a capable method he explains suitable method.

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa gsum dang bral ba gzhan la gus par bya ba nyid ces bya ba dad pa ni'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa gsum dang bral ba gzhan la gus par bya ba nyid ces bya ba dad pa ni'o //
translated: The opposite of the three, connection and so on, is respecting another which is faith.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan gsum dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos de ni yongs su brtag par byas pas na slu ba bsten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan gsum dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos de ni yongs su brtag par byas pas na slu ba bsten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That treatise which possesses the three qualities as explained in the verse beginning with “that” is not deceptive when it is thoroughly investigated.

original: slu la bsten pa med pa'i bstan bcos de la 'jug pa na skyes bu mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slu la bsten pa med pa'i bstan bcos de la 'jug pa na skyes bu mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters into that treatise which is not deceptive, one becomes a beautiful person.

original: bstan bcos 'di'i mi slu ba yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i mi slu ba yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-deceptiveness of this treatise?

original: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: “seen and unseen objects, direct perception and inference.”

original: don gyi sgra dang po ni brjod pa yin la gnyis pa ni yul brjod pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: don gyi sgra dang po ni brjod pa yin la gnyis pa ni yul brjod pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: The first word “object” refers to the expressed meaning, and the second refers to the expressed object.

original: don ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i dngos po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul gyi don de dag la go @244a * //
analyzed: don ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i dngos po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul gyi don de dag la go @244a * //
translated: Therefore, the objects are the objects of direct perception and inference, which are seen and unseen things.

original: rims bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med pa bstan bcos 'di'i mi slu ba zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: rims bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med pa bstan bcos 'di'i mi slu ba zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The non-deceptiveness of this treatise is the non-contradiction of those objects by direct perception and inference, respectively.

original: ci dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa kho nas gnod pa byed pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa kho nas gnod pa byed pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it only an inference based on the power of fact that is invalidated?

original: ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To show that it is not so, he says, “even the two kinds of direct perception.”

original: dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa dang lung la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa dang lung la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is based on the power of fact and on scripture.

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “direct perception, etc.”

original: bstan bcos la mngon sum du 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos la mngon sum du 'dod pa ste /
translated: The treatises are accepted as direct perception.

original: mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pa'i don dag la de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba ste mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pa'i don dag la de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba ste mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: The meaning accepted as direct perception is just as it is, i.e., it is direct perception, and is not invalidated by direct perception.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la mngon sum du 'dod pa'i don phung po lngas bsdus pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la mngon sum du 'dod pa'i don phung po lngas bsdus pa ston par byed do //
translated: With “for example,” etc., he shows the meaning accepted as direct perception in his own philosophical system, which is included in the five aggregates.

original: sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga bstan to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga bstan to //
translated: With “blue, etc.,” he shows the five objects, form, etc.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi phung po bshad pa yin no bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi phung po bshad pa yin no bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
translated: Pleasure and pain are the feeling aggregate,🔽because they are the clear experience of pleasure and pain.

original: nyams su myong ba gsal ba nyid kyi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal gzung gi 'dir btang snyoms kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gsal ba nyid kyi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal gzung gi 'dir btang snyoms kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, equanimity should also be considered.

original: rgyu mtshan ni skyes bu la sogs pa'i rtags de 'di nye bar mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni skyes bu la sogs pa'i rtags de 'di nye bar mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: The reason is the sign of a person, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: This explains the perception aggregate.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa smos pas 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa smos pas 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: Desire, etc. are the formation aggregate.

original: sogs kyi sgras ni zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras ni zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes hatred, delusion, etc.

original: blo smos pas ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: blo smos pas ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The word “mind” explains the consciousness aggregate.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang rgyu mtshan nye bar mtshon par byed pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang blo dang zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang rgyu mtshan nye bar mtshon par byed pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang blo dang zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Blue, etc., pleasure and pain, the reason, the sign, desire, etc., and mind are the terms of the compound.

original: bstan bcos la mngon sum du 'dod pa de dag ni mngon sum kho na yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la mngon sum du 'dod pa de dag ni mngon sum kho na yin te /
translated: Those who assert that the treatises are direct perception are direct perception itself.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dag ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dag ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because blue, etc. are direct perception of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dag kyang rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dag kyang rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because pleasure, etc. are direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum yang 'og nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum yang 'og nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Reflexive awareness will be established later.

original: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa dag ni mngon sum du 'dod pa ma yin pa'i don kyang mngon sum ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa dag ni mngon sum du 'dod pa ma yin pa'i don kyang mngon sum ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: Those who do not assert that are not direct perception, because they are not direct perception of the object that is not asserted to be direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context of “not contradicted by direct perception.”

original: mngon sum du 'dod pa ma yin pa dag kyang dper na zhes bya ba la sogs @244b bas bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dod pa ma yin pa dag kyang dper na zhes bya ba la sogs @244b bas bstan to //
translated: Those who do not assert direct perception are taught by “for example,” etc.

original: gzhan dag gis mngon sum nyid du bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' mngon sum dag ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mngon sum nyid du bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' mngon sum dag ma yin te /
translated: Those that are taught as direct perception by others are not direct perception in the Buddhist philosophical system.

original: rnam pa dpyad par gyur pa'i de dag kyang mngon sum nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dpyad par gyur pa'i de dag kyang mngon sum nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: And those which are analyzed into aspects are also not perception.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ste sdug bsngal dang gti mug gang dag la sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bor zhen pa'i ngang tshul gang yin pa de dag ni mngon sum nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ste sdug bsngal dang gti mug gang dag la sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bor zhen pa'i ngang tshul gang yin pa de dag ni mngon sum nyid ma yin no //
translated: Those which are the nature of sound, etc., which have the mode of apprehending pleasure, etc., pain and delusion, are not perception.

original: nang gi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i ngo bo bde ba dang sdug bsngal du myong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nang gi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i ngo bo bde ba dang sdug bsngal du myong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The nature of inner joy and distress is experienced as pleasure and pain.

original: gzhan sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhen pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhen pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig ma yin no //
translated: It is not just the nature of pleasure, etc., which is the nature of sound, etc., that is apprehended.

original: de ltar grangs can gyi 'dod pa spong ba'i sko nas bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar grangs can gyi 'dod pa spong ba'i sko nas bshad nas /
translated: Having explained this in order to refute the assertions of the Samkhyas,

original: bye brag pa la sogs pa'i 'dod pa spangs pa'i phyir rdzas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bye brag pa la sogs pa'i 'dod pa spangs pa'i phyir rdzas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to refute the assertions of the Vaiśeṣikas, etc., he says, “substance,” etc.

original: rdzas ni yan lag can gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: rdzas ni yan lag can gyi ming ngo //
translated: Substance is the name of the whole.

original: las ni 'degs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni 'degs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Action is lifting, etc.

original: spyi ni yod pa nyid dang ba lang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi ni yod pa nyid dang ba lang la sogs pa'o //
translated: Universality is existence, cow, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam par phye ba la sogs pa gzung ngo ;
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam par phye ba la sogs pa gzung ngo ;
translated: The words “and so on” include the distinction.

original: / sngon po la sogs pa'i yul ma gtogs par gzhan mngon sum nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / sngon po la sogs pa'i yul ma gtogs par gzhan mngon sum nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the object such as blue, there is no other direct perception,

original: de ma gtogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang spyi mngon sum nyid ma yin pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang spyi mngon sum nyid ma yin pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: because it is not perceived apart from that, and it has already been explained that a universal is not a direct perception.

original: rdzas la sogs pa dag kyang le'u gsum pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa dag kyang le'u gsum pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The existence of substance and so on will be discussed in chapter three.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni lung la ltos pa med pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni lung la ltos pa med pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Inference based on the power of fact is inference that does not rely on scripture.

original: de'i yul nyid du 'dod pa dag la de bzhin du 'gyur pa ste /🔽rjes su dpag pa'i yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yul nyid du 'dod pa dag la de bzhin du 'gyur pa ste / rjes su dpag pa'i yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of that is the object of inference.

original: de'i yul du 'dod pa rjes su dpag pas gnod par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i yul du 'dod pa rjes su dpag pas gnod par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The object of that is refuted by inference, as in the case of the example of the reflection of a face in a mirror.

original: de yang 'og nas le'u gnyis pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'og nas le'u gnyis pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later in chapter two.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa dag ni de ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa dag ni de ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyid do //
translated: It is not to be inferred, because it is not to be inferred.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: dper na bdag la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na bdag la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, the self, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzung ngo//
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzung ngo//
translated: The word “etc.” includes pradhāna, Īśvara, etc.

original: de dag ni gang gi rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ba'i rtags cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gang gi rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ba'i rtags cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest reason for inferring them.

original: re zhig rang bzhin gyi rtags ni ma yin te de'i rang bzhin nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig rang bzhin gyi rtags ni ma yin te de'i rang bzhin nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, they are not reasons of nature, because their nature is the nature of what is to be proven.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags kyang ma yin te rtag pa dag gi 'bras bu mi rung ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags kyang ma yin te rtag pa dag gi 'bras bu mi rung ba'i phyir ro//
translated: They are also not reasons of effect, because the effect of permanent things is not tenable.

original: @245a * // dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyis lung rnam par dag pa'i dus phyis tshad ma khas len pa can gyi bstan bcos kyi chos can rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: @245a * // dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyis lung rnam par dag pa'i dus phyis tshad ma khas len pa can gyi bstan bcos kyi chos can rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: The two valid cognitions that engage by the power of the thing establish the subject of the treatise, the pure scripture, and later, the valid cognition that accepts it.

original: snga phyi 'gal ba rjes su dpag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga phyi 'gal ba rjes su dpag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the contradiction between the earlier and later [statements], it is inferred.

original: gang gi tshe khyad par dpyod pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe lung la ltos pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par dpyod pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe lung la ltos pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: When one engages in the analysis of the distinction, then there is the inference that relies on scripture.

original: lung la ltos pa'i rjes su dpag pa de la gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: lung la ltos pa'i rjes su dpag pa de la gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the section on the non-defeat of the inference that relies on scripture.

original: de la gnod pa med pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la gnod pa med pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the non-defeat like?

original: dper na 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is like what is stated with attachment and so forth.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of attachment and so forth.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rang bzhin chos ma yin pa khas blangs pa dang / de las byung ba ste 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas bslangs pa'i lus dang ngag gi las chos ma yin pa khas blangs nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rang bzhin chos ma yin pa khas blangs pa dang / de las byung ba ste 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas bslangs pa'i lus dang ngag gi las chos ma yin pa khas blangs nas /
translated: and the nature of desire, hatred and ignorance is not Dharma, and that which arises from them, that is, the actions of body and speech motivated by desire, etc., are not Dharma.

original: de spangs pa ste chos ma yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir khrus dang me la spyin sreg la sogs pa dang / 'bab stegs kyi khrus kyis sdig ba zad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de spangs pa ste chos ma yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir khrus dang me la spyin sreg la sogs pa dang / 'bab stegs kyi khrus kyis sdig ba zad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Having accepted that, they do not teach that in order to eliminate that, that is, in order to remove that which is not Dharma, one should perform ablutions, fire offerings, etc., or that one’s sins will be exhausted by bathing at a ford.

original: gang gi ched du me la mar la sogs pa'i spyin sreg byas pas sdig pa zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ma bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi ched du me la mar la sogs pa'i spyin sreg byas pas sdig pa zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ma bstan to //
translated: They do not teach that by offering butter, etc., into the fire for the sake of someone, that person’s sins will be exhausted.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni za gcod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni za gcod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes fasting, etc.

original: de ltar na khrus la sogs pas sdig pa ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na khrus la sogs pas sdig pa ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, ablutions, etc., do not remove sins,

original: sdig pa'i nye par len pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sdig pa'i nye par len pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because they are not antidotes to the appropriation of sin, desire, etc.

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod pa mi byed pa de ni de'i gnod pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod pa mi byed pa de ni de'i gnod pa can ma yin te /
translated: That which does not harm the cause of something is not harmful to it.

original: dper na bad kan can gyi nad la mngar ba dang bsil ba dang snum pa'i rdzas dag gnod pa can ma yin pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bad kan can gyi nad la mngar ba dang bsil ba dang snum pa'i rdzas dag gnod pa can ma yin pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, sweet, cold, and oily substances are not harmful to one who is ill with phlegm.

original: khrus la sogs pa ni sdig pa'i rgyu la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dang dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khrus la sogs pa ni sdig pa'i rgyu la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dang dmigs pa'o //
translated: Bathing, etc. are not harmful to the cause of sin.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su gcod par nus te /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su gcod par nus te /
translated: The two kinds of valid knowledge, direct perception and inference, just explained, are able to ascertain.

original: yongs su gcod par nges pa'i gnod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par dag pa de ni mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par nges pa'i gnod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par dag pa de ni mi slu ba yin no //
translated: That pure which has the characteristic of being free from doubt and error is non-deceptive.

original: nyes pa zad pa'i tshig de ni mi slu bar mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa'i tshig de ni mi slu bar mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: That statement about the exhaustion of faults is similar to being non-deceptive.

original: ci ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas mi slu pa'i don yongs su gcod par nus pa la nyes pa zad pa'i tshig mi slu ba de ltar shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas mi slu pa'i don yongs su gcod par nus pa la nyes pa zad pa'i tshig mi slu ba de ltar shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yang yin te /
translated: Just as a non-erroneous statement of one who has exhausted the faults is able to ascertain a non-erroneous object by means of direct perception and inference, so also is the extremely obscure object.

original: nyes pa zad pa'i chog nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa'i chog nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of one who has exhausted the faults.

original: de @245b bas na don la mi slu ba nyes pa zad pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid can gyi rtags las byug pa'i blo ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du slob dpon gyis brjod do //
analyzed: de @245b bas na don la mi slu ba nyes pa zad pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid can gyi rtags las byug pa'i blo ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du slob dpon gyis brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the master has stated that the cognition produced from a sign that has the characteristic of a non-erroneous statement of one who has exhausted the faults is inference itself.

original: yul gang la zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang la zhe na /
translated: What is the object?

original: 'di'i lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “The object that is obscure to it.”

original: bstan bcos 'di'i lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i yul te spyod yul la yang ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i yul te spyod yul la yang ngo //
translated: The obscure object of this treatise is the extremely obscure object, the domain.

original: de yang go skabs med de rnam pa gzhan gyis shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang go skabs med de rnam pa gzhan gyis shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not possible, because there is no other mode of engaging with the extremely obscure.

original: 'jug pa yod na de ltar 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa yod na de ltar 'jug pa'o //
translated: If there were engagement, it would be like that.

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas chad pa la /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas chad pa la /
translated: “Such a person” and so on indicates the fallacy of infinite regress.

original: de dang 'di zhes bya ba ni ming thams cad pa gnyis kyis ni chod pa dang thag nye ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'di zhes bya ba ni ming thams cad pa gnyis kyis ni chod pa dang thag nye ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: “ That and this” are two terms that indicate the fallacy of infinite regress.

original: 'di skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid can de dang / kho bo cag gis 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par dpyad par bya ba 'di ni zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid can de dang / kho bo cag gis 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par dpyad par bya ba 'di ni zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase “this is what is to be analyzed” indicates that the master Dignāga’s inference is the same as that taught by the master, and that it is similar to what we have explained with the words “the relation and the method.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For that reason, he says, “such a person,”

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning “one who possesses the qualities of the relation and so on.”

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i dngos po de la mi slu bar mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ma mthong bar 'khrul pa med pa can te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i dngos po de la mi slu bar mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ma mthong bar 'khrul pa med pa can te /
translated: Because the cause of nondeception is the same in both perception and inference, there is no error in not seeing it.

original: nyes pa zad pa'i tshig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go ba ma yin pa'i don te yul nyes pa zad pa'i tshig las byung ba'i rtogs pa ni mi slu ba'i rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa'i tshig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go ba ma yin pa'i don te yul nyes pa zad pa'i tshig las byung ba'i rtogs pa ni mi slu ba'i rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words “exhaustion of faults” is not understood through direct perception or inference. The realization that arises from the words “exhaustion of faults” is an inference that is nondeceptive.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la brten pa nyid kyi phyir te nyes pa zad pa'i tshig la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa nyid kyi phyir te nyes pa zad pa'i tshig la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on that, that is, because it is based on the words “exhaustion of faults.”

original: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is similar to other realizations.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa las gzhan pa ste /
translated: It is different from those that are extremely hidden.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i yul rtogs pas lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i yul rtogs pas lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the realization of the object that is understood through direct perception and inference.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang ji skad du bshad pa'i lung gi khyad par la brten pa'i rtogs pa de dang de ni mi slu ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang ji skad du bshad pa'i lung gi khyad par la brten pa'i rtogs pa de dang de ni mi slu ba can yin te /
translated: The application is this: Any realization that is based on the specific scriptures that have been explained in this text is nondeceptive.

original: dper na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i don ma lus par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i don ma lus par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the complete realization of the meaning that is understood through direct perception and inference.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i lung gi khyad par la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i lung gi khyad par la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i gnas bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis gnas gsum pa bshad pa yin no zhes gang la nges pa yin /🔽de bas na 'dir shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i @246a * //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba'i gnas bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis gnas gsum pa bshad pa yin no zhes gang la nges pa yin / de bas na 'dir shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i @246a * //
translated: How can one be certain that the third point is explained by the very explanation of the point that is to be understood through direct perception and inference?

original: rtogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i lung gi khyad par la brten pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs la the tshom za ba'i ma grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i lung gi khyad par la brten pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs la the tshom za ba'i ma grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, here, the reason “the realization of a meaning that is extremely obscure is also based on a special scripture, as has been explained” is inconclusive.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: re zhig bstan pa thag nye ba can gyi nyan pa po gang yin pa de dag ni ston pa gcig gis gnas gsum pa yang bstan par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: re zhig bstan pa thag nye ba can gyi nyan pa po gang yin pa de dag ni ston pa gcig gis gnas gsum pa yang bstan par 'gyur ba na /
translated: Those who are close to the teaching, who are the listeners, when the Teacher explains the third point,

original: mngon sum nyid du khong du chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du khong du chud pa'i phyir /
translated: they understand it through direct perception.

original: de lta bas kyang nyes pa zad par byas pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas kyang nyes pa zad par byas pa las kyang yin te /
translated: Therefore, the ultimate is also the exhaustion of faults,

original: nyes pa zad pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic of the word “exhaustion” is the exhaustion of faults.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde la sogs pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde la sogs pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the sūtras, etc. are the entrance to the Dharma,🔽and that the three types of Dharma are impermanent,

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig ma /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig ma /
translated: all conditioned things are momentary,

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i chos rnam pa gsum la lugs las bzlog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i chos rnam pa gsum la lugs las bzlog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: all phenomena are selfless,🔽and nirvāṇa is peace.

original: da 'das nas kyang khyed cag gis sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da 'das nas kyang khyed cag gis sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: You should hold that which is not contrary to these three types of Dharma to be the word of the Buddha.

original: gnas gsum pa yang chos nyid lugs las ldog pa med par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas gsum pa yang chos nyid lugs las ldog pa med par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The third point is that the ultimate is not contrary to the way things are.

original: skad cig ma dang bdag med pa la sogs pa med pa dang ldan pa'i gnas gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / chos nyid dang 'gal pa'i nyes pa zang pa'i tshig lo khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang bdag med pa la sogs pa med pa dang ldan pa'i gnas gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / chos nyid dang 'gal pa'i nyes pa zang pa'i tshig lo khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third point is taught in order to show that the Buddha is not endowed with the three faults of being nonexistent, of being permanent, and of being devoid of momentariness and selflessness, and in order to show that he does not accept the words of those who have the fault of contradicting reality.

original: gal te nyes pa zad pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid nyes pa zad par byas pa de nyid yin no zhes gang las nges she na /
analyzed: gal te nyes pa zad pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid nyes pa zad par byas pa de nyid yin no zhes gang las nges she na /
translated: If the characteristic of the one who has exhausted faults is the exhaustion of faults itself, how is that known?

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir yul thams cad la rigs pa dang ldan par smra ba po yin pa de nyid ni 'jug par 'dod pa yid ches par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul thams cad la rigs pa dang ldan par smra ba po yin pa de nyid ni 'jug par 'dod pa yid ches par bya ba yin te /
translated: Because he speaks reasonably about all objects, he is trustworthy when he wishes to engage.

original: zhar la 'dos pas chog go //🔽shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ji skad du bshad pa'i don la mi slu ba des na /
analyzed: zhar la 'dos pas chog go // shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ji skad du bshad pa'i don la mi slu ba des na /
translated: Enough with this digression.🔽In the case of a very hidden object, the meaning explained by the words of the Buddha is not deceptive.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i lung la brten pa'i blo'i sgras rab tu bshad pa can yin du zin kyang ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i lung la brten pa'i blo'i sgras rab tu bshad pa can yin du zin kyang ste /
translated: Therefore, even though the meaning of the scriptures is explained by the words of the scriptures,

original: gang la sgra las byung zhing skye ba yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la sgra las byung zhing skye ba yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound “arisen from sound” is to be analyzed as “that which has arisen from sound.”

original: sgra las byung ba 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgra las byung ba'i rkyen gzhan tsam ston par byed pa de bzhin du blo 'di ni bsam pa nyid ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgra las byung ba'i rkyen gzhan tsam ston par byed pa de bzhin du blo 'di ni bsam pa nyid ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: “Like that which arises from sound” means that, just as the sound causes the appearance of something else, in the same way, this cognition does not reveal the intention itself.

original: de ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa'i don la bstan ma thag pa'i tshul du mi slu ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa'i don la bstan ma thag pa'i tshul du mi slu ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang yin te /
translated: Thus, because it is non-deceptive with regard to the object that is understood through perception and inference, in the manner that has just been explained, inference is also a means of valid cognition.

original: skyes bu 'jug par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'jug par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: It is because of the power of the intention of the person who wishes to engage in it.

original: blang bya dang ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang @246b dor bya ni sdug bsngal thams cad do //
analyzed: blang bya dang ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang @246b dor bya ni sdug bsngal thams cad do //
translated: The object to be accepted is nirvana, because it is the relinquishment of all the afflictions. The object to be rejected is all suffering.

original: de dag gi de nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de dag gi de nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Their reality is the nature that is free from error.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the truth of suffering and the truth of cessation.

original: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni thabs bcas so //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni thabs bcas so //
translated: That which engages the reality of what is to be taken up and what is to be laid aside, together with the means, is “together with the means.

original: dor par bya ba'i thabs ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dor par bya ba'i thabs ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The means of what is to be laid aside is the truth of origination.

original: blang bar bya ba'i thabs ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba'i thabs ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The means of what is to be taken up is the truth of the path.

original: blang bar bya ba dang dor par bya ba de nyid thabs dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa 'di ni dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i tshad mas rab tu nges pa ste rab tu grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang dor par bya ba de nyid thabs dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa 'di ni dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i tshad mas rab tu nges pa ste rab tu grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One’s teaching of just that reality of what is to be taken up and what is to be laid aside, together with the means, is “together with the means.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtso bo'i don las mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtso bo'i don las mi slu ba ste /
translated: It is “not deceptive” with regard to the primary meaning of the four noble truths taught by the Blessed One,

original: bden pa bzhi'i don gyi gtso bo de khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i don gyi gtso bo de khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains nirvana by understanding that primary meaning of the four noble truths.

original: gtso bo'i don la slu ba med pa de'i phyir shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don gzhan la bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las skyes pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i don la slu ba med pa de'i phyir shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don gzhan la bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las skyes pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Since the Lord’s words are not deceptive with regard to the principal matter, the knowledge born from the words of the Lord with regard to other matters that are extremely hidden is inference.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni rab tu dbye ba snga ma la ltos nas rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni rab tu dbye ba snga ma la ltos nas rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
translated: The word “also” has the sense of a distinction based on the previous one.

original: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dag gi thabs ni de'i thabs te /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dag gi thabs ni de'i thabs te /
translated: The means of accepting and rejecting is the method of that.

original: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i thabs zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i thabs zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The method of accepting and rejecting is a compound.

original: des bstan pa dag la ste /
analyzed: des bstan pa dag la ste /
translated: With regard to those taught by him,

original: yid ches pa des bstan pa de dag la rjes su dpag pas brtags pas na yang phyin ci log med cing de kho na bzhin yin pa ni mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: yid ches pa des bstan pa de dag la rjes su dpag pas brtags pas na yang phyin ci log med cing de kho na bzhin yin pa ni mi slu ba yin te /
translated: since those taught by him are examined by inference, they are also non-erroneous and just as they are, and thus are not deceptive.

original: dper na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag le'u gnyis pa las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul te dpyad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag le'u gnyis pa las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul te dpyad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, with regard to the four noble truths such as suffering, it is like the method of analysis that will be explained in chapter two.

original: de dang 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gong du bstan pa de dang de ni rnam par 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid can 'di'o //
analyzed: de dang 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gong du bstan pa de dang de ni rnam par 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid can 'di'o //
translated: “This and that” refers to the above teaching of the Lord, which is “this” because it is an exposition, and it is “that” because it is a characteristic of the four noble truths.

original: ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /🔽skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba can te /
analyzed: ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na / skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba can te /
translated: How is it so?🔽It is “useful for the purpose of man” because it is the cause of the purpose of man.

original: skyes bu'i don ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: The purpose of man is nirvana.

original: de nye bar mkho ba ni rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: de nye bar mkho ba ni rgyu nyid de /
translated: It is useful because it is the cause of that.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba can no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba can no //
translated: That which has that is “useful for the purpose of man.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir goms par bya bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir goms par bya bar 'os pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is “worthy of being cultivated.”

original: mngon par sbyar bar 'os pa ni mi slu ba'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul gzhan la yang kho na bzhin du khas blang bar bya ba zhes bya ba mi slu bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir ni
analyzed: mngon par sbyar bar 'os pa ni mi slu ba'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul gzhan la yang kho na bzhin du khas blang bar bya ba zhes bya ba mi slu bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir ni
translated: It is “worthy of being applied” because it is not deceptive. It is not that it is worthy of being accepted as another object that is not understood by perception or inference, but rather it is worthy of being accepted as non-deceptive.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is worthy of being accepted as non-deceptive.

original: gtso bo ma yin pa'i don la slu ba'i @247a * //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa'i don la slu ba'i @247a * //
translated: It is deceptive with regard to a non-primary object.

original: phyir rtag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir rtag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not permanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: skyes bu'i gtso bo'i don la tshad mas slu ba med pa can la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i gtso bo'i don la tshad mas slu ba med pa can la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction with the authoritative cognition that is undeceived with regard to the meaning of the principal person.

original: gnas gsum pa la khas blangs pa'i mi slu ba'i tshig ni skyes bu'i don gyi skabs dang 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas gsum pa la khas blangs pa'i mi slu ba'i tshig ni skyes bu'i don gyi skabs dang 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the third case, the statement that is undeceived by assertion is not contradicted in the least by the context of the meaning of the principal person.

original: bden pa bzhi phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad pa ni gtso bo'i don la 'jig rten slu ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad pa ni gtso bo'i don la 'jig rten slu ba ma yin te /
translated: The one who teaches the four noble truths without error is not deceived by the world with regard to the principal meaning.
