original: gtso bo'i don la skyes bu ma bslus pas gnas gsum pa la yang 'chad pa po yang dgos pa med par ldog par ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i don la skyes bu ma bslus pas gnas gsum pa la yang 'chad pa po yang dgos pa med par ldog par ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the principal person is not deceived, the one who explains the third case also does not turn away without purpose, because that would be fruitless.

original: gal te skyes bu gtso bo'i don la slu bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu gtso bo'i don la slu bar byed pa yin la /
translated: If one deceives the principal person with regard to the meaning,

original: gzhan la phan pas 'jug pa dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba can yin na /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pas 'jug pa dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba can yin na /
translated: and engages in benefiting others, seeing the meaning beyond the senses,

original: gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig la gzhan mi slu bar 'gyur ba yin pa de'i dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba nyid ni nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig la gzhan mi slu bar 'gyur ba yin pa de'i dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba nyid ni nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is certain that some will not be deceived, but it is not certain that they will see a fact that is beyond the senses.

original: de bas na rigs pas bgrod par bya ba'i skyes bu'i don la mi slu ba yin gyi mi shes pa nyid kyis na shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la slu bar yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rigs pas bgrod par bya ba'i skyes bu'i don la mi slu ba yin gyi mi shes pa nyid kyis na shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la slu bar yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not deceptive with regard to the purpose of a person who proceeds by reasoning, but it is deceptive with regard to what is extremely hidden because of ignorance.

original: nges par mi nus pa can gyi don 'di nyid ni bden te /
analyzed: nges par mi nus pa can gyi don 'di nyid ni bden te /
translated: This very fact that it is not certain is true.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu'i 'jug pa la ltos nas de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu'i 'jug pa la ltos nas de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is posited in that way in dependence on the engagement of a person.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “In that case, etc.”

original: rnam pa gnyi gas kyang zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi gas kyang zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bstan pa rnams so //
translated: “By both aspects” refers to the two verses that were taught.

original: de dang de go skabs med pas lung ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dang de go skabs med pas lung ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since there is no opportunity for that, scripture is said to be inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o ;
translated: Inference should be understood as the cause of inference.

original: ; lung la 'jug pa yod na de lta bu'i lung gi 'brel pas 'jug par bya ba'i don kho na yid la mi slu bar byed pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ; lung la 'jug pa yod na de lta bu'i lung gi 'brel pas 'jug par bya ba'i don kho na yid la mi slu bar byed pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But when there is engagement with scripture, the meaning to be engaged by the connection with such scripture is not necessarily non-deceptive.

original: de ltar na ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ste /
translated: If that is so,

original: bshad pa'i rnam pas kyang lung la brten pa'i shes pa nyes pa med pa ma yin te skyon dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pas kyang lung la brten pa'i shes pa nyes pa med pa ma yin te skyon dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: then the faultless knowledge based on scripture is not as explained, but rather has faults.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra dag ni don rnams la med na mi 'byung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dag ni don rnams la med na mi 'byung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Words do not necessarily arise in dependence on objects,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽sgra rnams dngos dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / sgra rnams dngos dang lhan cig tu //
translated: because there is no connection.🔽This has been explained by such passages as:🔽Words do not have

original: med na mi 'byung nyid med phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nyid med phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
translated: the nature of being invariably concomitant with objects.

original: skyes bu'i phul du byung ba nyid ni nyes pa zad pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i phul du byung ba nyid ni nyes pa zad pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The excellence of a person is the exhaustion of faults and so on.

original: de la ltos pa'i tshig gang yin pa de @247b ni ji bzhin don du gzhan gyis shes te /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i tshig gang yin pa de @247b ni ji bzhin don du gzhan gyis shes te /
translated: Any statement that depends on that is understood by others as it truly is.

original: rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is fully understood.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du mthong ba ste shes pa ni don ji lta ba mthong ba'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du mthong ba ste shes pa ni don ji lta ba mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing things as they truly are is the knowledge that sees things as they are, in accordance with reality.

original: gang la de dang par byas pa'i rtse ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa yod pa de ni don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la de dang par byas pa'i rtse ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa yod pa de ni don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One who has that, who is free from attachment, and so on, is one who sees things as they truly are, and so on.

original: de nyid yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de nyid yon tan yin te /
translated: That itself is a good quality.

original: de dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni nyes pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni nyes pa zad pa'o //
translated: A person who possesses that is one who has exhausted faults.

original: des byas pa ni nyes pa zad pa des sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: des byas pa ni nyes pa zad pa des sbyar ba ste /
translated: That which is done by that is created by the exhaustion of faults.

original: lung ni mi slu ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: lung ni mi slu ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: Scripture is called nondeceptive.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, “If, as you say, the meaning of the words of the scriptures is understood by others, then the scriptures are not nondeceptive.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid ni kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid ni kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The meaning that was just explained is exactly what we assert.

original: kho bo cag ni de lta bur gyur pa spong bar ni mi byed do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni de lta bur gyur pa spong bar ni mi byed do //
translated: We do not reject such a person.

original: 'on kyang gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phul du byung ba de skyes bus nges par shes par nus na de yang shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phul du byung ba de skyes bus nges par shes par nus na de yang shes par mi nus so //
translated: But if that excellence which has the nature of seeing reality, etc. can be ascertained by a person, then that cannot be known.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “realization,” etc.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba thams cad ni lung ngam lung ma yin pa tshol bar byed pa ste dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba thams cad ni lung ngam lung ma yin pa tshol bar byed pa ste dpyod par byed do //
translated: All those who are preceded by conceptual thought seek scripture or non-scripture, i.e., they investigate.

original: lung ma yin pa btang nas lung gi sgo nas 'jug pa can te /
analyzed: lung ma yin pa btang nas lung gi sgo nas 'jug pa can te /
translated: Having abandoned non-scripture, they engage through scripture.

original: lung gi don la nan tan du byed par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lung gi don la nan tan du byed par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: They desire to practice the meaning of scripture,

original: phongs pa ste chags pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phongs pa ste chags pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not out of poverty, i.e., not out of attachment.

original: 'jug pa 'dod pa can de nyid kyang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'dod pa can de nyid kyang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: He also shows that very one who desires to engage with “how,” etc.

original: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni srid par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni srid par gyur pa'o //
translated: “How” means “in what way.”🔽“Also” means “even.”

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
translated: “This” refers to the scriptures.

original: nan tan du byas pa ste /
analyzed: nan tan du byas pa ste /
translated: “One should make an effort” means

original: mngon sum byas pa'i don shes nas 'jug pa na don dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum byas pa'i don shes nas 'jug pa na don dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: that when one engages in the meaning that one has perceived, one will be endowed with the meaning,

original: 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: that is, one will be endowed with the result.

original: de ltar skyes bu tshol bar byed pa na mthong bar nus pa can te nges pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas shes par bya ba'i don gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu tshol bar byed pa na mthong bar nus pa can te nges pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas shes par bya ba'i don gang yin pa de la /
translated: Thus, when a person is seeking, he is able to see, that is, he is able to understand the meaning that is to be known by means of perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis gnod pa med pa ni slu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis gnod pa med pa ni slu ba med pa ste /
translated: That which is not contradicted by perception and inference is nondeceptive.

original: de nyid rkyen de dmigs pa des mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i don gzhan dag la yang 'jug nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen de dmigs pa des mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i don gzhan dag la yang 'jug nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: That very person, by means of that perception, is able to engage in other objects that are not to be known by means of perception and inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni de ltar phal che ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni de ltar phal che ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because worldly convention is generally like this.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yul gcig la mi slu ba mthong bas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad gang la gzhan la 'jug pa phal che ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽gal te skyes bu @248a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yul gcig la mi slu ba mthong bas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad gang la gzhan la 'jug pa phal che ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // gal te skyes bu @248a * //
translated: “Thus” means that, having seen that the words of a person are undeceptive with regard to one object, one engages in the world in most cases.

original: nyes pa zad pa gang yin pa de'i tshig las 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa gang yin pa de'i tshig las 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that the words of a person whose faults are exhausted should be engaged,

original: skyes bu yongs su brtags nas 'jug par khas len par 'gyur ba na mi 'jug pa kho nar 'gyur ro 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu yongs su brtags nas 'jug par khas len par 'gyur ba na mi 'jug pa kho nar 'gyur ro 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would have to accept that one should engage in the world after examining the person, but that is not the case.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu de shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu de shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to know that a person has the good qualities of seeing things as they are and so on.

original: 'jug pa med par brgal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jug pa med par brgal ba yin gyi /
translated: You are arguing that one should not engage in the world,

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dag mi 'dod pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dag mi 'dod pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the case that we do not accept that there are people who have the good qualities of seeing things as they are and so on.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: We Mādhyamikas maintain that such a person does not exist.

original: de dag kyang bden pa smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bden pa smra ba yin no //
translated: They are also truth-tellers.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu de 'dra ba dag ni phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu de 'dra ba dag ni phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because such persons who possess the qualities of seeing things as they are and so on teach without error,

original: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they teach things as they are.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu shes par mi nus pa yang /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu shes par mi nus pa yang /
translated: Such a person cannot be known.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tshad ma rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽skyes bu 'di ni 'di ltar nyes pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / skyes bu 'di ni 'di ltar nyes pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: He says, “because of the unreliability of the valid cognitions.”🔽This person is not like that, that is, he does not possess such faults.

original: min te nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin te 'on kyang nyes pa med pa can ni zhes bya ba ni de ltar te /
analyzed: min te nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin te 'on kyang nyes pa med pa can ni zhes bya ba ni de ltar te /
translated: But he is not without faults, rather he is faultless.

original: gzhan nyes pa med kyang rtogs dka' zhes ni gzhan gyis shes nyes med kyang zhes bya ba de la ltos nas rtogs dka' pa'i zhes bya ba bud med kyi rtags tshig gcig par bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan nyes pa med kyang rtogs dka' zhes ni gzhan gyis shes nyes med kyang zhes bya ba de la ltos nas rtogs dka' pa'i zhes bya ba bud med kyi rtags tshig gcig par bstan te /
translated: The phrase even though others are without fault is a single word for the sign of a woman, difficult to understand.🔽 The phrase even though others are without fault is a single word for the sign of a woman, difficult to understand.

original: gzhan nyes pa zhes bya ba de la ltos nas rtogs dka' zhes bya ba rnam par bsgyur la skyes pa'i rtags kyis mang po'i tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyes pa zhes bya ba de la ltos nas rtogs dka' zhes bya ba rnam par bsgyur la skyes pa'i rtags kyis mang po'i tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase difficult to understand is a word for the sign of a man, difficult to understand.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gzhan gyi yon tan dang nyes pa nges par byed pa dag gi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gzhan gyi yon tan dang nyes pa nges par byed pa dag gi /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad ma rnams ni rnyed dka'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni rnyed dka'i phyir te /
translated: Because the means of knowing the virtues and faults of others are difficult to obtain.

original: thob par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are difficult to obtain,

original: skyes bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: skyes bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: he says men who are engaged in right and wrong conduct, etc.

original: skyes bu gang dag la yang dag pa dang log par 'jug pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyi mtshan nyid can yod pa de dag ni yang dag pa dang log par 'jug pa can yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang dag la yang dag pa dang log par 'jug pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyi mtshan nyid can yod pa de dag ni yang dag pa dang log par 'jug pa can yin no //
translated: Those who have the characteristics of right and wrong conduct of body and speech are engaged in right and wrong conduct.

original: sems las byung ba ni sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni sems las byung ba ste /
translated: Mental factors are mental factors.

original: yon tan dang skyon dag go //🔽sems las byung ba'i yon tan snying rje dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dag las yang dag par 'jug pa can dang / @248b sems las byung ba'i skyon zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu las log par 'jug pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon dag go // sems las byung ba'i yon tan snying rje dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dag las yang dag par 'jug pa can dang / @248b sems las byung ba'i skyon zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu las log par 'jug pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are virtues and faults.🔽They are the causes of the mental factors of compassion, freedom from attachment, realization, and so on, which are correctly engaged, and they are the causes of the mental factors of anger and so on, which are incorrectly engaged.

original: dgongs pa 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du song ba can gyi bsam pa log par ston pa las /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du song ba can gyi bsam pa log par ston pa las /
translated: Some think that the intention to engage in virtue and the intention to refrain from nonvirtue are mental factors that are preceded by the mind.

original: lus dang ngag gi las la yang dag par log par 'jug pa can dag ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las la yang dag par log par 'jug pa can dag ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: But they are not the causes of physical and verbal karma that are correctly engaged or incorrectly engaged.

original: de yang zhes bya ba gzhan dag gi sems las byung ba'i yon tan dang skyon dbang po las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba gzhan dag gi sems las byung ba'i yon tan dang skyon dbang po las 'das pa ste /
translated: They are also the causes of the virtues and faults of others that are beyond the senses.

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dag las shin tu 'das pa de bas na mngon sum gyis yongs su gcad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dag las shin tu 'das pa de bas na mngon sum gyis yongs su gcad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is beyond the sense faculties such as the eyes, it is not an object to be discerned by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur na yang rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur na yang rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were to be inferred, it would not be by the logical mark of essential nature.

original: rang bzhin nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the essential nature itself is what is to be proven.

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pas rang ste yon tan dang skyon gyi rang bzhin las byung zhing skyes pa'i lus dang ngag gi las gang la yod pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags des rjes su dpag par bya ba dag yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pas rang ste yon tan dang skyon gyi rang bzhin las byung zhing skyes pa'i lus dang ngag gi las gang la yod pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags des rjes su dpag par bya ba dag yin na /
translated: However, if it were to be inferred by the logical mark of effect, which arises from the nature of good qualities and faults, then it would exist in the actions of body and speech that possess that effect.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that also does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir lus dang ngag gi mtshan nyid can gyi tha snyad kyang phal cher mang du blo sngon du gtong ba zhes bya ba so sor brtags pa bsam pa las rnam pa gzhan du yang bya bar nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus dang ngag gi mtshan nyid can gyi tha snyad kyang phal cher mang du blo sngon du gtong ba zhes bya ba so sor brtags pa bsam pa las rnam pa gzhan du yang bya bar nus te /
translated: Because the conventional characteristics of body and speech can also be performed in a different manner, by the mind that is predominantly directed towards the intention of thorough examination, which is called preceded by the mind.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin du bdag nyid ston par byed cing 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa bzhin du ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin du bdag nyid ston par byed cing 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa bzhin du ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, he shows himself as if he were free from passion, even though he is not free from passion; and he shows himself as if he were full of passion, even though he is free from passion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tha snyad dag ni skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad dag ni skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conventions are set in motion by the will of persons.

original: gang la skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “those that are set in motion by the will of persons” should be supplied in each case.

original: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa can yin pa de ltar na yang ci'i phyir rnam pa gzhan byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa can yin pa de ltar na yang ci'i phyir rnam pa gzhan byed ce na /
translated: Even if conventions are set in motion by the will of persons, why does he act in a way that is contrary to those conventions?

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Even those persons . . .

original: skyes bu gang dag la tha snyad 'dogs par 'jug pa can yin pa de dag kyang bsam pa sna tshogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: skyes bu gang dag la tha snyad 'dogs par 'jug pa can yin pa de dag kyang bsam pa sna tshogs pa nyid de /
translated: Those persons who set conventions in motion have various intentions,

original: 'dod pa tha dad pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa tha dad pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have different desires.

original: de bas na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du tha snyad la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du tha snyad la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since one engages in conventional expressions as one wishes,

original: yon tan dang skyon las byung ba'i tha snyad dag ni tha dad pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon las byung ba'i tha snyad dag ni tha dad pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no certainty that conventional expressions arise from virtues and faults.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i skyes bu 'di ni gtan tshigs 'chol pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i skyes bu 'di ni gtan tshigs 'chol pa ste /
translated: This person who is a proponent of inference is confused about the reason.

original: gtan tshigs 'khrul pa'i phyir skyes bu nyes pa zad pa nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'khrul pa'i phyir skyes bu nyes pa zad pa nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because the reason is confused, there is no certainty that the person has exhausted faults.

original: ji ltar lung byed pa po'i rtogs par 'gyur te ma @249a * //
analyzed: ji ltar lung byed pa po'i rtogs par 'gyur te ma @249a * //
translated: How could one understand the one who makes the scriptures?🔽No one could understand him.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.🔽It is not because of not wanting to, because such a person is accepted as one who teaches without error.

original: mi 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin te de 'dra ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa ma lus pa zad par 'dod pa zhes bya ba de khas blangs nas srid pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i sgo nas
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin te de 'dra ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa ma lus pa zad par 'dod pa zhes bya ba de khas blangs nas srid pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i sgo nas
translated: Having accepted that, the treatise is composed in order to teach the measure of existence through the door of the three valid means of knowledge.

original: de bsgrub par 'dod pa'i phyogs snga ma ci ste gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'god par byed do //
analyzed: de bsgrub par 'dod pa'i phyogs snga ma ci ste gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'god par byed do //
translated: The opponent who wishes to establish that [the person exists] is set forth by the words “what?” and so on.

original: gang nyes pa med pa ni nyes pa dang bral pa ste //
analyzed: gang nyes pa med pa ni nyes pa dang bral pa ste //
translated: The one who is without fault is free from fault.

original: de 'dra ba'i skyes bu yod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i skyes bu yod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is there not such a person?

original: yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is, he says, “diminution” and so on.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du 'gyur ba na 'grib pa ste ma bsags pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du ma gyur pa na phul du byung ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du 'gyur ba na 'grib pa ste ma bsags pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du ma gyur pa na phul du byung ste /
translated: When the antidote is manifest, there is diminution, that is, no accumulation; and when the antidote is not manifest, there is abundance, that is, accumulation.

original: nye bar bsags pa bstan pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba bsten pa dag go //
analyzed: nye bar bsags pa bstan pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba bsten pa dag go //
translated: Those things such as attachment that are taught to be relied upon are diminution and abundance.

original: de dag kun mi mthun phyogs dang bcas pa nyid phyir te /
analyzed: de dag kun mi mthun phyogs dang bcas pa nyid phyir te /
translated: They are all accompanied by their opposites.

original: gang gi mngon sum du gyur pa dang mi 'gyur ba 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba brten pa de dag de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs te gnod pa can yin no //
analyzed: gang gi mngon sum du gyur pa dang mi 'gyur ba 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba brten pa de dag de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs te gnod pa can yin no //
translated: That which is directly perceived and not perceived, and that which is diminished and enhanced, is the counteragent to that, i.e., is the counteragent to the latter.

original: de dang bcas pas 'jug pas na mi mthun phyogs dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de dang bcas pas 'jug pas na mi mthun phyogs dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is associated with the counteragent because it engages in the counteragent.

original: de'i dngos po yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the state of that because it is that.

original: gnod pa can dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: gnod pa can dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is: because it is associated with the counteragent.🔽By what is the counteragent associated? By the counteragents to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.

original: / gnod pa byed pa can gang gis nyes pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa nyid kyis gnod pa can de goms pa yang dang yang du rgyun mi 'chad par skyes pa las bdag gyur pas te /
analyzed: / gnod pa byed pa can gang gis nyes pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa nyid kyis gnod pa can de goms pa yang dang yang du rgyun mi 'chad par skyes pa las bdag gyur pas te /
translated: The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.

original: der 'dod cing de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid de gnod pa can gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: der 'dod cing de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid de gnod pa can gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i phyir /
translated: The state of the counteragent is the state of the counteragent to the faults.🔽The state

original: nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyud la lar zag pa 'dod chags la sogs pa zad cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyud la lar zag pa 'dod chags la sogs pa zad cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In some scriptures, the self-nature of the antidote to faults is such that defilements, such as attachment, are exhausted and destroyed.

original: nyes pa thams cad kyi gnod pa can ni /
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad kyi gnod pa can ni /
translated: The one who is harmed by all faults🔽is the one who has the knowledge of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i shes pa yin no zhes le'u gnyis pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i shes pa yin no zhes le'u gnyis pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is taught in Chapter Two.

original: de bas na de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu ni 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu ni 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, such a person is not the one who is meant here.

original: skyes bu ston pa po zag pa zad pa de yang shes par dka' ba yin no zhes de tsam zhig smra'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ston pa po zag pa zad pa de yang shes par dka' ba yin no zhes de tsam zhig smra'o //
translated: The one who teaches the person, the one whose defilements are exhausted, is also difficult to know.🔽This is all that is said.

original: nyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verses beginning with “faults” is taught.

original: nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Faults are attachment and so on.

original: ci lta bur gyur ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci lta bur gyur ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind are they?

original: 'grib pa dang phul du @249b byung ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: 'grib pa dang phul du @249b byung ba'i chos can te /
translated: They are the ones that decrease and increase.

original: khyad par du byed pa dang mi byed pa'i rang bzhin can du yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa khyad par du byed pa dang mi byed pa ste //
analyzed: khyad par du byed pa dang mi byed pa'i rang bzhin can du yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa khyad par du byed pa dang mi byed pa ste //
translated: It is the nature of some to be especially active or inactive, and it is the nature of others to be especially active or inactive in overcoming resistance.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis byas pa'i zil gyis non cing gsal ba gang yin pa de'i khyad par du byed pa dang mi byed pa sgrub par byed cing go bar byed do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis byas pa'i zil gyis non cing gsal ba gang yin pa de'i khyad par du byed pa dang mi byed pa sgrub par byed cing go bar byed do //
translated: That which is especially active or inactive in overcoming resistance is established and understood as being especially active or inactive in overcoming resistance that is created by resistance.

original: 'grib pa'i chos can gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par du byed pa sgrub par byed cing gnod pa can gyis zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par du byed pas nyes pa dag 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grib pa'i chos can gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par du byed pa sgrub par byed cing gnod pa can gyis zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par du byed pas nyes pa dag 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the nature of decline is established as being especially active in overcoming resistance, because it is overcome by resistance. That which is the nature of injury is established as being especially active in overcoming resistance, because it is overcome by injury.

original: phul du byung ba'i chos can gyis zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par du byed pa sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i chos can gyis zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par du byed pa sgrub par byed de /
translated: That which is the nature of excellence is established as being especially active in overcoming resistance,

original: gnod pa can gyis zil gyis gnon pa smos pas de dag phul du byung ba'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyis zil gyis gnon pa smos pas de dag phul du byung ba'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said to be overcome by injury, and because it is the nature of excellence.

original: me la sogs pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words “like fire, etc.” include cold and warm touch, etc.

original: dper na me la sogs pa dag ni chu la sogs pa gnod pa can khyad par du gyur pa dang / khyad par du gyur pa med pa yod na 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos can dag gis go rims bzhin du chu la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pas khyad par du gyur pa dang khyad par du gyur pa med pa sgrub par byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na me la sogs pa dag ni chu la sogs pa gnod pa can khyad par du gyur pa dang / khyad par du gyur pa med pa yod na 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos can dag gis go rims bzhin du chu la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pas khyad par du gyur pa dang khyad par du gyur pa med pa sgrub par byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as fire, etc., when there is water, etc., that is adverse, either transformed or not transformed, are subject to increase and decrease, and, respectively, establish the transformed and the not transformed by way of their predominance, so also is it with attachment, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa yin la ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa yin la ;
translated: Attachment, etc., are dependent on external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po yang dpyad par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po yang dpyad par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is not external reality incapable of being analyzed?

original: bcad par mi nus pa de'i phyir nyes pa dag bcas par mi nus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcad par mi nus pa de'i phyir nyes pa dag bcas par mi nus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Since it is incapable of being divided, the faults are incapable of being refuted.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni zhes bya ba smos pa la ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni zhes bya ba smos pa la ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: Therefore, he says, “because of that,” and the word “ni” has the meaning of “hi.”

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ba can dag ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ba can dag ste /
translated: Those attachments, etc. are born from conceptualization.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa de dag la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa de dag la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: They are born from conceptualization which has the characteristic of improper mental attention.

original: 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi don yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi don yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, if external objects exist without improper mental attention, attachment, etc. would not arise.

original: de sngon du bya ba yod na don med par yang skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: de sngon du bya ba yod na don med par yang skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: And if that is done previously, they would arise without an object. Therefore,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ba can yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ba can yin no //
translated: because of following and reversing, attachment, etc. are born from conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtogs pa las byung ba de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa nye bar len pa yod na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtogs pa las byung ba de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa nye bar len pa yod na yang /
translated: Because it arises from conceptualization, therefore, even when the appropriation having the characteristics as previously explained exists,

original: bdag med par @250a * //
analyzed: bdag med par @250a * //
translated: there is no self.

original: ston pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yad kyi yon tan 'ga' zhig goms pa la nang gi nye bar len pa la gus pa med par khyad par du gyur pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yad kyi yon tan 'ga' zhig goms pa la nang gi nye bar len pa la gus pa med par khyad par du gyur pa med pa ste /
translated: When one is habituated to the qualities of the teacher having the characteristics of the absence of self, there is no distinction without respect to the internal appropriation.

original: 'phel ba med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phel ba med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no increase. This is the meaning.

original: de skad du re zhig 'di ltar gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad du re zhig 'di ltar gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, since the antidote is not very clear,

original: nyes pa'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad du gcad pa med pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad du gcad pa med pa de lta na yang /
translated: the cause of the fault is not completely eliminated.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs goms pas nus pa nyams par byas pa cang yi nye bar len pa las khyad par du gyur pa med par byed de nyung zhing ches nyung bar 'gyur ro 'dis ni gtan tshigs bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs goms pas nus pa nyams par byas pa cang yi nye bar len pa las khyad par du gyur pa med par byed de nyung zhing ches nyung bar 'gyur ro 'dis ni gtan tshigs bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, through habituation to the antidote, the power of the appropriation is diminished, and the fault becomes less and less. This explains the reason.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa yin gyi yon tan bsgoms pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa la gnas pas gsal por gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa yin gyi yon tan bsgoms pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa la gnas pas gsal por gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the cultivation of the virtues is perfected, then they are clear.

original: de gsal ba na ste /
analyzed: de gsal ba na ste /
translated: When they are clear,

original: yid kyi yon tan gsal ba na yod na'o //
analyzed: yid kyi yon tan gsal ba na yod na'o //
translated: when the mental virtues are clear, then they exist.

original: 'di rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon te /
translated: The seed of the defilements is the universal.

original: 'di las nyes pa dag skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las nyes pa dag skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the faults arise from this, it is called the universal.

original: 'jig pa gang la rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa gang la rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi 'jig pa'o //
translated: That destruction which does not have a universal is destruction without a universal.

original: nyes pa gang dag la chos de yod pa de dag ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi 'jig pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: nyes pa gang dag la chos de yod pa de dag ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi 'jig pa'i chos can te /
translated: Those faults which have that dharma are those which have destruction without a universal.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they have destruction with residual impressions.

original: me la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: They are like fire, etc.

original: dper na me la sogs pa ni chu la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu khyad par gyur pa yod na /
analyzed: dper na me la sogs pa ni chu la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu khyad par gyur pa yod na /
translated: For example, fire, etc. are very perishable when there is a very different opposing factor, such as water, etc.

original: shin tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shin tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang nye ba las khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i chos can de dag ni de shin tu 'phel bar gyur pa na de dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi 'jig pa'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang nye ba las khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i chos can de dag ni de shin tu 'phel bar gyur pa na de dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi 'jig pa'i chos can yin te /
translated: And the application is this: those things that are not characterized by a difference from whatever is near, when they increase very much, they are characterized by destruction without a subsequent cause, because they overcome that.

original: dper na me la sogs pa ni chu la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa 'phel ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me la sogs pa ni chu la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa 'phel ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire, etc. overcome water, etc. when they increase.

original: nyes pa dag kyang bdag med pa mthong ba nye ba las kyang nyes pa khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nyes pa dag kyang bdag med pa mthong ba nye ba las kyang nyes pa khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the faults are also not characterized by a difference from the nearness of the vision of selflessness. This is a natural inference.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa rgyu de bas na nyes pa cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa rgyu de bas na nyes pa cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because that is so, therefore there is not the slightest fault.

original: nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The other, “without fault,” and so on.

original: nyes pa med pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no one who is without fault.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says, “because,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni @250b rnam par dbye ba ltar bcos pa'i tshig gi phrad yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni @250b rnam par dbye ba ltar bcos pa'i tshig gi phrad yin te /
translated: “ Because” is a particle that indicates a division.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni don 'di la 'jug go //🔽nyes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni don 'di la 'jug go // nyes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ For what reason” has the same meaning.🔽“ The arising of the adverse condition that is the nature of a fault” is like the arising of a fault.

original: ji ltar thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir skyes bu nyes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir skyes bu nyes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba ste /
translated: Just as a person, because of being habituated from beginningless time, has the arising of the adverse condition that is the nature of a fault,

original: bdag med par mthong ba skye ba de bzhin du nyes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yod na yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin te byed pa'i rgyu thag nye ba ji lta ba bzhin du nyes pa yang 'byung ba yin no//
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba skye ba de bzhin du nyes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yod na yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin te byed pa'i rgyu thag nye ba ji lta ba bzhin du nyes pa yang 'byung ba yin no//
translated: Just as the arising of the vision of selflessness is like that, so too, when the self that is the opposite of the faults exists, the faults arise just as the proximate causes are.

original: ji ltar nyes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la yang lam gyis gnod par 'gyur ba de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar nyes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la yang lam gyis gnod par 'gyur ba de ltar /
translated: Just as the path harms the self that is the opposite of the faults,

original: nyes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs la nyes pa gnod par gyur te gnyis ka 'gal bar 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro /🔽// / bam po nyid shu rtsa bzhi pa /
analyzed: nyes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs la nyes pa gnod par gyur te gnyis ka 'gal bar 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro / // / bam po nyid shu rtsa bzhi pa /
translated: so too the faults harm the side that is the antidote to the faults, because both are similar in being mutually exclusive.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: 'tshe ba med pa ni 'khor ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa ni 'khor ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonviolence is because it is free from all the harms of samsara.

original: 'di la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi yul yang dag pa 'di phyin ci ma log pas na yang dag pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'di la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi yul yang dag pa 'di phyin ci ma log pas na yang dag pa'i don no //
translated: Here, the object of the reality of the characteristics of impermanence, etc., is the correct object, because it is unmistaken.

original: yang dag pa'i don smos pa yang lam gyi sems kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don smos pa yang lam gyi sems kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The mention of the correct object is the nature of the mind of the path.

original: yang dag pa'i don smos pa ni sems kyi don yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don smos pa ni sems kyi don yin te /
translated: The mention of the correct object is the object of the mind.

original: de la sgro btags pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa de ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sgro btags pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa de ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The engagement by the aspect of superimposition on that is error.

original: de yang sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir nyes pa ni glo bur ba rab dag yin te /
analyzed: de yang sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir nyes pa ni glo bur ba rab dag yin te /
translated: And that is not the nature of the mind. Therefore, the faults are adventitious.

original: sgro btags pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the engagement by the aspect of superimposition.

original: re zhig goms par ma byas pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs la yang lam gyi sems ni tshad ma'i grogs nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin nyid du rigs na ci goms par byas pa'i lam la yang ma yin /
analyzed: re zhig goms par ma byas pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs la yang lam gyi sems ni tshad ma'i grogs nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin nyid du rigs na ci goms par byas pa'i lam la yang ma yin /
translated: The mind of the path is reasonable as the nature of the path even in the state of not being cultivated, because it is the companion of valid knowledge. But is it not so when the path is cultivated?

original: de yang le'u gnyis pa las /
analyzed: de yang le'u gnyis pa las /
translated: And that is stated in the second chapter:

original: sems 'di ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: sems 'di ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: This mind is by nature

original: 'od gsal dri ma glo bur ba //
analyzed: 'od gsal dri ma glo bur ba //
translated: The stains of clear light are adventitious.

original: de yi rang bzhin thog ma nas //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin thog ma nas //
translated: Its nature is primordially

original: nus med pa'ang phyis nus med //
analyzed: nus med pa'ang phyis nus med //
translated: without potency, and later it is without potency.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is made clear by such statements.

original: 'tshe ba med par yang de yin la yang dag pa'i don sems la /
analyzed: 'tshe ba med par yang de yin la yang dag pa'i don sems la /
translated: It is non-violence, and it is the mind of the meaning of reality.

original: de lta bur gyur ba yang de yin la /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba yang de yin la /
translated: It is such, and it is the nature.

original: rang bzhin yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'i snying po can gyi las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //🔽nye bar 'tshe ba med pa yang dag pa'i don sems kyi rang bzhin nyes pa'i gnyen por gyur ba ni yang dag pa'i don nyid du goms pa'i phyir dang bdag @251a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'i snying po can gyi las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o // nye bar 'tshe ba med pa yang dag pa'i don sems kyi rang bzhin nyes pa'i gnyen por gyur ba ni yang dag pa'i don nyid du goms pa'i phyir dang bdag @251a * //
translated: Thus it is the summary of the holding of karma, which has the essence of the holding of karma.🔽Non-violence is the nature of the mind of the meaning of reality, which is the antidote to faults, because of the cultivation of the meaning of reality itself and because of the attainment of the state of self.

original: nyid du gyur pa thob pa'i phyir phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: nyid du gyur pa thob pa'i phyir phyin ci log ste /
translated: It is the antidote to the error of the inverted mind.

original: ji skad du bshad pa gsum pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba rnam par 'tshe ba dang yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa dang rang bzhin ma yin pa'i nyes pa dag gis mi ldog ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa gsum pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba rnam par 'tshe ba dang yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa dang rang bzhin ma yin pa'i nyes pa dag gis mi ldog ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: The faults of violence, non-reality, and non-nature, which are the opposite of the characteristics of the third as explained, are not averted.

original: lam goms par gyur pa zil gyis mnan pas nyes pa dag mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam goms par gyur pa zil gyis mnan pas nyes pa dag mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: The faults do not occur because the path is cultivated and mastered.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bad du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bad du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Even though one strives,” etc.

original: de ni lam goms par gyur pa can la nyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir rtsol ba nyid yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lam goms par gyur pa can la nyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir rtsol ba nyid yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since the faults are not generated in one who has cultivated the path, there is no striving itself. Even so, it is to be stated by way of acceptance.

original: nyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'bad du zin kyang /
analyzed: nyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'bad du zin kyang /
translated: Even though one strives to generate the faults,

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: the mind does not grasp that side.

original: nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa yon tan dang ldan pa bdag med pa'i lam de'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa yon tan dang ldan pa bdag med pa'i lam de'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the mind does not grasp the side of that path of selflessness which possesses the qualities that are the antidote to the faults.

original: nyes pa bskyed pa'i rtsol ba bzlog nas yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kho na la 'bad rtsol byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes pa bskyed pa'i rtsol ba bzlog nas yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kho na la 'bad rtsol byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because one has turned away from the effort that produces faults and one makes an effort only in the antidote side, which is the side of good qualities.

original: re zhig dang por rang bzhin 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: re zhig dang por rang bzhin 'chad par byed de /
translated: First of all, he explains the nature:

original: rang bzhin te bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni skyes bu'i gnyen po'i phyogs la gnas pa'i 'bad rtsol med par zlog par byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin te bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni skyes bu'i gnyen po'i phyogs la gnas pa'i 'bad rtsol med par zlog par byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature, which is the characteristic of selflessness, cannot be turned away without effort on the side of the antidote of the person.

original: gtsang sbra can thod pa can la 'dod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsang sbra can thod pa can la 'dod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like desire for one who has become pure and then becomes impure.

original: dper na gtsang spra can du gyur nas thod pa can du gyur pa gang yin pa de'i gtsang sbra can gyi gnas skabs las 'dod pa gang yin pa de la 'bad rtsol med par ldog mi nus pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gtsang spra can du gyur nas thod pa can du gyur pa gang yin pa de'i gtsang sbra can gyi gnas skabs las 'dod pa gang yin pa de la 'bad rtsol med par ldog mi nus pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like this: for one who has become pure and then becomes impure, the desire for the state of purity cannot be turned away without effort.

original: lam gyi rang bzhin bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol byed pa na yang thob pa'i rang bzhin yon tan thob pa dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin skyon mthong bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol byed pa na yang thob pa'i rang bzhin yon tan thob pa dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin skyon mthong bar byas pa yin no //
translated: When one strives to reverse the nature of the path, one sees the attainment of the nature of virtue and the reversal of the nature of faults.

original: skyon mthong ba de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: skyon mthong ba de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa ste /
translated: That seeing of faults is not in the nature of the adverse side.

original: skyon gyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi goms pa can gyi skyes bu'i nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon gyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi goms pa can gyi skyes bu'i nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not in the nature of the adverse side of the faults of a person who is accustomed to the side that is the antidote to the faults.

original: de bzhin du yon tan mthong ba de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs goms pa can gyi skyon dag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan mthong ba de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs goms pa can gyi skyon dag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, that seeing of virtues is not in the faults of one who is accustomed to the adverse side.

original: ci'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs la yang nyes pa mthong ba yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs la yang nyes pa mthong ba yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the seeing of faults does not exist even in the side that is the antidote?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, Because...

original: gnyen po'i phyogs de ni nye bar 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs de ni nye bar 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That side that is the antidote is itself free from harm.

original: gang la rnam par 'tshe ba rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir lam ni rnam par 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang la rnam par 'tshe ba rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir lam ni rnam par 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The path is non-violence because it is free from the three kinds of violence.

original: 'di ltar sems rnam par 'ching ba'i rgyu ni nyes pa'i rnam par 'tshe ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems rnam par 'ching ba'i rgyu ni nyes pa'i rnam par 'tshe ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the cause of the bondage of the mind is the violence of evil.

original: gang gis @251b sems rnam par bcings pa na yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la mi 'jug pa dang / lus dang sems kyi gdung ba'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i rnam par 'tshe ba dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba rab tu zhi ba nyid ma yin pas de'i nye bar longs spyod pa na ro myong ba nyid kyis skyo ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis @251b sems rnam par bcings pa na yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la mi 'jug pa dang / lus dang sems kyi gdung ba'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i rnam par 'tshe ba dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba rab tu zhi ba nyid ma yin pas de'i nye bar longs spyod pa na ro myong ba nyid kyis skyo ba'o //
translated: When the mind is bound, it does not engage in seeing the truth. The cause of the torment of body and mind is the violence of suffering and mental dissatisfaction. Since the enjoyment of that which is accompanied by the outflows is not true peace, one becomes weary of it through the experience of its taste.
